tissues O O
. O O

Vertebrate O O

- O O

to O O

) O O

In O O

Here O O

that O O

of O O

tissue O O

of O O

mediated O O

INTRODUCTION O O

Alternative O O
splicing O O
of O O
pre O O
- O O
mRNA O O
is O O
one O O
of O O
the O O
fundamental O O
mechanisms O O
for O O
the O O
regulation O O
of O O
gene O O
expression O O
in O O
higher O O
eukaryotes O O
( O O
1 O O
, O O
2 O O
) O O
. O O

Developmentally O O
regulated O O
, O O
cell O O
type O O
- O O
or O O
tissue O O
- O O
specific O O
, O O
and O O
signal O O
- O O
induced O O
alternative O O
splicing O O
of O O
pre O O
- O O
mRNAs O O
takes O O
place O O
in O O
multicellular O O
organisms O O
throughout O O
their O O
lifetimes O O
. O O

Misregulation O O
or O O
abnormalities O O
in O O
pre O O
- O O
mRNA O O
splicing O O
, O O
in O O
some O O
instances O O
, O O
leads O O
to O O
cellular O O
dysfunctions O O
found O O
in O O
human B B_PERSON/B_SPECIES[BIO]
and O O
animal O O
diseases O O
( O O
3 O O
- O O
5 O O
) O O
. O O

Using O O
various O O
model O O
systems O O
of O O
regulated O O
alternative O O
splicing O O
, O O
a O O
number O O
of O O
pre O O
- O O
mRNA O O
features O O
that O O
influence O O
alternative O O
splice O O
site O O
selection O O
have O O
been O O
defined O O
( O O
1 O O
, O O
2 O O
) O O
. O O

These O O
include O O
enhancer O O
and O O
repressor O O
RNA O O
sequences O O
located O O
in O O
exons O O
and O O
introns O O
. O O

Identification O O
of O O
RNA O O
- O O
binding O O
proteins O O
targeting O O
these O O
cis O O
- O O
regulatory O O
elements O O
is O O
currently O O
in O O
progress O O
. O O

In O O
vertebrates O O
, O O
participation O O
of O O
the O O
SR O O
family O O
proteins O O
and O O
hnRNP O O
proteins O O
, O O
such O O
as O O
PTB O O
and O O
hnRNPA1 O O
, O O
in O O
alternative O O
splicing O O
regulation O O
via O O
binding O O
to O O
the O O
cis O O
- O O
regulatory O O
elements O O
have O O
been O O
shown O O
in O O
many O O
tissue O O
- O O
specific O O
splicing O O
models O O
( O O
6 O O
, O O
7 O O
) O O
. O O

Although O O
these O O
RNA O O
- O O
binding O O
proteins O O
are O O
ubiquitously O O
expressed O O
, O O
their O O
different O O
abundance O O
in O O
different O O
cells O O
, O O
differences O O
in O O
their O O
post O O
- O O
translational O O
modifications O O
in O O
different O O
cellular O O
contexts O O
and O O
their O O
different O O
abilities O O
to O O
assemble O O
multiprotein O O
complexes O O
in O O
different O O
pre O O
- O O
mRNA O O
contexts O O
are O O
thought O O
to O O
contribute O O
to O O
the O O
determination O O
of O O
cell O O
type O O
- O O
specific O O
patterns O O
of O O
alternative O O
splicing O O
. O O

For O O
the O O
last O O
few O O
years O O
, O O
tissue O O
- O O
specific O O
and O O
tissue O O
- O O
enriched O O
RNA O O
- O O
binding O O
proteins O O
have O O
begun O O
to O O
be O O
identified O O
as O O
splicing O O
regulators O O
. O O

These O O
include O O
brain O O
- O O
specific O O
( O O
or O O
enriched O O
) O O
Nova O O
- O O
1 O O
, O O
nPTB O O
( O O

) O O
and O O
some O O
of O O
the O O

Discovery O O
of O O

has O O
had O O
a O O

impact O O
on O O

aimed O O
at O O

of O O

splicing O O

One O O
of O O
the O O
intronic O O

- O O
elements O O

which O O
are O O
involved O O
in O O
tissue O O

or O O

stage O O
- O O

of O O

The O O

of O O

in O O

and O O

Since O O

a O O

of O O

of O O

RESULTS O O

Tissue O O
- O O
dependent O O
isoforms O O
of O O
Fxh O O
and O O
A2BP1 O O
and O O
their O O
subcellular O O
distribution O O

The O O
A2BP1 O O
mRNAs O O
are O O
detected O O
almost O O
exclusively O O
in O O
brain O O
and O O
striated O O
muscles O O
( O O
heart O O
and O O
skeletal O O
muscles O O
) O O
in O O
adult O O
mice B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_DRUG[THERAPEUTIC_OR_PREVENTIVE_PROCEDURE]
, O O
whereas O O
the O O
Fxh O O
mRNAs O O
are O O
expressed O O
in O O
a O O
wide O O
variety O O
of O O
tissues O O
with O O
the O O
highest O O
expression O O
in O O
brain O O
and O O
heart O O
[ O O
( O O
21 O O
, O O
25 O O
) O O
and O O
S O O
. O O
Kawamoto O O
, O O
unpublished O O
data O O
] O O
. O O

These O O
expression O O
profiles O O
prompted O O
us O O
to O O
characterize O O
the O O
mRNAs O O
of O O
A2BP1 O O
and O O
Fxh O O
in O O
brain O O
and O O
muscles O O
. O O

We O O
have O O
cloned O O
cDNAs O O
for O O
two O O
gene O O
transcripts O O
from O O
brain O O
, O O
heart O O
and O O
skeletal O O
muscles O O
by O O
RT O O
- O O
PCR O O
and O O
5 O O
' O O
RACE O O
. O O

The O O
isolated O O
cDNAs O O
are O O
schematically O O
presented O O
with O O
genomic O O
structures O O
in O O
Figure O O
1 O O
( O O
for O O
amino O O
acid O O
sequences O O
see O O
also O O
Figure O O
8 O O
) O O
. O O

Both O O
gene O O
transcripts O O
are O O
found O O
to O O
undergo O O
tissue O O
- O O
specific O O
alternative O O
splicing O O
. O O

In O O
both O O
cases O O
, O O
brain O O
and O O
striated O O
muscles O O
express O O
unique O O
splice O O
variants O O
generated O O
by O O
mutually O O
exclusive O O
splicing O O
of O O
exons O O
B40 O O
and O O
M43 O O
, O O
respectively O O
, O O
which O O
provide O O
different O O
coding O O
sequences O O
in O O
the O O
middle O O
of O O
the O O
carboxyl O O
half O O
of O O
the O O
molecules O O
. O O

Southern O O
blot O O
analysis O O
of O O
the O O
RT O O
- O O
PCR O O
products O O
of O O
the O O
Fxh O O
mRNAs O O
from O O
the O O
different O O
tissues O O
probed O O
by O O
oligonucleotides O O
corresponding O O
to O O
B40 O O
and O O
M43 O O
shows O O
that O O
M43 O O
is O O
exclusively O O
used O O
in O O
heart O O
and O O
skeletal O O
muscles O O
, O O
while O O
B40 O O
is O O
predominantly O O
used O O
in O O
brain O O
( O O
Figure O O
2A O O
) O O
. O O

Digestion O O
of O O
the O O
RT O O
- O O
PCR O O
products O O
of O O
the O O
A2BP1 O O
mRNAs O O
with O O
restriction O O
enzymes O O
unique O O
to O O
B40 O O
and O O
M43 O O
demonstrates O O
that O O
B40 O O
and O O
M43 O O
are O O
used O O
almost O O
exclusively O O
in O O
brain O O
and O O
muscles O O
, O O
respectively O O
( O O
Figure O O
2B O O
) O O
. O O

A2BP1 O O
contains O O
an O O
additional O O
cassette O O
type O O
alternative O O
exon O O
A53 O O
, O O
consisting O O
of O O
53 O O
nt O O
. O O

Inclusion O O
and O O
exclusion O O
of O O
exon O O
A53 O O
results O O
in O O
two O O
different O O
amino O O
acid O O
sequences O O
at O O
the O O
C O O
- O O
terminal O O
region O O
owing O O
to O O
a O O
frame O O
shift O O
. O O

In O O
the O O
case O O
of O O
the O O
A2BP1 O O
gene O O
, O O
moreover O O
, O O
it O O
appears O O
that O O
brain O O
and O O
striated O O
muscle O O
utilize O O
alternative O O
promoters O O
, O O
resulting O O
in O O
different O O
amino O O
acid O O
sequences O O
at O O
the O O
N O O
- O O
terminus O O
. O O

The O O
5 O O
' O O
RACE O O
of O O
skeletal O O
muscle O O
mRNAs O O
yielded O O
essentially O O
a O O
single O O
species O O
of O O
sequence O O
with O O
29 O O
unique O O
N O O
- O O
terminal O O
amino O O
acids O O
. O O

The O O
5 O O
' O O
RACE O O
using O O
brain O O
mRNAs O O
; O O
however O O
, O O
yielded O O
multiple O O
products O O
with O O
multiple O O
deduced O O
amino O O
acid O O
sequences O O
, O O
all O O
of O O
which O O
differ O O
from O O
the O O
muscle O O
amino O O
acid O O
sequence O O
at O O
the O O
very O O
N O O
- O O
terminus O O
. O O

Here O O
, O O
we O O
focus O O
our O O
analysis O O
on O O
a O O
clone O O
containing O O
nine O O
unique O O
amino O O
acids O O
at O O
the O O
N O O
- O O
terminus O O
, O O
which O O
was O O
obtained O O
most O O
frequently O O
. O O

Exon O O
- O O
intron O O
organization O O
of O O
Fxh O O
and O O
A2BP1 O O
shows O O
remarkable O O
similarities O O
and O O
a O O
RRM O O
is O O
encoded O O
in O O
four O O
exons O O
( O O
Figure O O
1B O O
) O O
. O O

Of O O
note O O
is O O
that O O
the O O
significant O O
amounts O O
of O O
Fxh O O
and O O
A2BP1 O O
mRNAs O O
from O O
skeletal O O
muscles O O
are O O
missing O O
a O O
part O O
of O O
the O O
RRM O O
by O O
exon O O
skipping O O
. O O

Typically O O
, O O
as O O
shown O O
in O O
Figure O O
2C O O
, O O
they O O
lack O O
the O O
93 O O
nt O O
exon O O
that O O
encodes O O
RNP1 O O
, O O
one O O
of O O
the O O
two O O
most O O
critical O O
motifs O O
of O O
the O O
RRM O O
( O O
30 O O
) O O
. O O

Some O O
of O O
them O O
lack O O
almost O O
the O O
entire O O
RRM O O
( O O
e O O
. O O
g O O
. O O
F402 O O
in O O
Figure O O
1A O O
) O O
. O O

To O O
examine O O
the O O
subcellular O O
distribution O O
of O O
each O O
isoform O O
of O O
Fxh O O
and O O
A2BP1 O O
, O O
myc O O
- O O
tagged O O
proteins O O
were O O
transiently O O
expressed O O
in O O
cultured O O
cells O O
and O O
immunostained O O
with O O
an O O
anti O O
- O O
myc O O
antibody O O

DISCUSSION O O

Two O O
major O O
findings O O
are O O
described O O
in O O
this O O
report O O
. O O

First O O
, O O
Fxh O O
and O O
A2BP1 O O
facilitate O O
neural O O
cell O O
- O O
specific O O
inclusion O O
of O O
the O O
cassette O O
- O O
type O O
exon O O
via O O
binding O O
to O O
the O O
specific O O
intronic O O
sequence O O
UGCAUG O O
. O O

In O O
addition O O
to O O
a O O
minigene O O
model O O
system O O
, O O
Fxh O O
and O O
A2BP1 O O
are O O
capable O O
of O O
facilitating O O
N30 O O

. O O

This O O
isoform O O
is O O
incapable O O
of O O
activating O O
N30 O O
splicing O O
and O O
, O O
moreover O O
, O O
can O O
inhibit O O
N30 O O
inclusion O O
. O O

The O O
properties O O
of O O
these O O
isoforms O O
are O O
consistent O O
with O O
Fxh O O
and O O
A2BP1 O O
acting O O
as O O
regulators O O
for O O
N30 O O
splicing O O
, O O
since O O
N30 O O
is O O
included O O
in O O
neuronal O O
cells O O
, O O
but O O
excluded O O
in O O
muscles O O
. O O

Therefore O O
, O O
despite O O
the O O
tissue O O
- O O
independent O O
occurrence O O
of O O
UGCAUG O O
as O O
a O O
regulatory O O
element O O
, O O
given O O
the O O
tissue O O
- O O
dependent O O
isoforms O O
of O O
the O O
UGCAUG O O
- O O
binding O O
proteins O O
( O O
Fxh O O
and O O
A2BP1 O O
) O O
with O O
different O O
activities O O
, O O
the O O
hexanucleotide O O
UGCAUG O O
could O O
confer O O
tissue O O
specificity O O
on O O
regulated O O
splicing O O
. O O

One O O
of O O
the O O
major O O
problems O O
in O O
understanding O O
the O O
mechanisms O O
responsible O O
for O O
alternative O O
pre O O
- O O
mRNA O O
splicing O O
is O O
the O O
manner O O
in O O
which O O
tissue O O
specificity O O
is O O
determined O O
. O O

In O O
vertebrates O O
, O O
to O O
date O O
, O O
only O O
a O O
few O O
tissue O O
- O O
specific O O
proteins O O
have O O
been O O
identified O O
as O O
splicing O O
regulators O O
( O O
8 O O
- O O
12 O O
) O O
. O O

Here O O
, O O
we O O
have O O
shown O O
that O O
the O O
tissue O O
- O O
dependent O O
isoforms O O
of O O
the O O
sequence O O
- O O
specific O O
RNA O O
- O O
binding O O
proteins O O
, O O
which O O
themselves O O
are O O
generated O O
by O O
alternative O O
splicing O O
, O O
have O O
different O O
activities O O
in O O
tissue O O
- O O
specific O O
alternative O O
splicing O O
of O O
target O O
pre O O
- O O
mRNA O O
. O O

Therefore O O
, O O
these O O
isoforms O O
play O O
a O O
role O O
in O O
the O O
determination O O
of O O
tissue O O
specificity O O
of O O
target O O
pre O O
- O O
mRNA O O
splicing O O
. O O

The O O
discovery O O
of O O
these O O
tissue O O
- O O
dependent O O
isoforms O O
of O O
the O O
UGCAUG O O
- O O
binding O O
proteins O O
with O O
different O O
splicing O O
activities O O
adds O O
an O O
important O O
new O O
dimension O O
to O O
the O O
molecular O O
mechanisms O O
responsible O O
for O O
regulating O O
tissue O O
- O O
dependent O O
alternative O O
splicing O O
mediated O O
via O O
UGCAUG O O
. O O

Mutations O O
of O O
PIK3CA O O
in O O
gastric O O
adenocarcinoma O O

Abstract O O

Background O O

Activation O O
of O O
the O O
phosphatidylinositol O O
3 O O
- O O
kinase O O
( O O
PI3K O O
) O O
through O O
mutational O O
inactivation O O
of O O
PTEN O O
tumour O O
suppressor O O
gene O O
is O O
common O O
in O O
diverse O O
cancer O O
types O O
, O O
but O O
rarely O O
reported O O
in O O
gastric O O
cancer O O
. O O

Recently O O
, O O
mutations O O
in O O
PIK3CA O O
, O O
which O O
encodes O O
the O O
p110 O O
alpha O O
catalytic O O
subunit O O
of O O
PI3K O O
, O O
have O O
been O O
identified O O
in O O
various O O
human B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_BODY_PART_OR_ORGAN_COMPONENT
cancers O O
, O O
including O O
3 O O
of O O
12 O O
gastric O O
cancers O O
. O O

Eighty O O
percent O O
of O O
these O O
reported O O
mutations O O
clustered O O
within O O
2 O O
regions O O
involving O O
the O O
helical O O
and O O
kinase O O
domains O O
. O O

In O O
vitro O O
study O O
on O O
one O O
of O O
the O O
" O O
hot O O
- O O
spot O O
" O O
mutants O O
has O O
demonstrated O O
it O O
as O O
an O O
activating O O
mutation O O
. O O

Methods O O

Based O O
on O O
these O O
data O O
, O O
we O O
initiated O O
PIK3CA O O
mutation O O
screening O O
in O O
94 O O
human B B_DISEASE_ADJECTIVE[DISEASE]/B_SPECIES[BIO]
gastric O O
cancers O O
by O O
direct O O
sequencing O O
of O O
the O O
gene O O
regions O O
in O O
which O O
80 O O
% O O
of O O
all O O
the O O
known O O
PIK3CA O O
mutations O O
were O O
found O O
. O O

We O O
also O O
examined O O
PIK3CA O O
expression O O
level O O
by O O
extracting O O
data O O
from O O
the O O
previous O O
large O O
- O O
scale O O
gene O O
expression O O
profiling O O
study O O
. O O

Using O O
Significance O O
Analysis O O
of O O
Microarrays O O
( O O
SAM O O
) O O
, O O
we O O
further O O
searched O O
for O O
genes O O
that O O
show O O
correlating O O
expression O O
with O O
PIK3CA O O
. O O

Results O O

We O O
have O O
identified O O
PIK3CA O O
mutations O O
in O O
4 O O
cases O O
( O O
4 O O
. O O
3 O O
% O O
) O O
, O O
all O O
involving O O
the O O
previously O O
reported O O
hotspots O O
. O O

Among O O
these O O
4 O O
cases O O
, O O
3 O O
tumours O O
demonstrated O O
microsatellite O O
instability O O
and O O
2 O O
tumours O O
harboured O O
concurrent O O
KRAS O O
mutation O O
. O O

Data O O
extracted O O
from O O
microarray O O
studies O O
showed O O
an O O
increased O O
expression O O
of O O
PIK3CA O O
in O O
gastric O O
cancers O O
when O O
compared O O
with O O
the O O
non O O
- O O
neoplastic O O
gastric O O
mucosae O O
( O O
p O O
< O O
0 O O
. O O
001 O O
) O O
. O O

SAM O O
further O O
identified O O
2910 O O
genes O O
whose O O
expression O O
levels O O
were O O
positively O O
associated O O
with O O
that O O
of O O
PIK3CA O O
. O O

Conclusion O O

Our O O
data O O
suggested O O
that O O
activation O O
of O O
the O O
PI3K O O
signalling O O
pathway O O
in O O
gastric O O
cancer O O
may O O
be O O
achieved O O
through O O
up O O
- O O
regulation O O
or O O
mutation O O
of O O
PIK3CA O O
, O O
in O O
which O O
the O O
latter O O
may O O
be O O
a O O
consequence O O
of O O
mismatch O O
repair O O
deficiency O O
. O O

Background O O

The O O
phosphatidylinositol O O
3 O O
- O O
kinase O O
( O O
PI3K O O
) O O
- O O
AKT O O
signalling O O
pathway O O
is O O
involved O O
in O O
the O O
regulation O O
of O O
diverse O O
cellular O O
processes O O
, O O
including O O
cell O O
growth O O
, O O
survival O O
and O O
motility O O
. O O

Abnormal O O
activation O O
of O O
this O O
pathway O O
is O O
frequently O O
observed O O
in O O
various O O
cancer O O
types O O
, O O
leading O O
to O O
aberrant O O
cell O O
cycle O O
progression O O
, O O
altered O O
adhesion O O
and O O
motility O O
, O O
inhibition O O
of O O
apoptosis O O
and O O
induction O O
of O O
angiogenesis O O
[ O O
1 O O
] O O
. O O

It O O
has O O
been O O
previously O O
reported O O
that O O
genetic O O
alterations O O
involving O O
various O O
members O O
along O O
this O O
signalling O O
pathway O O
could O O
lead O O
to O O
its O O
activation O O
in O O
cancer O O
. O O

These O O
include O O
mutation O O
, O O
allelic O O
loss O O
or O O
promoter O O
methylation O O
of O O
the O O
negative O O
regulator O O
PTEN O O
[ O O
2 O O
] O O
; O O
or O O
alternatively O O
, O O
chromosomal O O
amplification O O
or O O
over O O
- O O
expression O O
of O O
the O O
positive O O
regulators O O
PIK3CA O O
[ O O
3 O O
- O O
5 O O
] O O
and O O
the O O
various O O
AKT O O
kinases O O
[ O O
6 O O
, O O
7 O O
] O O
. O O

Furthermore O O
, O O
changes O O
in O O
other O O
related O O
pathways O O
that O O
are O O
commonly O O
altered O O
in O O
cancer O O

such O O
as O O
those O O
involved O O
in O O
growth O O
factor O O
stimulation O O
via O O
the O O
G O O
- O O
protein O O
- O O
coupled O O
receptors O O
or O O
through O O
direct O O
interaction O O
with O O
the O O
activated O O
form O O
of O O
small O O
GTPase O O
RAS O O
, O O
can O O
also O O
lead O O
to O O
PI3K O O
- O O
AKT O O
pathway O O
activation O O
[ O O
8 O O
] O O
. O O

Activation O O
of O O
this O O
pathway O O
results O O
in O O
the O O
phosphorylation O O
of O O
AKT O O
at O O
Thr O O
- O O
308 O O
/ O O
309 O O
and O O
Ser O O
- O O
473 O O
/ O O
474 O O
. O O

These O O
phosphorylated O O
forms O O
of O O
AKT O O
proteins O O
have O O
been O O
detected O O
by O O
Western O O
blot O O
or O O
immunohistochemistry O O
in O O
various O O
cancer O O
types O O
, O O
suggesting O O
the O O
frequent O O
activation O O
of O O
PI3K O O
- O O
AKT O O
pathway O O
in O O
the O O
carcinogenic O O
process O O
[ O O
7 O O
, O O
9 O O
] O O
. O O

Although O O
genetic O O
changes O O
along O O
the O O
PI3K O O
- O O
AKT O O
pathway O O
have O O
been O O
repeatedly O O
documented O O
in O O
brain O O
, O O
ovarian O O
, O O
endometrial O O
, O O
breast O O
, O O
prostate O O
and O O
thyroid O O
cancers O O
[ O O
1 O O
, O O
2 O O
] O O
, O O
reports O O
on O O
its O O
mechanism O O
of O O
activation O O
in O O
gastric O O
cancer O O
are O O
limited O O
. O O

Gastric O O
cancer O O
is O O
the O O
second O O
most O O
common O O
cancer O O
worldwide O O
but O O
its O O
molecular O O
basis O O
of O O
tumourigenesis O O
is O O
still O O
poorly O O
understood O O
. O O

Previous O O
immunohistochemical O O
study O O
has O O
demonstrated O O
the O O
presence O O
of O O
the O O
phosphorylated O O
form O O
of O O
AKT O O
in O O
78 O O
% O O
of O O
gastric O O
cancer O O
[ O O
10 O O
] O O
, O O
suggesting O O
that O O
activation O O
of O O
this O O
pathway O O
may O O
also O O
be O O
common O O
in O O
gastric O O
cancer O O
. O O

Though O O
loss O O
of O O
heterozygosity O O
( O O
LOH O O
) O O
involving O O
the O O
PTEN O O
locus O O
has O O
been O O
demonstrated O O
in O O
47 O O
% O O
of O O
gastric O O
cancer O O
in O O
a O O
recent O O
study O O
, O O
mutation O O
or O O
promoter O O
methylation O O
was O O
absent O O
even O O
in O O
cases O O
with O O
LOH O O
[ O O
11 O O
] O O
. O O

Thus O O
data O O
from O O
this O O
study O O
could O O
not O O
support O O
the O O
two O O
- O O
hit O O
inactivation O O
of O O
PTEN O O
in O O
gastric O O
cancer O O
, O O
while O O
the O O
biological O O
significance O O
of O O
PTEN O O
haploinsufficiency O O
remains O O
controversial O O
. O O

Alternatively O O
, O O
amplification O O
of O O
AKT1 O O
has O O
been O O
reported O O
in O O
a O O
single O O
case O O
of O O
gastric O O
cancer O O
[ O O
12 O O
] O O
, O O
and O O
amplification O O
of O O
PIK3CA O O
associated O O
with O O
elevated O O
mRNA O O
levels O O
has O O
been O O
found O O
in O O
36 O O
% O O
of O O
gastric O O
cancer O O
[ O O
11 O O
] O O
. O O

More O O
recently O O
, O O
Samuels O O
et O O
al O O
. O O
screened O O
a O O
diverse O O
spectrum O O
of O O
human B B_PERSON/B_BODY_PART_OR_ORGAN_COMPONENT
cancers O O
for O O
mutation O O
in O O
16 O O
PI3K O O
or O O
PI3K O O
- O O
like O O
genes O O
and O O
found O O
a O O
high O O
frequency O O
of O O
somatic O O
mutation O O
in O O
PIK3CA O O
, O O
which O O
encodes O O
the O O
p110 O O
alpha O O
catalytic O O
subunit O O
. O O

Major O O
screening O O
in O O
colorectal O O
cancer O O
( O O
CRC O O
) O O
identified O O
PIK3CA O O
mutations O O
in O O
74 O O
out O O
of O O
234 O O
( O O

% O O
) O O
cases O O

while O O

were O O

noted O O
in O O
3 O O
out O O
of O O
12 O O
( O O
25 O O
% O O
) O O
gastric O O
cancers O O
. O O

Reported O O
mutations O O
were O O
mostly O O
of O O
missense O O
type O O
, O O
and O O
clustered O O
within O O
2 O O

in O O
the O O

and O O
kinase O O
domains O O
. O O

Expression O O
of O O
a O O
" O O
hot O O
- O O
spot O O
" O O
mutant O O
, O O

, O O
conferred O O
a O O

up O O
- O O
regulation O O
of O O
lipid O O

of O O

, O O

as O O
an O O
activating O O
mutation O O
[ O O
13 O O
] O O
. O O

In O O

, O O

of O O

Using O O

genes O O
with O O

have O O
also O O

. O O

Methods O O

Patient B B_PERSON/B_LOCATION
samples O O

of O O

for O O

. O O

of O O

for O O

and O O

. O O

Mutations O O
in O O
these O O

of O O
all O O

mutations O O

in O O
the O O
previous O O
study O O
[ O O
13 O O
] O O
. O O

PIK3CA O O
intron O O
- O O
specific O O

amplification O O

and O O

were O O

to O O

[ O O

[ O O

file O O
1 O O
] O O
. O O

In O O
particular O O
, O O

for O O
exon O O
9 O O
have O O
been O O
modified O O
to O O
avoid O O
amplification O O
of O O
homologous O O
sequences O O
located O O
in O O
other O O
chromosomes O O
. O O

PCR O O
products O O
were O O
generated O O
using O O
the O O
external O O
primers O O
and O O
directly O O
sequenced O O
using O O
the O O
internal O O
primers O O
with O O
the O O
DYEnamic O O
(TM) O O
ET O O
Terminator O O
Cycle O O
Sequencing O O
Kit O O
( O O
Amersham O O
Biosciences O O
, O O
Freiburg O O
, O O
Germany O O
) O O
according O O
to O O
the O O
manufacturer O O
' O O
s O O
instruction O O
. O O

Electrophoresis O O
was O O
performed O O
in O O
the O O
ABI O O
Prism O O
(R) O O
3700 O O
DNA O O
Analyzer O O
( O O
Applied O O
Biosystems O O
, O O
Foster O O
City O O
, O O
CA O O
, O O
USA O O
) O O
. O O

For O O
each O O
exon O O
, O O
PCR O O
products O O
were O O
generated O O
from O O
2 O O
independent O O
PCR O O
reactions O O
for O O

of O O
the O O
forward O O
and O O
reverse O O
strands O O
. O O

For O O
exon O O
9 O O
, O O
2 O O
independent O O
PCR O O
followed O O
by O O
sequencing O O
of O O
the O O
forward O O
strand O O
were O O
performed O O
. O O

of O O

the O O

software O O

(TM) O O
( O O

, O O

) O O

Extraction O O
of O O
expression O O
data O O
and O O
statistical O O
analysis O O

Gene O O

were O O

from O O
the O O

containing O O
126 O O

( O O

gastric O O
cancers O O

14 O O

and O O
22 O O

- O O
tumour O O
gastric O O
mucosae O O
) O O

on O O
a O O
3 O O
- O O
fold O O
signal O O
above O O
background O O
ratio O O
for O O
either O O
channel O O
and O O
with O O
80 O O
% O O
good O O
data O O
[ O O
14 O O
] O O
. O O

Gene O O
expression O O
data O O
from O O
20 O O
, O O
336 O O
cDNA O O
clones O O
satisfied O O
this O O

criteria O O
and O O
were O O
extracted O O
, O O
which O O
included O O
a O O
cDNA O O

corresponding O O
to O O
PIK3CA O O
( O O
IMAGE O O
clone O O
number O O

, O O
GenBank O O
accession O O
no O O
. O O
W72473 O O
) O O
. O O

Expression O O
data O O
for O O
PIK3CA O O
was O O
extracted O O
and O O
the O O

in O O
expression O O
levels O O
between O O

and O O

- O O

the O O
Student O O
' O O

- O O
Test O O
. O O

was O O

to O O

with O O
significant O O
correlating O O
expression O O
with O O
PIK3CA O O
[ O O

] O O
. O O

The O O

in O O

by O O
a O O
K O O
- O O
nearest O O

algorithm O O
using O O
10 O O

by O O

. O O

Results O O

Among O O
the O O

adenocarcinoma O O
analysed O O

we O O
have O O
detected O O
PIK3CA O O
mutation O O
in O O
4 O O
cases O O
. O O

Two O O

the O O

A3140G O O
( O O

) O O
in O O
exon O O

, O O
and O O
the O O
other O O

with O O

G1624A O O
( O O
E542K O O

and O O

( O O

in O O
exon O O

Representative O O

1 O O

All O O
four O O

as O O
somatic O O

. O O

Though O O

of O O

of O O

In O O

in O O

While O O

PIK3CA O O

spectrum O O
and O O
their O O

- O O

( O O

Since O O

with O O

- O O

( O O
n O O

, O O

= O O
- O O
0 O O
. O O
418 O O
, O O

= O O

. O O

; O O

' O O

- O O
Test O O
, O O
p O O
< O O
0 O O
. O O

) O O
. O O

Using O O

as O O

variable O O
for O O

] O O
, O O

, O O
Delta O O
= O O
1 O O

Additional O O
file O O

Interestingly O O
, O O
no O O
gene O O
was O O

to O O
be O O
negatively O O
associated O O
with O O
PIK3CA O O
expression O O
. O O

Discussion O O

In O O
this O O
study O O
, O O
we O O
have O O
reported O O
the O O
presence O O
of O O
PIK3CA O O
gene O O
mutation O O
in O O
4 O O
. O O
3 O O
% O O
of O O
gastric O O
cancer O O
. O O

A O O
high O O
tendency O O
( O O
3 O O
in O O
4 O O
) O O
of O O
mismatch O O
repair O O
deficiency O O
was O O
noted O O
in O O
cases O O
harbouring O O
PIK3CA O O
mutation O O
. O O

Though O O
the O O
small O O
number O O
of O O
PIK3CA O O
mutations O O
in O O
our O O
study O O
may O O
not O O
justify O O
statistical O O
claim O O
of O O
significance O O
; O O
suggestion O O
of O O
such O O
, O O
despite O O
of O O
its O O
not O O
being O O
mentioned O O
by O O
the O O
authors O O
, O O
can O O
be O O
found O O
from O O
a O O
previous O O
study O O
in O O
CRC O O
by O O
Samuels O O
et O O
al O O
. O O
. O O

From O O
their O O
study O O
of O O
33 O O
MSI O O
and O O
201 O O
microsatellite O O
stable O O
( O O
MSS O O
) O O
CRC O O
cases O O
, O O
PIK3CA O O
mutation O O
was O O
present O O
in O O
48 O O
% O O
of O O
the O O
MSI O O
tumours O O
, O O
but O O
only O O
in O O
29 O O
% O O
of O O
the O O
MSS O O
tumours O O
. O O

A O O
significant O O
association O O
would O O
have O O
been O O
revealed O O
if O O
statistical O O
analysis O O
had O O
been O O
applied O O
( O O
Fisher O O
' O O
s O O
exact O O
test O O
, O O
p O O
= O O
0 O O
. O O
014 O O
) O O
[ O O
13 O O
] O O
. O O

Gastrointestinal O O
tract O O
cancers O O
with O O
MSI O O
are O O
known O O
to O O
have O O
a O O
different O O
molecular O O
pathway O O
of O O
tumour O O
evolution O O
compared O O
with O O
their O O
MSS O O
counterparts O O
[ O O
19 O O
, O O
20 O O
] O O
. O O

This O O
can O O
be O O
attributed O O
to O O
their O O
propensity O O
for O O
frameshift O O
mutations O O
in O O
repeat O O
sequences O O
, O O
resulting O O
in O O
selective O O
disruption O O
of O O
genes O O
with O O
such O O
sequences O O
within O O
their O O
coding O O
regions O O
. O O

With O O
2 O O
poly O O
- O O
adenine O O
tracts O O
within O O
its O O
coding O O
region O O
, O O
PTEN O O
can O O
be O O
inactivated O O
through O O
frameshift O O
mutations O O
in O O
MSI O O
CRC O O
, O O
resulting O O
in O O
the O O
selective O O
targeting O O
of O O
the O O
PI3K O O
- O O
AKT O O
signalling O O
pathway O O
[ O O
21 O O
, O O
22 O O
] O O
. O O

It O O
is O O
also O O
known O O
that O O
mismatch O O
repair O O
deficiency O O
would O O
lead O O
to O O
an O O
elevated O O
rate O O
of O O
missense O O
mutation O O
due O O
to O O
impaired O O
single O O
nucleotide O O
mismatch O O
repair O O
[ O O
23 O O
] O O
. O O

Thus O O
, O O
the O O
observed O O
higher O O
incidence O O
of O O
PIK3CA O O
missense O O
mutation O O
in O O
MSI O O
colorectal O O
and O O
gastric O O
cancers O O
suggests O O
yet O O
another O O
mechanism O O
for O O
the O O
activation O O
of O O
the O O
PI3K O O
- O O
AKT O O
signalling O O
pathway O O
through O O
mismatch O O
repair O O
deficiency O O
. O O

Our O O
data O O
also O O
showed O O
a O O
higher O O
tendency O O
of O O
KRAS O O
mutation O O
in O O
cases O O
with O O
PIK3CA O O
mutations O O
( O O
2 O O
in O O
4 O O
) O O
than O O
in O O
those O O
without O O
( O O
6 O O
in O O
90 O O
) O O
. O O

Yet O O
again O O
due O O
to O O
the O O
low O O
incidence O O
of O O
both O O
mutations O O
in O O
our O O
samples O O
, O O
statistical O O
significance O O
may O O
not O O
be O O
claimed O O
. O O

In O O
the O O
study O O
by O O
Samuels O O
et O O
al O O
. O O
, O O
some O O
of O O
the O O
colorectal O O
tumours O O
with O O
PIK3CA O O
mutation O O
also O O
harboured O O
KRAS O O
or O O
BRAF O O
mutation O O
[ O O
13 O O
] O O
. O O

The O O
PI3K O O
- O O
AKT O O
pathway O O
is O O
known O O
to O O
have O O
a O O
close O O
association O O
with O O
the O O
RAS O O
- O O
MEKK O O
signalling O O
pathway O O
[ O O
8 O O
] O O
. O O

Constitutively O O
active O O
RAS O O
can O O
interact O O
with O O
the O O
catalytic O O
subunit O O
of O O
PI3K O O
and O O
lead O O
to O O
its O O
activation O O
. O O

Ras O O
- O O
dependent O O
PI3K O O
activation O O
contributes O O
to O O
the O O
transforming O O
phenotype O O
by O O
mediating O O
anchorage O O
- O O
independent O O
growth O O
, O O
cytoskeletal O O
reorganisation O O
and O O
apoptosis O O
evasion O O
. O O

It O O
has O O
been O O
observed O O
that O O
genes O O
involved O O
in O O
the O O
same O O
signalling O O
pathway O O
may O O
manifest O O
mutations O O
in O O
cancer O O
cells O O
in O O
a O O
mutually O O
exclusive O O
manner O O
, O O
presumably O O
due O O
to O O
the O O
lack O O
of O O
selective O O
growth O O
advantage O O
in O O
having O O
a O O
second O O
hit O O
in O O
the O O
already O O
altered O O
pathway O O
. O O

A O O
prominent O O
example O O
is O O
the O O
mutually O O
exclusive O O
occurrence O O
of O O
the O O
BRAF O O
hotspot O O
mutation O O
( O O
V600E O O
) O O
and O O
KRAS O O
mutations O O
in O O
colorectal O O
cancer O O
[ O O
24 O O
, O O
25 O O
] O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
there O O
exist O O
other O O
examples O O
of O O
alterations O O
in O O
multiple O O
components O O
of O O
the O O
same O O
signalling O O
pathway O O
that O O
may O O
lead O O
to O O
a O O
multi O O
- O O
level O O
modulation O O
of O O
its O O
activity O O
. O O

For O O
example O O
, O O
non O O
- O O
V600E O O
BRAF O O
mutations O O
tend O O
to O O
occur O O
together O O
with O O
KRAS O O
mutations O O
[ O O
26 O O
] O O
, O O
and O O
inactivation O O
of O O
the O O
secreted O O
frizzled O O
- O O
related O O
proteins O O
( O O
antagonists O O
of O O
WNT O O
) O O
by O O
promoter O O
methylation O O
frequently O O
coincides O O
with O O
mutations O O
in O O
the O O
Adenomatous O O
Polyposis O O
Coli O O
gene O O
to O O
achieve O O
multi O O
- O O
level O O
activation O O
of O O
the O O
WNT O O
signalling O O
pathway O O
in O O
colorectal O O
cancers O O
[ O O
27 O O
] O O
. O O

Whether O O
PIK3CA O O
functions O O
independently O O
from O O
RAS O O
, O O
or O O
acts O O
synergistically O O
with O O
RAS O O
to O O
produce O O
additive O O
effects O O
on O O
the O O
activation O O
of O O
the O O
same O O
pathway O O
awaits O O
further O O
clarification O O
. O O

By O O
extracting O O
data O O
from O O
microarray O O
, O O
we O O
have O O
confirmed O O
the O O
up O O
- O O
regulation O O
of O O
PIK3CA O O
expression O O
in O O
gastric O O
cancer O O
tissues O O
compared O O
with O O
the O O
non O O
- O O
neoplastic O O
gastric O O
mucosae O O
and O O
identified O O
a O O
large O O
number O O
of O O
genes O O
that O O
showed O O
a O O
significant O O
positive O O
correlation O O
in O O
expression O O
level O O
with O O
PIK3CA O O
. O O

These O O
genes O O
participate O O
in O O
diverse O O
cellular O O
processes O O
with O O
177 O O
as O O
putative O O
cell O O
cycle O O
- O O
regulated O O
genes O O
[ O O
28 O O
] O O
and O O
126 O O
mapped O O
to O O
genes O O
with O O
known O O
functions O O
in O O
cell O O
cycle O O
regulation O O
, O O
cell O O
proliferation O O
or O O
DNA O O
replication O O
[ O O
see O O
Additional O O
file O O
2 O O
] O O
. O O

While O O
some O O
of O O
these O O
genes O O
maybe O O
induced O O
by O O
PIK3CA O O
, O O
others O O
maybe O O
co O O
- O O
ordinately O O
regulated O O
by O O
common O O
upstream O O
signals O O
. O O

Expression O O
data O O
set O O
at O O
one O O
point O O
was O O
limited O O
in O O
differentiating O O
the O O
above O O
cause O O
and O O
consequence O O
, O O
yet O O
it O O
certainly O O
revealed O O
the O O
complexity O O
of O O
the O O
carcinogenic O O
process O O
and O O
the O O
intricate O O
relationship O O
of O O
PIK3CA O O
signalling O O
with O O
other O O
cellular O O
processes O O
. O O

Contrary O O
to O O
our O O
expectation O O
, O O
the O O
incidence O O
of O O
PIK3CA O O
mutation O O
found O O
in O O
the O O
current O O
study O O
( O O
4 O O
% O O
) O O
is O O
much O O
lower O O
compared O O
with O O
that O O
observed O O
by O O
Samuel O O
et O O
al O O
. O O

( O O
25 O O
% O O
) O O
[ O O
13 O O
] O O
. O O

The O O
reason O O
for O O
discrepancy O O
may O O
simply O O
be O O
a O O
result O O
of O O
sample O O
bias O O
as O O

previous O O
study O O
involved O O
only O O
a O O

number O O
of O O
gastric O O
cancers O O
( O O
n O O
= O O
12 O O
) O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
ethnic O O
differences O O
can O O
also O O
be O O
another O O
possibility O O
. O O

The O O
diverse O O
pathological O O
spectrum O O
and O O
aetiological O O
factors O O
of O O
gastric O O
cancers O O
in O O
different O O

may O O
be O O

by O O
differences O O
in O O
molecular O O
pathway O O
of O O
tumour O O
development O O

study O O
is O O

a O O

with O O

from O O

will O O
be O O

to O O

this O O

. O O

Conclusion O O

Large O O
- O O
scale O O
screening O O
of O O
gastric O O
adenocarcinomas O O
for O O

mutations O O
revealed O O
a O O
mutation O O
incidence O O
of O O
4 O O
. O O
3 O O
% O O
. O O

Increased O O
PIK3CA O O
expression O O
level O O
was O O
observed O O
in O O
gastric O O
tumours O O
compared O O
with O O
non O O
- O O
neoplastic O O
mucosae O O
. O O

This O O
increase O O
in O O

level O O
was O O
associated O O
with O O
the O O
elevated O O
expression O O
of O O
a O O
large O O
number O O
of O O
genes O O
, O O
which O O
may O O

or O O

of O O

along O O
the O O

signalling O O
pathway O O
. O O

Supplementary O O
Material O O

Identification O O
of O O
kinectin O O
as O O
a O O
novel O O
Beh O O
c O O
et O O
' O O
s O O
disease O O
autoantigen O O

Abstract O O

There O O
has O O
been O O
some O O
evidence O O
that O O
Beh O O
c O O
et O O
' O O
s O O
disease O O
( O O
BD O O
) O O
has O O
a O O
significant O O
autoimmune O O
component O O
but O O
the O O
molecular O O
identity O O
of O O
putative O O
autoantigens O O
has O O
not O O
been O O
well O O
characterized O O
. O O

In O O
the O O
initial O O
analysis O O
of O O
the O O
autoantibody O O
profile O O
in O O
39 O O
Chinese O O
BD O O
patients B B_PERSON/B_LOCATION
, O O
autoantibodies O O
to O O
cellular O O
proteins O O
were O O
uncovered O O
in O O
23 O O
% O O
as O O
determined O O
by O O
immunoblotting O O
. O O

We O O
have O O
now O O
identified O O
one O O
of O O
the O O
major O O
autoantibody O O
specificities O O
using O O
expression O O
cloning O O
. O O

Serum O O
from O O
a O O
BD O O
patient B B_PERSON/B_STUDY[THERAPEUTIC_OR_PREVENTIVE_PROCEDURE]
was O O
used O O
as O O
a O O
probe O O
to O O
immunoscreen O O
a O O
lambda O O
ZAP O O
expression O O
cDNA O O
library O O
. O O

Candidate O O
autoantigen O O
cDNAs O O
were O O
characterized O O
by O O
direct O O
nucleotide O O
sequencing O O
and O O
their O O
expressed O O
products O O
were O O
examined O O
for O O
reactivity O O
to O O
the O O
entire O O
panel O O
of O O
BD O O
sera O O
using O O
immunoprecipitation O O
. O O

Reactivity O O
was O O
also O O
examined O O
with O O
normal O O
control O O
sera O O
and O O
disease O O
control O O
sera O O
from O O
patients B B_PERSON/B_BIO
with O O
lupus O O
and O O
Sj O O
o O O
gren O O
' O O
s O O
syndrome O O
. O O

Six O O
independent O O
candidate O O
clones O O
were O O
isolated O O
from O O
the O O
cDNA O O
library O O
screen O O
and O O
were O O
identified O O
as O O
overlapping O O
partial O O
human B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_GENE
kinectin O O
cDNAs O O
. O O

The O O
finding O O
that O O
kinectin O O
was O O
an O O
autoantigen O O
was O O
verified O O
in O O
9 O O
out O O
of O O
39 O O
( O O
23 O O
% O O
) O O
BD O O
patient B B_PERSON/B_LOCATION
sera O O
by O O
immunoprecipitation O O
of O O
the O O
in O O
vitro O O
translation O O
products O O
. O O

Sera O O
from O O
controls O O
showed O O
no O O
reactivity O O
. O O

The O O
significance O O
of O O
kinectin O O
as O O
a O O
participant O O
in O O
autoimmune O O
pathogenesis O O
in O O
BD O O
and O O
the O O
potential O O
use O O
of O O
autoantibody O O
to O O
kinectin O O
in O O
serodiagnostics O O
are O O
discussed O O
. O O

Introduction O O

Beh O O
c O O
et O O
' O O
s O O
disease O O
( O O
BD O O
) O O
is O O
a O O
systemic O O
vasculitic O O
disease O O
typified O O
by O O
a O O
triad O O
of O O
symptoms O O
including O O
recurrent O O
oral O O
ulcers O O
, O O
genital O O
ulcers O O
and O O
uveitis O O
. O O

In O O
addition O O
, O O
skin O O
, O O
joint O O
, O O
large O O
vessels O O
, O O
nervous O O
system O O
and O O
gastrointestinal O O
systems O O
may O O
be O O
involved O O
. O O

BD O O
is O O
a O O
global O O
disease O O
but O O
has O O
the O O
highest O O
prevalence O O
in O O
the O O
region O O
along O O
the O O
ancient O O
' O O
Silk O O
Road O O
' O O
in O O
China O O
. O O

The O O
etiopathogenesis O O
of O O
the O O
disease O O
remains O O
unclear O O
but O O
microbial O O
agent O O
triggers O O
, O O
environmental O O
factors O O
, O O
genetic O O
predisposition O O
, O O
neutrophil O O
hyperfunction O O
, O O
endothelial O O
cell O O
dysfunction O O
and O O
immunological O O
abnormalities O O
involving O O
both O O
T O O
and O O
B O O
cells O O
have O O
been O O
implicated O O
. O O

Increasing O O
amounts O O
of O O
research O O
evidence O O
supports O O
the O O
possibility O O
that O O
it O O
is O O
an O O
immune O O
- O O
mediated O O
vasculitis O O
, O O
and O O
that O O
abnormal O O
T O O
- O O
cell O O
and O O
B O O
- O O
cell O O
reactions O O
and O O
autoantigen O O
- O O
driven O O
autoimmunity O O
play O O
pivotal O O
roles O O
[ O O
1 O O
] O O
. O O

Systemic O O
lupus O O
erythematosus O O
( O O
SLE O O
) O O
is O O
the O O
prototypic O O
systemic O O
autoimmune O O
rheumatic O O
disease O O
with O O
autoantibodies O O
against O O
cellular O O
( O O
particularly O O
nuclear O O
) O O
antigens O O
, O O
some O O
of O O
which O O
are O O
critically O O
implicated O O
in O O
the O O
autoimmune O O
pathology O O
while O O
others O O
provide O O
valuable O O
serodiagnostic O O
markers O O
for O O
the O O
disease O O
. O O

Unlike O O
the O O
picture O O
in O O
SLE O O
and O O
other O O
related O O
rheumatic O O
diseases O O
, O O
in O O
BD O O
, O O
antinuclear O O
antibodies O O
and O O
antibodies O O
to O O
neutrophil O O
cytoplasmic O O
antigens O O
etc O O
. O O
are O O
not O O
present O O
. O O

To O O
date O O
, O O
since O O
neither O O
a O O
specific O O
autoantibody O O
nor O O
pathognomonic O O
pathological O O
index O O
is O O
available O O
to O O
help O O
establish O O
the O O
diagnosis O O
of O O
BD O O
, O O
it O O
is O O
largely O O
or O O
solely O O
based O O
on O O
clinical O O
manifestations O O
[ O O
2 O O
] O O
, O O
and O O
a O O
dilemma O O
in O O
diagnosis O O
is O O
not O O
a O O
rare O O
occurrence O O
in O O
clinical O O
practice O O
. O O

Nevertheless O O
, O O
since O O
the O O
1960s O O
, O O
there O O
have O O
been O O
reports O O
of O O
autoantibodies O O
against O O
certain O O
unknown O O
components O O
of O O
human B B_PERSON/B_DISEASE_ADJECTIVE[DISEASE]
oral O O
mucosa O O
in O O
sera O O
of O O
patients B B_PERSON/B_BIO
with O O
BD O O
. O O

Since O O
then O O
, O O
sporadic O O
reports O O
on O O
findings O O
of O O
autoantibodies O O
in O O
this O O
disease O O
have O O
been O O
described O O
, O O
such O O
as O O
antibodies O O
to O O
retinal O O
antigen O O
( O O

) O O
, O O

shock O O
protein O O
( O O

) O O
of O O
some O O
strains O O
of O O
Streptococcus B B_SPECIES[BIO]
sanguis I I_SPECIES[BIO]
cross O O
- O O
reactive O O
with O O
human B B_PERSON/B_SPECIES[BIO]

polypeptide O O
[ O O
3 O O
] O O
, O O

to O O
endothelial O O
cell O O

( O O

) O O
and O O

to O O
alpha O O
- O O

[ O O

, O O

This O O

using O O
time O O
- O O

- O O

Immunoscreening O O
of O O
expression O O

using O O

was O O
used O O

has O O

/ O O

[ O O

[ O O
10 O O
] O O
antigens O O
in O O

( O O

) O O
and O O

antigen O O
CENP O O
- O O

[ O O

. O O

In O O

Materials O O
and O O

The O O
currently O O

Results O O
and O O
discussion O O

Autoantibody O O
detection O O
in O O
sera O O
from O O
BD O O
patients B B_PERSON/B_STUDY[THERAPEUTIC_OR_PREVENTIVE_PROCEDURE]

Initial O O
examination O O
of O O
a O O
group O O
of O O
39 O O
BD O O
patients B B_PERSON/B_BIO
using O O
indirect O O
immunofluorescence O O
( O O
IIF O O
) O O
on O O
a O O
HEp O O
- O O
2 O O
cell O O
substrate O O
did O O
not O O
yield O O
any O O
characteristic O O
nuclear O O
or O O
cytoplasmic O O
staining O O
patterns O O
. O O

BD O O
is O O
thought O O
by O O
some O O
to O O
be O O
a O O
vasculitic O O
disease O O
involving O O
pathophysiology O O
of O O
endothelial O O
cells O O
, O O
and O O
antibody O O
to O O
endothelial O O
cell O O
antigen O O
( O O
AECA O O
) O O
has O O
been O O
reported O O
. O O

Reports O O
on O O
the O O
prevalence O O
of O O
AECA O O
have O O
varied O O
largely O O
and O O
alpha O O
- O O
enolase O O
was O O
reported O O
as O O
one O O
of O O
the O O
putative O O
target O O
antigens O O
[ O O
26 O O
] O O
. O O

In O O
this O O
study O O
, O O
the O O
use O O
of O O
bovine B B_PERSON/B_SPECIES[BIO]
aortic O O
endothelial O O
cells O O
as O O
substrate O O
for O O
IIF O O
did O O
not O O
provide O O
any O O
additional O O
data O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
Western O O
blot O O
analysis O O
of O O
the O O
BD O O
sera O O
began O O
to O O
show O O
some O O
interesting O O
autoreactivity O O
using O O
cell O O
lysates O O
from O O
both O O
HeLa O O
and O O
bovine B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_PROTEIN[GENE]
aortic O O
endothelial O O
cells O O
. O O

HeLa O O
cells O O
were O O
initially O O
used O O
for O O
this O O
analysis O O
because O O
they O O
are O O
commonly O O
used O O
in O O
the O O
laboratory O O
as O O
Western O O
blot O O
substrate O O
. O O

Fig O O
. O O

1 O O
illustrates O O
the O O
common O O
reactivity O O
to O O
49 O O
kDa O O
and O O
120 O O
kDa O O
proteins O O
in O O
the O O
endothelial O O
cell O O
lysates O O
. O O

These O O
antigens O O
were O O
also O O
detected O O
in O O
HeLa O O
and O O
T24 O O
cells O O
; O O
the O O
latter O O
cell O O
line O O
was O O
analyzed O O
because O O
our O O
laboratory O O
at O O
The O O
Scripps O O
Research O O
Institute O O
has O O
produced O O
an O O
excellent O O
expression O O
cDNA O O
library O O
from O O
the O O
T24 O O

and O O
the O O
positive O O
result O O
with O O
the O O
T24 O O
cell O O
extracts O O
allowed O O
us O O
to O O
screen O O
the O O
T24 O O
library O O
. O O

Ig O O
isotype O O
analysis O O
showed O O
that O O
all O O
reactivity O O
was O O
largely O O
IgG O O
antibodies O O

Since O O
the O O
49 O O
kDa O O
and O O
120 O O
kDa O O
bands O O
were O O
observed O O
in O O
cell O O
extracts O O
from O O
bovine B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_PROTEIN[GENE]
as O O
well O O
as O O
human B B_SPECIES[BIO]
cell O O
lines O O
, O O
these O O
autoantigens O O
might O O
be O O
evolutionarily O O
conserved O O
. O O

In O O
total O O
, O O
nine O O
out O O
of O O
39 O O
BD O O
sera O O
( O O
23 O O
% O O
) O O
had O O
autoantibody O O
to O O
the O O
49 O O
kDa O O
antigen O O
and O O
eight O O
( O O
20 O O
% O O
) O O
to O O
the O O
120 O O
kDa O O
antigen O O
. O O

Four O O
BD O O
sera O O
( O O
10 O O
% O O
) O O
reacted O O
with O O
both O O
proteins O O
. O O

Additionally O O
, O O
sera O O

to O O
the O O
120 O O
kDa O O
protein O O
also O O
demonstrated O O
a O O
common O O

that O O

at O O
~ O O

kDa O O

although O O
it O O
appeared O O
weaker O O
than O O
the O O

kDa O O
band O O

These O O

appeared O O
to O O
have O O
different O O

weights O O
than O O
those O O
of O O
the O O
known O O

in O O

In O O

were O O

but O O

were O O
not O O
as O O

and O O

to O O

from O O

( O O

to O O

from O O

( O O

) O O
was O O

for O O

Kinectin O O
identified O O
as O O
a O O

BD O O

After O O

cell O O

The O O

were O O

in O O

into O O

plasmids O O

( O O

( O O

( O O

Secondary O O

identified O O
as O O
coiled O O
- O O
coil O O
- O O
rich O O
proteins O O
including O O
pericentrin O O
, O O
a O O
220 O O
kDa O O
protein O O
[ O O
46 O O
] O O
, O O
ninein O O
, O O
a O O
protein O O
with O O
alternatively O O
spliced O O
products O O
of O O
245 O O
and O O
249 O O
kDa O O
[ O O
47 O O
] O O
, O O
Cep250 O O
( O O
250 O O
kDa O O
) O O
and O O
Cep110 O O
( O O
110 O O
kDa O O
) O O
[ O O
48 O O
] O O
. O O

Centromere O O
autoantigens O O
have O O
been O O
described O O
but O O
the O O
two O O
interesting O O
ones O O
related O O
to O O
this O O
discussion O O
are O O
CENP O O
- O O
E O O
[ O O
49 O O
] O O
and O O
CENP O O
- O O
F O O
[ O O
50 O O
] O O
; O O
both O O
are O O
high O O
molecular O O
weight O O
proteins O O
( O O
312 O O
to O O
400 O O
kDa O O
) O O
and O O
have O O
the O O
same O O
type O O
of O O
overall O O
structure O O
as O O
discussed O O
above O O
. O O

NuMA O O
is O O
another O O
large O O
coiled O O
- O O

protein O O
located O O
at O O
the O O
mitotic O O
spindle O O

the O O
most O O

in O O
sera O O
with O O
mitotic O O
spindle O O
apparatus O O
staining O O
[ O O
51 O O
] O O
. O O

Non O O
- O O
muscle O O

( O O
~ O O
200 O O
kDa O O
) O O
is O O
a O O

autoantigen O O
[ O O

] O O
that O O
falls O O
in O O
the O O
same O O
group O O
of O O
high O O
molecular O O

and O O
coiled O O
- O O
coil O O
- O O
rich O O
autoantigens O O
. O O

These O O

, O O

, O O

apparatus O O
and O O

autoantigens O O
are O O

weights O O

overall O O

of O O
coiled O O
- O O

The O O

of O O

in O O

may O O

Conclusion O O

Here O O

report O O
the O O

of O O

autoantibody O O
in O O
23 O O
% O O
of O O
Chinese O O
patients B B_PERSON
with O O

of O O

as O O
a O O

- O O

autoantigen O O
has O O
not O O

. O O

Autoantibody O O

against O O

of O O

disease O O
. O O

to O O

to O O

larger O O
patient B B_PERSON/B_DISEASE

On O O

EndoNet O O
: O O
an O O
information O O
resource O O
about O O
endocrine O O
networks O O

Abstract O O

EndoNet O O
is O O
a O O
new O O
database O O
that O O
provides O O
information O O
about O O
the O O
components O O
of O O
endocrine O O
networks O O
and O O
their O O
relations O O
. O O

One O O
class O O
represents O O
the O O
hormones O O
( O O
in O O
the O O
broadest O O
sense O O
) O O
secreted O O
by O O
defined O O
donor O O
cells O O
. O O

The O O
other O O
class O O
consists O O
of O O
the O O
acceptor O O
or O O
target O O
cells O O
expressing O O
the O O
corresponding O O
hormone O O
receptors O O
. O O

The O O
identity O O
and O O
anatomical O O
environment O O
of O O
cell O O
types O O
, O O
tissues O O
and O O
organs O O
is O O
defined O O
through O O
references O O
to O O
the O O
CYTOMER O O
(R) O O
ontology O O
. O O

With O O
the O O
EndoNet O O
user O O
interface O O
, O O
it O O
is O O
possible O O
to O O
query O O
the O O
database O O
for O O
hormones O O
, O O
receptors O O
or O O
tissues O O
and O O
to O O
combine O O
several O O
items O O
from O O
different O O
search O O
rounds O O
in O O
one O O
complex O O
result O O
set O O
, O O
from O O
which O O
a O O
network O O
can O O
be O O
reconstructed O O
and O O
visualized O O
. O O

For O O
each O O
entity O O
, O O
a O O
detailed O O
characteristics O O
page O O
is O O
available O O
. O O

Some O O
well O O
- O O
established O O
endocrine O O
pathways O O
are O O
offered O O
as O O
showcases O O
in O O
the O O
form O O
of O O
predefined O O
result O O
sets O O
. O O

These O O
sets O O
can O O
be O O
used O O
as O O
a O O
starting O O
point O O
for O O
a O O
more O O
complex O O
query O O
or O O
for O O
obtaining O O
a O O
quick O O
overview O O
. O O

The O O
EndoNet O O
database O O
is O O
accessible O O
at O O
. O O

INTRODUCTION O O

Theoretical O O
analyses O O
in O O
the O O
post O O
- O O
sequencing O O
era O O
, O O
in O O
particular O O
in O O
the O O
context O O
of O O
systems O O
biology O O
approaches O O
, O O
increasingly O O
investigate O O
the O O
properties O O
of O O
all O O
kinds O O
of O O
pathways O O
and O O
networks O O
such O O
as O O
metabolic O O
and O O
signaling O O
pathways O O
. O O

It O O
is O O
commonly O O
accepted O O
that O O
we O O
need O O
formal O O
descriptions O O
of O O
these O O
networks O O
to O O
make O O
systematic O O
use O O
of O O
the O O
overwhelming O O
body O O
of O O
facts O O
gathered O O
over O O
decades O O
of O O
laboratory O O
work O O
both O O
in O O
narrow O O
or O O
global O O
scale O O
. O O

Corresponding O O
databases O O
have O O
been O O
created O O
and O O
are O O
available O O
now O O
for O O
metabolic O O
networks O O
( O O
KEGG O O
) O O
( O O
1 O O
, O O
2 O O
) O O
, O O
protein O O
interaction O O
networks O O
( O O
BIND O O
and O O
DIP O O
) O O
( O O
3 O O
, O O
4 O O
) O O
and O O
signaling O O
pathways O O
( O O
CSNDB O O
, O O
Patika O O
and O O
TRANSPATH O O
(R) O O
) O O
( O O
5 O O
- O O
8 O O
) O O
, O O
just O O
to O O
name O O
a O O
few O O
. O O

So O O
far O O
, O O
however O O
, O O
their O O
main O O
focus O O
is O O
on O O
intracellular O O
processes O O
. O O

This O O
shortcoming O O
is O O
part O O
of O O
the O O
more O O
comprehensive O O
problem O O
, O O
the O O
genotype O O
- O O
phenotype O O
gap O O
: O O
from O O
a O O
certain O O
genotype O O
, O O
we O O
are O O
able O O
to O O
infer O O
a O O
' O O
molecular O O
phenotype O O
' O O
, O O
but O O
for O O
correlating O O
it O O
with O O
a O O
more O O
complex O O
phenotype O O
such O O
as O O
a O O
biological O O
process O O
, O O
or O O
even O O
a O O
certain O O
disease O O
and O O
its O O
clinical O O
appearance O O
, O O
we O O
still O O
depend O O
largely O O
on O O
the O O
mere O O
description O O
of O O
an O O
observed O O
correlation O O
. O O

There O O
is O O
no O O
way O O
to O O
infer O O
such O O
a O O
phenotype O O
through O O
all O O
the O O
different O O
layers O O
of O O
increasing O O
complexity O O
between O O
genomic O O
DNA O O
sequences O O
and O O
the O O
physiological O O
function O O
of O O
whole O O
organs O O
and O O
their O O
interplay O O
within O O
an O O
organism O O
. O O

There O O
may O O
be O O
principal O O
barriers O O
preventing O O
such O O
an O O
inference O O
across O O
different O O
complexity O O
levels O O
, O O
but O O
even O O
to O O
explore O O
these O O
limits O O
, O O
we O O
have O O
to O O
make O O
attempts O O
to O O
bridge O O
the O O
genotype O O
- O O
phenotype O O
gap O O
. O O

We O O
have O O
to O O
do O O
the O O
next O O
step O O
towards O O
modeling O O
intercellular O O
networks O O
that O O
are O O
inextricably O O
linked O O
to O O
the O O
physiology O O
of O O
multicellular O O
organisms O O
( O O
13 O O
) O O
. O O

Being O O
one O O
of O O
the O O
most O O
complex O O
constructs O O
in O O
the O O
body O O
, O O
the O O
endocrine O O
system O O
comprises O O
numerous O O
cells O O
and O O
tissues O O
that O O
secrete O O
hormones O O
which O O
pass O O
through O O
the O O
body O O
, O O
activate O O
specific O O
receptors O O
of O O
target O O
cells O O
and O O
initiate O O
there O O
multiple O O
intracellular O O
signaling O O
pathways O O
. O O

Here O O
, O O
we O O
present O O
a O O
new O O
database O O
, O O
EndoNet O O
, O O
which O O
provides O O
information O O
about O O
the O O
components O O
of O O
endocrine O O
networks O O
and O O
their O O
relations O O
, O O
and O O
enables O O
the O O
analysis O O
of O O
intercellular O O
regulatory O O
pathways O O
in O O
humans B B_BIO/B_DISEASE
. O O

The O O
EndoNet O O
database O O
is O O
accessible O O
at O O
. O O

RESULTS O O

The O O
biological O O
schema O O
of O O
endocrine O O
actions O O

Development O O
and O O
function O O
of O O
different O O
organs O O
as O O
well O O
as O O
the O O
response O O
of O O
a O O
whole O O
multicellular O O
organism O O
to O O
its O O
environment O O
is O O
coordinated O O
through O O
a O O
complex O O
communication O O
system O O
between O O
specialized O O
cells O O
that O O
are O O
part O O
of O O
its O O
organs O O
. O O

This O O
communication O O
is O O
mostly O O
mediated O O
by O O
hormones O O
. O O

In O O
a O O
broader O O
sense O O
, O O
this O O
functional O O
class O O
of O O
biomolecules O O
also O O
comprises O O
growth O O
factors O O
, O O
cytokines O O
, O O
chemokines O O
and O O
other O O
signal O O
transmitters O O
. O O

This O O
generic O O
view O O
is O O
supported O O
, O O
for O O
instance O O
, O O
by O O
the O O
definition O O
given O O
for O O
' O O
hormone O O
activity O O
' O O
by O O
Gene O O
Ontology O O
( O O
GO O O
) O O
( O O
14 O O
) O O
: O O
' O O
Any O O
substance O O
formed O O
in O O
very O O
small O O
amounts O O
in O O
one O O
specialized O O
organ O O
or O O
group O O
of O O
cells O O
and O O
carried O O
( O O
sometimes O O
in O O
the O O
bloodstream O O
) O O
to O O
another O O
organ O O
or O O
group O O
of O O
cells O O
, O O
in O O
the O O
same O O
organism O O
, O O
upon O O
which O O
it O O
has O O
a O O
specific O O
regulatory O O
action O O
' O O
. O O

This O O
definition O O
is O O
also O O
broad O O
enough O O
to O O
include O O
modes O O
of O O
hormonal O O
actions O O
as O O
diverse O O
as O O
endocrine O O
, O O
paracrine O O
and O O
autocrine O O
effects O O
. O O

Accordingly O O
, O O
with O O
the O O
term O O
' O O
hormone O O
' O O
one O O
might O O
refer O O
to O O
any O O
extracellular O O
substance O O
that O O
induces O O
specific O O
responses O O
in O O
target O O
cell O O
and O O
helps O O
to O O
coordinate O O
growth O O
, O O
differentiation O O
, O O
gene O O
expression O O
and O O
metabolic O O
activities O O
of O O
various O O
cells O O
, O O
tissues O O
and O O
organs O O
in O O
multicellular O O
organisms O O
( O O
15 O O
) O O
. O O

Hormones O O
can O O
be O O
classified O O
based O O
on O O
their O O
chemical O O
nature O O
, O O
solubility O O
, O O
the O O
distance O O
over O O
which O O
the O O
signal O O
acts O O
and O O
so O O
on O O
( O O
15 O O
, O O
16 O O
) O O
. O O

From O O
the O O
viewpoint O O
of O O
genome O O
- O O
phenotype O O
relations O O
, O O
it O O
is O O
reasonable O O
to O O
distinguish O O
between O O
polypeptide O O
, O O
thus O O
, O O
genome O O
- O O
encoded O O
hormones O O
, O O
on O O
one O O
hand O O
, O O
and O O
those O O
low O O
- O O
molecular O O
weight O O
hormones O O
such O O
as O O
steroids O O
, O O
with O O
only O O
the O O
machinery O O
of O O
their O O
synthesis O O
being O O
genome O O
- O O
encoded O O
, O O
on O O
the O O
other O O
hand O O
. O O

Another O O
classification O O
of O O
hormones O O
, O O
which O O
seems O O
to O O
be O O
overlapping O O
with O O
the O O
previous O O
one O O
refers O O
to O O
the O O
intracellular O O
location O O
of O O
their O O
receptors O O
and O O
, O O
thus O O
, O O
how O O
the O O
subsequent O O
signal O O
is O O
further O O
transduced O O
: O O
membrane O O
- O O
bound O O
receptors O O
usually O O
trigger O O
more O O
or O O
less O O
complex O O
signaling O O
cascades O O
towards O O
the O O
nucleus O O
, O O
whereas O O
nuclear O O
receptors O O
, O O
mainly O O
bound O O
by O O
low O O
- O O
molecular O O
weight O O
hormones O O
, O O
have O O
a O O
very O O
short O O
signaling O O
pathway O O
downstream O O
since O O
they O O
act O O
as O O
transcription O O
factors O O
themselves O O
( O O
15 O O
, O O
16 O O
) O O
. O O

In O O
intercellular O O
communication O O
, O O
we O O
can O O
basically O O
differentiate O O
between O O
two O O
kinds O O
of O O
cells O O
: O O
donor O O
cells O O
which O O
synthesize O O
and O O
secrete O O
a O O
hormone O O
, O O
and O O
acceptor O O
cells O O
which O O
express O O
a O O
hormone O O
receptor O O
( O O
Figure O O
1a O O
) O O
. O O

Donor O O
cells O O
become O O
active O O
under O O
the O O
influence O O
of O O
an O O
external O O
, O O
mostly O O
environmental O O
, O O
stimulus O O
. O O

In O O
the O O
acceptor O O
cell O O
, O O
binding O O
of O O
the O O
hormone O O
to O O
a O O
receptor O O
triggers O O
an O O
intracellular O O
signal O O
transduction O O
cascade O O
with O O
different O O
kinds O O
of O O
end O O
nodes O O
and O O
effects O O
: O O
transcription O O
factors O O
affecting O O
the O O
gene O O
expression O O
program O O
of O O
the O O
acceptor O O
cell O O
, O O
metabolic O O
enzymes O O
controlling O O
the O O
cell O O
' O O
s O O
metabolism O O
, O O
structural O O
components O O
which O O
define O O
the O O
acceptor O O
' O O
s O O
morphological O O
features O O
, O O
or O O
components O O
of O O
the O O
secretory O O
apparatus O O
regulating O O
the O O
release O O
of O O
other O O
extracellular O O
molecules O O
. O O

If O O
synthesis O O
and O O
secretion O O
of O O
another O O
hormone O O
is O O
among O O
the O O
effects O O
exerted O O
by O O
receptor O O
activation O O
, O O
the O O
acceptor O O
is O O
turned O O
into O O
a O O
donor O O
cell O O
, O O
thus O O
becoming O O
an O O
internal O O
node O O
of O O
the O O
organism O O
' O O
s O O
endocrine O O
network O O
. O O

Acceptor O O
cells O O
which O O
do O O
not O O
become O O
producers O O
of O O
another O O
hormone O O
are O O
called O O
' O O
terminal O O
target O O
cells O O
' O O
of O O
the O O
endocrine O O
network O O
, O O
but O O
finally O O
constitute O O
the O O
overall O O
physiological O O
effect O O
of O O
the O O
respective O O
hormonal O O
pathway O O
, O O
or O O
simply O O
the O O
phenotype O O
( O O
Figure O O
1a O O
) O O
. O O

The O O
EndoNet O O
data O O
model O O

In O O
the O O
EndoNet O O
data O O
model O O
, O O
two O O
classes O O
of O O
entities O O
-- O O
hormones O O
( O O
in O O
the O O
broadest O O
sense O O
) O O
and O O
their O O
acceptor O O
or O O
target O O
cells O O
expressing O O
the O O
corresponding O O
receptors O O
-- O O
span O O
a O O
bipartite O O
directed O O
graph O O
. O O

Since O O
one O O
and O O
the O O
same O O
hormone O O
may O O
be O O
secreted O O
by O O
multiple O O
cell O O
types O O
( O O
donor O O
cells O O
) O O
, O O
each O O
such O O
secretion O O
event O O
is O O
represented O O
by O O
a O O
hormone O O
node O O
on O O
its O O
own O O
. O O

Similarly O O
, O O
each O O
cell O O
type O O
known O O
to O O
express O O
a O O
hormone O O
receptor O O
( O O
acceptor O O
cell O O
) O O
leads O O
to O O
an O O
individual O O
node O O
. O O

The O O
graph O O
' O O
s O O
edges O O
represent O O
hormone O O
transport O O
and O O
binding O O
to O O
a O O
receptor O O
( O O
intercellular O O
edges O O
) O O
, O O
on O O
one O O
hand O O
, O O
and O O
triggering O O
or O O
inhibition O O
of O O
hormone O O
secretion O O
by O O
a O O
receptor O O
activated O O
by O O
hormone O O
binding O O
( O O
intracellular O O
edges O O
) O O
, O O
on O O
the O O
other O O
hand O O
. O O

Optionally O O
, O O
an O O
edge O O
representing O O
the O O
transport O O
of O O
a O O
hormone O O
can O O
be O O
subdivided O O
by O O
introducing O O
the O O
transport O O
medium O O
( O O
usually O O
blood O O
) O O
as O O
an O O
additional O O
, O O
intermediary O O
node O O
. O O

Thus O O
, O O
in O O
the O O
conceptual O O
schema O O
of O O
the O O
EndoNet O O
database O O
( O O
Figure O O
1b O O
) O O
, O O
the O O
links O O
between O O
cells O O
/ O O
organs O O
and O O
hormone O O
define O O
donor O O
cells O O
( O O
' O O
D O O
' O O
) O O
, O O
those O O
between O O
cells O O
/ O O
organs O O
and O O
receptors O O
acceptor O O
cells O O
( O O
' O O
A O O
' O O
) O O
. O O

If O O
an O O
acceptor O O
cell O O
synthesizes O O
another O O
hormone O O
in O O
response O O
to O O
an O O
incoming O O
signal O O
, O O
it O O
becomes O O
an O O
internal O O
node O O
in O O
the O O
emerging O O
hormonal O O
network O O
. O O

In O O
EndoNet O O
, O O
the O O
pathway O O
between O O
a O O
hormone O O
receptor O O
expressed O O
in O O
an O O
acceptor O O
cell O O
and O O
a O O
hormone O O
synthesized O O
in O O
the O O
same O O
cell O O
( O O
intracellular O O
edge O O
) O O
is O O
handled O O
as O O
a O O
black O O
box O O
. O O

In O O
case O O
of O O
genome O O
- O O
encoded O O
peptide O O
hormones O O
, O O
cross O O
- O O
references O O
to O O
entries O O
in O O
the O O
TRANSPATH O O
(R) O O
database O O
, O O
which O O
describe O O
the O O
signaling O O
cascade O O
starting O O
from O O
the O O
hormone O O
' O O
s O O
receptor O O
and O O
ending O O
at O O
the O O
hormone O O
' O O
s O O
gene O O
, O O
are O O
provided O O
, O O
if O O
available O O
. O O

Datasets O O
on O O
non O O
- O O
peptide O O
hormones O O
will O O
in O O
future O O
be O O
enriched O O
by O O
a O O
specific O O
metabolic O O
add O O
- O O
on O O
which O O
will O O
include O O
references O O
to O O
the O O
databases O O

( O O
1 O O
) O O
and O O
BRENDA O O
( O O
17 O O
) O O
, O O
allowing O O
for O O
further O O
characterization O O
of O O
the O O
steps O O
performed O O
during O O
the O O
hormone O O
' O O
s O O
synthesis O O
and O O
the O O
regulation O O
of O O
both O O
activity O O
and O O
expression O O
of O O
the O O
enzymes O O
involved O O
. O O

By O O
now O O
, O O
the O O
EndoNet O O
structure O O
already O O
allows O O
for O O
including O O
descriptions O O
of O O
the O O
physiological O O
effects O O
induced O O
by O O
hormone O O
binding O O
( O O
see O O
below O O
, O O
Future O O
Developments O O
) O O
. O O

The O O
contents O O
of O O
EndoNet O O

In O O
the O O
present O O
version O O
of O O
EndoNet O O
, O O
and O O
as O O
a O O
first O O
approach O O
, O O
we O O
consider O O
the O O
endocrine O O
( O O
hormonal O O
) O O
network O O
of O O
the O O
human B B_PERSON/B_SPECIES[BIO]
body O O
. O O

For O O
each O O
molecule O O
( O O
hormone O O
or O O
receptor O O
) O O
, O O
a O O
primary O O
name O O
and O O
synonyms O O
are O O
given O O
. O O

In O O
case O O
of O O
peptide O O
hormones O O
, O O
the O O
sequence O O
of O O
the O O
processed O O
polypeptide O O
, O O
rather O O
than O O
that O O
of O O
the O O
protein O O

, O O
is O O
specified O O
. O O

For O O
a O O
multimeric O O

the O O
subunit O O
composition O O
as O O
well O O
as O O
the O O
sequences O O
of O O
all O O
subunits O O
are O O
stored O O
; O O
the O O
same O O
holds O O
true O O
for O O
hormone O O
receptors O O
. O O

Additionally O O
, O O
all O O
peptide O O
hormone O O

have O O
links O O
to O O
HumanPSD O O
(TM) O O
( O O
18 O O
) O O
and O O
to O O
the O O
Swiss O O
- O O
Prot O O
database O O
, O O
The O O
structures O O
of O O
non O O
- O O

hormones O O
can O O
be O O
accessed O O
through O O
the O O
corresponding O O
hyperlinks O O
to O O
the O O

section O O
. O O

Finally O O
, O O
all O O
molecules O O
may O O
have O O
links O O
to O O
the O O
TRANSPATH O O
(R) O O
database O O
. O O

As O O
described O O
, O O
EndoNet O O
utilizes O O
data O O
about O O
the O O
tissues O O
from O O
which O O
hormones O O
are O O
secreted O O
and O O
in O O
which O O
receptors O O
are O O
expressed O O
to O O
define O O
donor O O
and O O
acceptor O O
cells O O
, O O
respectively O O
. O O

The O O
identity O O
and O O
anatomical O O
environment O O
of O O
cell O O
types O O
, O O
tissues O O
and O O
organs O O
is O O
defined O O
through O O
references O O
to O O
the O O
CYTOMER O O
(R) O O
ontology O O
( O O
19 O O
, O O
20 O O
) O O
; O O
in O O
the O O

cases O O
where O O
the O O
receptors O O
are O O
ubiquitously O O
expressed O O
, O O
just O O
the O O
root O O
term O O
' O O
human B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_CELL[BODY_PART_OR_ORGAN_COMPONENT]
body O O
' O O
is O O
linked O O
. O O

Data O O
on O O
whether O O
a O O
hormone O O
' O O
s O O
synthesis O O
is O O
triggered O O
or O O
inhibited O O
by O O
another O O
hormone O O
through O O
its O O

receptor O O
in O O
a O O

was O O
obtained O O
by O O
manual O O
selection O O
from O O
textbooks O O
[ O O

. O O

( O O

( O O

) O O
, O O

( O O

(R) O O

- O O

) O O
. O O

The O O
contents O O
of O O
EndoNet O O
are O O
summarized O O
in O O
Table O O
1 O O
. O O

Web O O
interface O O

visualization O O

EndoNet O O
can O O
be O O
accessed O O
through O O
the O O

via O O
a O O

- O O
based O O

interface O O
. O O

Hormones O O
, O O
receptors O O
and O O
tissues O O
can O O
be O O
queried O O
for O O
their O O
names O O

information O O
on O O

components O O
is O O
available O O
through O O
individual O O
characteristics O O
pages O O

Each O O
hormone O O
' O O
s O O
individual O O
entry O O
page O O
displays O O
its O O
source O O
and O O
target O O
tissues O O
( O O
donor O O
and O O
acceptor O O
cells O O
) O O
as O O
well O O
as O O
its O O
receptors O O
, O O
along O O
with O O
some O O
molecular O O
data O O
. O O

Similarly O O
, O O
each O O
receptor O O
entry O O
exhibits O O
the O O
tissues O O
in O O
which O O
the O O
receptor O O
is O O
expressed O O
, O O
and O O
the O O
hormones O O
it O O
interacts O O
with O O
. O O

Finally O O
, O O
each O O
tissue O O
entry O O
lists O O
the O O
hormone O O
receptors O O
that O O
are O O
found O O
in O O
, O O
as O O
well O O
as O O
the O O
hormones O O
that O O
are O O
synthesized O O
and O O

the O O
tissue O O
. O O

It O O
is O O
also O O
indicated O O
whether O O
the O O
corresponding O O
tissue O O
exerts O O
gender O O
- O O
specific O O
properties O O
; O O
additional O O
information O O
based O O
on O O
the O O
CYTOMER O O
(R) O O
ontology O O
is O O
available O O
through O O
the O O
corresponding O O
link O O
on O O
the O O
tissue O O
detail O O
page O O
. O O

Instead O O
of O O

for O O
a O O

of O O

, O O

can O O
also O O

featured O O
by O O
EndoNet O O
( O O
available O O
at O O

' O O
Search O O
' O O
page O O
) O O
. O O

Each O O
query O O
result O O
can O O
be O O
used O O
as O O
starting O O
point O O
for O O
an O O
extended O O
query O O
. O O

Different O O
items O O
of O O
interest O O
can O O
be O O
selected O O
and O O
added O O
to O O
a O O
common O O
result O O
set O O
. O O

Since O O
several O O
search O O
results O O
can O O
be O O
combined O O
, O O
it O O
is O O
possible O O
to O O
create O O
sets O O
with O O
multiple O O
search O O
parameters O O
. O O

At O O
any O O
step O O
of O O
this O O
incremental O O
retrieval O O
process O O
, O O
the O O
sets O O
of O O
hormones O O
, O O
receptors O O
and O O
tissues O O
obtained O O
so O O
far O O
can O O
be O O
used O O
as O O
starting O O
points O O
for O O
reconstructing O O
a O O
network O O
by O O
a O O
depth O O
- O O
first O O
graph O O
traversal O O
algorithm O O
. O O

The O O
maximum O O
number O O
of O O
steps O O
can O O
be O O
selected O O
separately O O
for O O
the O O
upstream O O
and O O
downstream O O
part O O
of O O
the O O
reconstruction O O
process O O
. O O

Subsequently O O
, O O
the O O
graph O O
will O O
be O O
displayed O O
using O O
a O O
Graphviz O O
- O O
based O O
visualization O O
method O O
[ O O
( O O
22 O O
) O O
, O O
] O O
. O O

In O O
the O O

, O O

and O O
receptors O O
are O O
represented O O
as O O
nodes O O
grouped O O
together O O
into O O
subgraphs O O
representing O O
the O O
tissues O O
( O O
cells O O
/ O O
organs O O
) O O
they O O
are O O
secreted O O
from O O
or O O
expressed O O
in O O
, O O
respectively O O
( O O
Figure O O
2 O O
) O O
. O O

Autocrine O O
loops O O
( O O
donor O O
and O O
acceptor O O
cell O O
being O O
identical O O
) O O
are O O
treated O O
specially O O
for O O
visualization O O
. O O

On O O
demand O O
, O O
the O O
hormones O O
' O O
transport O O
media O O
can O O
be O O
included O O
in O O
the O O
visualization O O
of O O
intercellular O O
edges O O
, O O
enabling O O
the O O
user O O
to O O
choose O O
between O O
different O O
complexities O O
of O O
output O O
. O O

Intracellular O O
edges O O
, O O
which O O
connect O O
a O O
receptor O O
to O O
a O O
hormone O O
, O O
represent O O
the O O
influence O O
of O O
a O O
receptor O O
' O O
s O O
activation O O
on O O
the O O
secretion O O
of O O
a O O
hormone O O
from O O
the O O
same O O
cell O O
and O O
are O O
displayed O O
differently O O
, O O
depending O O
on O O
whether O O
this O O
influence O O
is O O
triggering O O
or O O
inhibitory O O
in O O
nature O O
. O O

The O O
graph O O
is O O
displayed O O
as O O
a O O
clickable O O
image O O
map O O
, O O
linking O O
each O O
entity O O
to O O
its O O
detailed O O
characteristics O O
page O O
, O O
thus O O
making O O
the O O
database O O
entries O O
accessible O O
from O O
the O O
graphical O O
overview O O
of O O
a O O
network O O
, O O
too O O
. O O

The O O
graph O O
is O O
available O O
in O O
two O O
different O O
formats O O
: O O
PNG O O
and O O
SVG O O
. O O

While O O
virtually O O
every O O
browser O O
supports O O
PNG O O
( O O
a O O
' O O
pixel O O
' O O
or O O
' O O
bitmap O O
' O O
format O O
) O O
, O O
only O O
a O O
few O O
of O O
them O O
provide O O
a O O
zoom O O
functionality O O
for O O
bitmap O O
pictures O O
. O O

Scalable O O
vector O O
graphics O O
, O O
( O O
SVG O O
) O O
provides O O
more O O
functionality O O
( O O
including O O
perfect O O
image O O
quality O O
throughout O O
all O O
zoom O O
factors O O
) O O
, O O
but O O
until O O
now O O
most O O
browsers O O
do O O
not O O

natively O O
and O O

( O O

for O O

this O O
vector O O
- O O
based O O

Some O O
well O O
- O O

are O O

as O O

DISCUSSION O O

At O O
its O O
present O O
state O O

provides O O

of O O

considered O O
as O O

as O O

and O O

and O O

The O O
aim O O
of O O
the O O
database O O
is O O
to O O
provide O O
a O O

for O O

the O O

of O O

in O O

of O O

( O O

[ O O

in O O
( O O

] O O

EndoNet O O
database O O

not O O

but O O
will O O
grow O O
rapidly O O
. O O

differences O O
in O O

Abstract O O

Background O O

The O O
increase O O
in O O
the O O
prevalence O O
of O O
insulin O O
resistance O O
- O O
related O O
metabolic O O
syndrome O O
, O O
a O O
disorder O O
that O O
greatly O O
increases O O
the O O
risk O O
of O O
diabetes O O
, O O
heart O O
attack O O
and O O
stroke O O
, O O
is O O
alarming O O
. O O

One O O
of O O
the O O
most O O
frequent O O
and O O
early O O
symptoms O O
of O O
metabolic O O
syndrome O O
is O O
hypertriglyceridemia O O
. O O

We O O
examined O O
the O O
gender O O
differences O O
between O O
various O O
metabolic O O
factors O O
related O O
to O O
insulin O O
resistance O O
in O O
elderly O O
non O O
- O O
diabetic O O
men B B_PERSON
and O O
postmenopausal O O
women B B_PERSON
of O O
comparable O O
age O O
suffering O O
from O O
hypertriglyceridemia O O
, O O
and O O
compared O O
them O O
with O O
healthy O O
subjects O O
of O O
equal O O
age O O
. O O

Results O O

The O O
indexes O O
of O O
insulin O O
resistance O O
HOMA O O
IR O O
and O O
QUICKI O O
were O O
significantly O O
higher O O
in O O
both O O
hyperlipemic O O
men B B_PERSON
and O O
women B B_PERSON/B_BIO
than O O
in O O
controls O O
; O O
95 O O
% O O
confidence O O
limits O O
of O O
hyperlipemic O O
subjects O O
did O O
not O O
overlap O O
with O O
controls O O
. O O

In O O
both O O
normolipemic O O
and O O
hyperlipemic O O
men B B_PERSON
and O O
women B B_PERSON/B_BIO
serum O O
leptin O O
correlated O O
significantly O O
with O O
insulin O O
resistance O O
, O O
while O O
HDL O O
- O O
cholesterol O O
correlated O O
inversely O O
with O O
HOMA O O
- O O
IR O O
only O O
in O O
women B B_PERSON/B_BIO
( O O
both O O
normo O O
- O O
and O O
hyperlipemic O O
) O O
, O O
and O O
serum O O
tumor O O
necrosis O O
factor O O
alpha O O
( O O
TNF O O
alpha O O
) O O
only O O
in O O
hyperlipemic O O
women B B_PERSON/B_BIO
. O O

According O O
to O O
results O O
of O O
multiple O O
regression O O
analysis O O
with O O
HOMA O O
- O O
IR O O
as O O
a O O
dependent O O
variable O O
, O O
leptin O O
played O O
a O O

in O O
determining O O
insulin O O
resistance O O
in O O
both O O
genders O O
, O O
but O O
- O O
aside O O
from O O
leptin O O
- O O
triglycerides O O
, O O
TNF O O
alpha O O
and O O
decreased O O
HDL O O
- O O
cholesterol O O
were O O
significant O O
determinants O O
in O O
women B B_PERSON/B_BIO
, O O
while O O
body O O
mass O O
index O O
and O O
decreased O O
HDL O O
- O O
cholesterol O O
were O O
significant O O
determinants O O
in O O
men B B_PERSON
. O O

The O O
coefficient O O
of O O
determination O O
( O O
R2 O O
) O O
of O O
HOMA O O
IR O O
by O O
above O O
mentioned O O
metabolic O O
variables O O
was O O
in O O
women B B_PERSON/B_BIO
above O O
60 O O
% O O
, O O
in O O
men B B_PERSON
only O O
about O O
40 O O
% O O
. O O

Conclusion O O

The O O
significant O O
role O O
of O O
serum O O
leptin O O
in O O
determination O O
of O O
insulin O O
resistance O O
in O O

elderly O O

and O O
postmenopausal O O
women B B_PERSON
of O O

was O O

However O O

significant O O

in O O
women B B_PERSON/B_BIO
a O O

of O O
triglycerides O O
, O O
TNF O O
alpha O O
and O O
decreased O O
HDL O O
- O O
cholesterol O O
, O O
in O O
men B B_PERSON
only O O
a O O
mild O O
role O O
of O O
BMI O O
and O O
decreased O O
HDL O O
- O O
cholesterol O O
. O O

Background O O

In O O
association O O
with O O
pandemic O O
obesity O O
the O O
prevalence O O
of O O
the O O
insulin O O
resistance O O
- O O
related O O
metabolic O O
syndrome O O
is O O
constantly O O
growing O O
[ O O
1 O O
] O O
. O O

As O O
a O O
consequence O O
of O O
this O O
fact O O
, O O
type O O
2 O O
diabetes O O
mellitus O O
and O O
cardiovascular O O
mortality O O
occurs O O
in O O
much O O
younger O O
age O O
groups O O
[ O O
2 O O
] O O
. O O

A O O
typical O O

of O O
an O O
increase O O
of O O
serum O O

of O O

is O O
a O O

and O O

of O O
this O O

[ O O
3 O O
] O O
. O O

With O O
increasing O O
age O O

body O O

index O O
( O O

) O O
and O O

, O O
insulin O O

declines O O
and O O
the O O

of O O

risk O O
factors O O
increases O O
in O O
both O O
genders O O
[ O O
4 O O
- O O
6 O O
] O O
. O O

It O O
was O O
repeatedly O O
demonstrated O O
that O O
plasma O O
concentration O O
of O O
leptin O O
- O O
a O O

mainly O O
by O O

tissue O O
- O O
is O O
substantially O O
higher O O
in O O
all O O
age O O
groups O O
of O O
women B B_PERSON/B_BIO
than O O
in O O
men B B_PERSON/B_BIO
[ O O
7 O O
- O O
10 O O
] O O
. O O

This O O
may O O
be O O
caused O O
by O O
different O O
size O O
and O O
/ O O
or O O
distribution O O
of O O
fat O O
tissue O O
compartments O O
influenced O O

: O O

stimulate O O
, O O
whereas O O

inhibits O O

secretion O O
. O O

In O O
women B B_PERSON/B_BIO
subcutaneous O O

mass O O
prevails O O
- O O
and O O
during O O
augmentation O O
of O O

increases O O
- O O
while O O
in O O
men B B_PERSON
intra O O
- O O
abdominal O O
fat O O

prevails O O
[ O O
11 O O
- O O
13 O O
] O O
. O O

Subcutaneous O O
fat O O
in O O

serves O O
as O O
a O O
substantial O O
source O O
of O O

necrosis O O
factor O O
alpha O O
( O O

alpha O O
) O O

that O O
interfere O O
with O O
insulin O O
signal O O
transduction O O
into O O
the O O
cells O O
[ O O
14 O O
- O O
16 O O
] O O
. O O

Leptin O O
, O O
TNF O O
alpha O O
and O O
some O O
other O O
factors O O
are O O
abundantly O O
expressed O O
in O O

and O O
contribute O O
to O O
the O O

that O O
accompanies O O

and O O

Leptin O O
correlates O O
positively O O
with O O

, O O

, O O

and O O

correlates O O
inversely O O
with O O
HDL O O
- O O
cholesterol O O
and O O

[ O O
17 O O
- O O
25 O O
] O O
. O O

The O O
incidence O O
and O O

of O O

heart O O
disease O O
and O O
of O O

of O O

with O O

In O O

, O O

of O O

of O O

After O O

The O O

of O O

. O O

Methods O O

Subjects O O

The O O

was O O

on O O

out O O
- O O

at O O

Statistics O O

6 O O

The O O

- O O

tests O O
were O O
used O O
in O O
testing O O
the O O

of O O
distribution O O
. O O

Some O O
of O O
the O O
data O O

were O O
not O O

. O O

The O O

of O O

between O O

' O O
s O O

- O O

was O O
used O O
for O O

analysis O O
. O O

analysis O O
was O O

using O O

of O O

resistance O O
as O O

- O O

) O O

variables O O
. O O

The O O
so O O
- O O
called O O
step O O
- O O
down O O
regression O O
model O O
was O O
used O O
to O O
select O O
dominant O O
independent O O
variables O O
. O O

Various O O
four O O
- O O

groups O O
of O O
independent O O
( O O

) O O
variables O O
were O O
used O O
for O O
the O O
analysis O O

- O O

was O O

The O O
independent O O
variables O O
were O O
then O O

, O O
one O O
at O O

to O O

dependent O O
variable O O
( O O
i O O
. O O
e O O
. O O
that O O
showed O O
the O O
least O O
p O O
- O O

in O O
the O O
test O O
of O O

regression O O
coefficient O O
being O O
zero O O
) O O
was O O

The O O
coefficient O O
of O O
determination O O

, O O
which O O
can O O

as O O

. O O

A O O
great O O
drop O O
in O O
R2 O O
after O O

some O O
independent O O
variable O O
enabled O O
selection O O
of O O

to O O

of O O

dependent O O

. O O

Results O O

Table O O
1 O O
demonstrates O O
mean O O
parameters O O
in O O
individual O O
groups O O
of O O
subjects O O
matched O O
according O O
to O O

parameters O O
and O O
age O O

While O O

of O O
all O O

did O O
not O O
differ O O
substantially O O
, O O
the O O

of O O
total O O
serum O O

, O O

, O O

and O O

- O O

differ O O
very O O

in O O

and O O

groups O O
as O O
compared O O
with O O
controls O O
. O O

In O O
addition O O
, O O
the O O
concentration O O
of O O
triglycerides O O
in O O
control O O
women B B_PERSON
was O O
significantly O O
higher O O
than O O
in O O
control O O
men B B_PERSON
, O O
the O O
concentration O O
of O O
triglycerides O O
in O O
hyperlipemic O O
women B B_PERSON
was O O
lower O O
than O O
in O O
hyperlipemic O O
men B B_PERSON
, O O
and O O
the O O
concentration O O
of O O
HDL O O
- O O

in O O

women B B_PERSON
was O O
very O O
significantly O O
higher O O
when O O
compared O O
with O O
hyperlipemic O O
men B B_PERSON
. O O

2 O O
shows O O

On O O

. O O

From O O
Fig O O
. O O

1 O O
, O O
presenting O O
95 O O
% O O

of O O

of O O

than O O
in O O

did O O
not O O

each O O

. O O

In O O

of O O

, O O

. O O

In O O

of O O

' O O

In O O

, O O
serum O O
triglycerids O O
, O O

. O O

of O O

in O O

In O O

to O O

Alexithymia O O
and O O
anxiety O O
in O O
female O O

Abstract O O

Objectives O O

Alexithymia O O
is O O
highly O O
prevalent O O
among O O
chronic O O
pain O O
patients B B_PERSON/B_DISEASE
. O O

Pain O O
is O O
a O O
remarkable O O
cause O O
for O O
high O O
levels O O
of O O
chronic O O
anxiety O O
. O O

The O O
purpose O O
of O O
this O O

was O O
to O O
investigate O O
the O O

of O O

to O O
determine O O
anxiety O O

among O O

- O O
IV O O
somatoform O O
pain O O
disorder O O
( O O
chronic O O
pain O O
) O O

and O O
to O O

the O O

between O O

and O O
the O O
self O O
- O O

of O O

. O O

Methods O O

Thirty O O
adult O O
females O O
( O O
mean O O
age O O
: O O
34 O O
, O O
63 O O
+/- O O

( O O

- O O

. O O

Thirty O O
seven O O
healthy O O

( O O

34 O O
, O O

+/- O O

years O O
) O O

who O O
matched O O
for O O
sociodemographic O O

with O O
the O O

, O O

the O O
control O O
group O O
. O O

A O O
sociodemographic O O
data O O
form O O
, O O
26 O O
- O O
item O O
Toronto O O
Alexithymia O O
Scale O O
( O O

- O O
26 O O
) O O
, O O

( O O

on O O

of O O

including O O

( O O
measured O O
by O O

) O O

and O O

. O O

Results O O

Chronic O O
pain O O
patients B B_PERSON/B_DRUG[THERAPEUTIC_OR_PREVENTIVE_PROCEDURE]
were O O
found O O
significantly O O
more O O
alexithymic O O
than O O
controls O O
. O O

There O O
was O O
a O O
positive O O
correlation O O
between O O
TAS O O
- O O

scores O O
and O O
the O O

of O O

. O O

The O O

and O O

did O O
not O O

in O O

of O O

Neither O O

nor O O

was O O

between O O
