Environmental O O
Health O O
Perspectives O O

Controlled O O
exposure O O
of O O
animals O O
with O O
chronic O O
bronchitis O O
and O O
control O O
animals O O
to O O
concentrated O O

particles O O
also O O

of O O

disease O O
in O O

to O O

particles O O
( O O

) O O
. O O

This O O
has O O
led O O
to O O
the O O
hypothesis O O
that O O
the O O
cardiovascular O O
effects O O
of O O
air O O
pollution O O
are O O
predominantly O O
in O O
persons B B_PERSON/B_ORGANIZATION
with O O

. O O

There O O
has O O
been O O
even O O
less O O
done O O
to O O

potential O O

of O O

of O O

on O O

The O O
existing O O
literature O O
on O O

per O O
se O O
seems O O
to O O
increase O O
the O O
risk O O
of O O
adverse O O
outcomes O O
( O O
22 O O
<FFFD> O O

) O O
. O O

Little O O
is O O
known O O
about O O
the O O
role O O
of O O
these O O
comorbidities O O
as O O
effect O O
modifiers O O
for O O
the O O

of O O

This O O

from O O

Materials O O
and O O
Methods O O
Health O O
data O O
. O O

The O O
Health O O
Care O O
Financing O O
Administration O O
( O O

MD O O
) O O
maintains O O
records O O
of O O
every O O
hospital O O
admission O O
for O O
Medicare O O
participants B B_PERSON/B_ORGANIZATION
in O O
the O O
United O O
States O O
. O O

Persons B B_PERSON/B_ENT
in O O
this O O
database O O
have O O
a O O
unique O O
identifier O O
. O O

Using O O
this O O
identifier O O
, O O
we O O
traced O O
every O O
hospital O O
admission O O
for O O
heart O O
and O O
lung O O
disease O O
for O O
each O O
person B B_PERSON/B_LOCATION
in O O
Cook O O
County O O
, O O
Illinois O O
, O O
between O O
1985 O O
and O O
1994 O O
. O O

We O O
chose O O
Cook O O
County O O
because O O
it O O
is O O
the O O
most O O
populous O O

county O O
in O O
the O O
United O O
States O O
with O O
daily O O
monitoring O O
for O O
particulate O O
matter O O
with O O
aerodynamic O O
diameter O O
< O O
10 O O
<FFFD> O O
m O O
( O O
PM10 O O
) O O
. O O

The O O
data O O
were O O
then O O
analyzed O O
to O O
look O O
at O O
effect O O
modification O O
by O O
concurrent O O
and O O
preexisting O O
conditions O O
as O O
well O O
as O O
by O O
age O O
, O O
race O O
, O O
and O O
sex O O
. O O

To O O
establish O O
a O O
baseline O O
risk O O
, O O
we O O
computed O O
daily O O
counts O O
of O O
hospital O O
admissions O O
for O O
cardiovascular O O
disease O O
( O O
CVD O O
) O O
[ O O
International O O
Classification O O
of O O
Disease O O
, O O
9th O O
edition O O
, O O
World O O
Health O O
Organization O O
, O O
Geneva O O
( O O
ICD O O
- O O
9 O O
) O O
code O O
390 O O
<FFFD> O O
429 O O
] O O
, O O
pneumonia O O
( O O
ICD O O
- O O
9 O O
code O O
480 O O
<FFFD> O O
487 O O
) O O
, O O
and O O
COPD O O
( O O
ICD O O
- O O
9 O O
code O O
490 O O
<FFFD> O O
496 O O
, O O
excluding O O
493 O O
) O O
. O O

The O O
association O O
between O O
these O O
daily O O
counts O O
and O O
PM10 O O
was O O
examined O O
for O O
the O O
years O O
1988 O O
<FFFD> O O
1994 O O
, O O
when O O
daily O O
PM10 O O
monitoring O O
data O O
were O O
available O O
in O O
Chicago O O
. O O

Once O O
our O O
baseline O O
risks O O
were O O
established O O
, O O
we O O
examined O O
three O O
classes O O
of O O
potential O O
effect O O

. O O

First O O
, O O
we O O
looked O O
at O O
whether O O
previous O O
admissions O O
for O O
selected O O
conditions O O
predisposed O O
persons B B_PERSON
to O O
having O O
a O O
greater O O
risk O O
from O O
air O O
pollution O O
. O O

For O O
each O O
of O O
the O O
three O O
admission O O
categories O O
( O O
CVD O O
, O O

, O O

) O O
, O O
we O O
considered O O
10 O O
causes O O
( O O
defined O O
by O O
a O O
previous O O
admission O O
) O O
as O O
effect O O
modifiers O O
: O O
COPD O O
( O O
ICD O O
- O O
9 O O
code O O
490 O O
<FFFD> O O
496 O O
except O O
493 O O
) O O
, O O

( O O

- O O
9 O O

) O O
, O O

) O O

, O O

( O O

9 O O

) O O
, O O

( O O

9 O O
code O O
428 O O
) O O
, O O

disorders O O
( O O

- O O

The O O
second O O
set O O
of O O
potential O O
predisposing O O
conditions O O
included O O
secondary O O
diagnoses O O
associated O O
with O O
the O O
index O O
admission O O
. O O

These O O
could O O
represent O O
the O O
presence O O
of O O
a O O
chronic O O
condition O O
( O O
e O O
. O O
g O O
. O O
, O O
COPD O O
) O O
that O O
has O O
not O O
resulted O O
in O O
a O O
previous O O
hospital O O
admission O O
. O O

They O O
could O O
also O O
represent O O
acute O O
conditions O O
that O O
may O O
have O O
increased O O
the O O
subjects O O
' O O
sensitivity O O
to O O
air O O
pollution O O
. O O

For O O
example O O
, O O
if O O
respiratory O O
infections O O
modified O O
the O O
effect O O
of O O
particulate O O
matter O O
on O O
the O O
cardiovascular O O
health O O
of O O
persons B B_PERSON
with O O
underlying O O
heart O O
disease O O
, O O
then O O
the O O
risk O O
of O O
a O O
hospital O O
admission O O
for O O
heart O O
disease O O
might O O
be O O
different O O
in O O
persons B B_PERSON/B_LOCATION
with O O
infections O O
. O O

If O O
this O O
were O O
true O O
, O O
then O O
the O O
risk O O
ratio O O
of O O
a O O
10 O O
- O O
<FFFD> O O
g O O
/ O O
m3 O O
increase O O
of O O
PM10 O O
on O O
cardiovascular O O
admissions O O
of O O
persons B B_PERSON
with O O
a O O
concurrent O O
respiratory O O
infection O O
would O O
be O O
different O O
from O O
the O O
ratio O O
in O O
persons B B_PERSON/B_LOCATION
without O O
respiratory O O
infection O O
. O O

To O O
test O O
these O O
hypotheses O O
, O O
we O O
computed O O
separate O O
daily O O
counts O O
of O O
admissions O O
for O O
events O O
with O O
and O O
without O O
the O O
concurrent O O
conditions O O
hypothesized O O
to O O
increase O O
sensitivity O O
to O O
air O O
pollution O O
. O O

These O O
were O O
taken O O
as O O
the O O
same O O
10 O O
conditions O O
in O O
the O O
first O O
analysis O O
with O O
certain O O
exclusions O O
for O O
pairing O O
that O O
would O O

. O O

That O O
is O O

of O O

as O O

for O O

, O O
pneumonia O O
and O O
COPD O O
were O O
not O O
possible O O
concurrent O O
conditions O O
for O O
each O O
other O O
. O O

of O O
predisposing O O

was O O

older O O
than O O

. O O

running O O

To O O

for O O

and O O

of O O

To O O
model O O

that O O

the O O

of O O

of O O

Methods O O
We O O
analyzed O O
the O O
data O O
with O O
a O O
generalized O O
additive O O
robust O O
Poisson O O
regression O O
model O O
( O O
32 O O
) O O
. O O

This O O
approach O O
has O O
become O O
the O O
norm O O
in O O
such O O
studies O O
( O O
14 O O
, O O
33 O O
, O O
34 O O
) O O
. O O

In O O
the O O
generalized O O
additive O O
model O O
the O O
outcome O O
is O O
assumed O O
to O O
depend O O
on O O
a O O
sum O O
of O O
nonparametric O O
smooth O O
functions O O
for O O
each O O
variable O O
that O O
models O O
the O O
potential O O
nonlinear O O
dependence O O
of O O
daily O O
admission O O
on O O
weather O O
and O O
season O O
. O O

The O O
model O O
is O O
of O O
the O O
form O O
: O O
log O O
[ O O
E O O
( O O
Yt O O
) O O
] O O
= O O
0 O O
+ O O
S1 O O
( O O
X1 O O
) O O
+ O O
. O O
. O O
. O O

+ O O
Sp O O
( O O
Xp O O
) O O
where O O
E O O
( O O
Yt O O
) O O
is O O
the O O
expected O O
value O O
of O O
the O O
daily O O
count O O
of O O
admissions O O
Yt O O
and O O
Si O O
are O O
the O O
smooth O O
functions O O
of O O
the O O
covariates O O
Xi O O
. O O

We O O
examined O O
temperature O O
, O O
previous O O
day O O
' O O
s O O
temperature O O
, O O
relative O O
humidity O O
, O O
barometric O O
pressure O O
, O O
and O O
day O O
of O O
week O O
covariates O O
. O O

The O O
locally O O
weighted O O

7 O O
. O O

0 O O
. O O
1 O O
0 O O
. O O

0 O O

Discussion O O
In O O
this O O
analysis O O
we O O
examined O O
whether O O

of O O
PM10 O O

of O O

found O O
that O O

was O O

of O O

that O O

<FFFD> O O
VOLUME O O
108 O O
| O O
NUMBER O O
9 O O
| O O
September O O
2000 O O

845 O O

Syndrome O O
of O O
arachnomelia O O
in O O
Simmental O O
cattle B B_BIO/B_PERSON

Abstract O O

Background O O

The O O
syndrome O O
of O O
arachnomelia O O
is O O
an O O
inherited O O
malformation O O
mainly O O
of O O
limbs O O
, O O
back O O
and O O
head O O
in O O
cattle B B_BIO/B_PERSON
. O O

At O O
present O O
the O O
arachnomelia O O
syndrome O O
has O O
been O O
well O O
known O O
mainly O O
in O O
Brown O O
Swiss O O
cattle B B_BIO/B_DISEASE
. O O

Nevertheless O O
, O O
the O O
arachnomelia O O
syndrome O O
had O O
been O O
observed O O
in O O
the O O
Hessian O O
Simmental O O
population O O
during O O
the O O
decade O O
1964 O O
- O O
1974 O O
. O O

The O O
goal O O
of O O
this O O
work O O
was O O
the O O
characterization O O
of O O
the O O
morphology O O
and O O
genealogy O O
of O O
the O O
syndrome O O
in O O
Simmental O O
to O O
establish O O
the O O
basis O O
for O O
an O O
effective O O
management O O
of O O
the O O
disease O O
. O O

Results O O

The O O
first O O
pathologically O O
confirmed O O
arachnomelia O O
syndrome O O
- O O
cases O O
in O O
the O O
current O O
Simmental O O
population O O
appeared O O
in O O
the O O
year O O
2005 O O
. O O

By O O
2007 O O
, O O
an O O
additional O O
140 O O
calves B B_PERSON/B_BIO
with O O
the O O
arachnomelia O O
syndrome O O
were O O
identified O O
. O O

The O O
major O O
pathological O O
findings O O
were O O
malformed O O
bones O O
affecting O O
the O O
head O O
, O O
long O O
bones O O
of O O
the O O
legs O O
and O O
the O O
vertebral O O
column O O
. O O

It O O
could O O
be O O
shown O O
that O O
, O O
with O O
the O O
exception O O
of O O
two O O
cases O O
that O O
were O O
considered O O
as O O
phenocopies O O
, O O
all O O
of O O
the O O
paternal O O
and O O
about O O
two O O
- O O
third O O
of O O
the O O
maternal O O
pedigrees O O
of O O
the O O
affected O O
calves B B_PERSON
could O O
be O O
traced O O
back O O
to O O
one O O
common O O
founder O O
. O O

Together O O
with O O
the O O
data O O
from O O
experimental O O
matings O O
, O O
the O O
pedigree O O
data O O
support O O
an O O
autosomal O O
recessive O O
mutation O O
being O O
the O O
etiology O O
of O O
the O O
arachnomelia O O
syndrome O O
. O O

The O O
frequency O O
of O O
the O O
mutation O O
in O O
the O O
current O O
population O O
was O O
estimated O O
to O O
be O O
3 O O
. O O
32 O O
% O O
. O O

Conclusion O O

We O O
describe O O
the O O
repeated O O
occurrence O O
of O O
the O O
arachnomelia O O
syndrome O O
in O O
Simmental O O
calves B B_PERSON/B_SPECIES[BIO]
. O O

It O O
resembles O O
completely O O
the O O
same O O
defect O O
occurring O O
in O O
the O O
Brown O O
Swiss O O
breed O O
. O O

The O O
mutation O O
became O O
relatively O O
widespread O O
amongst O O
the O O
current O O
population O O
. O O

Therefore O O
, O O
a O O
control O O
system O O
has O O
to O O
be O O
established O O
and O O
it O O
is O O
highly O O
desirable O O
to O O
map O O
the O O
disease O O
and O O
develop O O
a O O
genetic O O
test O O
system O O
. O O

Background O O

In O O
the O O
year O O
2006 O O
a O O
syndrome O O
was O O
described O O
in O O
the O O
German O O
and O O
Austrian O O
Simmental O O
( O O
Fleckvieh O O
, O O
as O O
it O O
is O O
locally O O
called O O
, O O
is O O
the O O
main O O
dual O O
- O O
purpose O O
breed O O
in O O
Germany O O
, O O
in O O
short O O
called O O
Simmental O O
in O O
the O O
further O O
text O O
) O O
population O O
, O O
that O O
was O O
pathologically O O
similar O O
to O O
the O O
arachnomelia O O
syndrome O O
in O O
Brown O O
Swiss O O
cattle B B_SPECIES[BIO]
[ O O
1 O O
] O O
. O O

The O O
congenital O O
arachnomelia O O
syndrome O O
( O O
AS O O
, O O
OMIA O O
Phene O O
ID O O
139 O O
, O O
Group O O
000059 O O
) O O
is O O
mainly O O
a O O
malformation O O
of O O
the O O
skeletal O O
system O O
in O O
cattle B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_PERSON
that O O
was O O
initially O O
described O O
by O O
Rieck O O
and O O
Schade O O
[ O O
2 O O
] O O
in O O
Holstein O O
Friesian O O
, O O
Red O O
Holstein O O
and O O
Simmental O O
. O O

The O O
main O O
pathological O O
changes O O
are O O
skeletal O O
malformations O O
of O O
the O O
legs O O
, O O
the O O
spinal O O
column O O
and O O
the O O
skull O O
. O O

The O O
legs O O
are O O
thinner O O
and O O
appear O O
longer O O
than O O
normal O O
( O O
dolichostenomelia O O
, O O
arachnomelia O O
) O O
since O O
the O O
diameter O O
of O O
the O O
diaphyses O O
is O O
reduced O O
. O O

These O O
long O O
bones O O
are O O
more O O
fragile O O
and O O
, O O
in O O
combination O O
with O O
stiffened O O
joints O O
, O O
they O O
tend O O
to O O
fracture O O
during O O
calving O O
. O O

The O O
fetlock O O
joints O O
are O O
deformed O O
, O O
often O O
stiffened O O
and O O
show O O
hyperextension O O
. O O

The O O
malformation O O
of O O
the O O
spinal O O
column O O
leads O O
to O O
kyphosis O O
and O O
scoliosis O O
. O O

The O O
skull O O
malformations O O
are O O
characterized O O
by O O
a O O
shortened O O
lower O O
jaw O O
( O O
brachygnathia O O
inferior O O
) O O
, O O
convex O O
rounding O O
of O O
the O O
frontal O O
bone O O
leading O O
to O O
a O O
marked O O
stop O O
( O O
" O O
pointer O O
head O O
" O O
) O O
and O O
rotation O O
of O O
the O O
anterior O O
cranium O O
. O O

In O O
some O O
cases O O
, O O
additional O O
malformations O O
like O O
hydrocephalus O O
externus O O
develop O O
[ O O
2 O O
- O O
5 O O
] O O
. O O

Since O O
the O O
report O O
of O O

and O O
Schade O O
[ O O
2 O O
] O O
no O O
further O O

were O O

in O O

, O O

in O O

in O O

, O O

of O O

[ O O

. O O

In O O

mode O O
of O O

was O O
supposed O O
and O O

Recently O O

of O O

were O O
reported O O
in O O

[ O O

of O O

. O O

lower O O
than O O
1 O O
. O O
0 O O
percent O O

Conclusion O O

The O O
main O O
findings O O
, O O
brachygnathia O O
inferior O O
and O O
convex O O
frontal O O
bone O O
of O O
the O O
face O O
, O O
deformation O O
of O O
vertebrae O O
, O O
and O O
dysplasia O O
of O O
the O O
limbs O O
, O O
namely O O
the O O
diaphyses O O
of O O
metatarsus O O
and O O
- O O
carpus O O
and O O
the O O
fetlocks O O
, O O
can O O
best O O
be O O
explained O O
by O O
irregularly O O
developed O O
bone O O
structure O O
at O O
the O O
corresponding O O
locations O O
. O O

Without O O
pathological O O
examination O O
it O O
is O O
difficult O O
to O O
distinguish O O
the O O
arachnomelia O O
syndrome O O
from O O
other O O
malformations O O
of O O
the O O
limbs O O
. O O

Therefore O O
, O O
low O O
numbers O O
of O O
cases O O
in O O
Simmental O O
probably O O
passed O O
unrecognized O O
before O O
2005 O O
. O O

In O O
that O O
year O O
the O O
allelic O O
frequency O O
of O O
the O O
disease O O
in O O
the O O
cow B B_BIO/B_PERSON
population O O
increased O O
sharply O O
because O O
some O O
sires O O
that O O
had O O
been O O
carriers O O
of O O
the O O
mutation O O
had O O
become O O
very O O
popular O O
2 O O
- O O
4 O O
years O O
before O O
. O O

The O O
identification O O
of O O
a O O
common O O
ancestor O O
, O O
the O O
results O O
from O O
the O O
experimental O O
matings O O
and O O
the O O
analyses O O
of O O
numbers O O
of O O
cases O O
from O O
risk O O
matings O O
strongly O O
support O O
the O O
hypothesis O O
of O O
an O O
autosomal O O
recessively O O
inherited O O
disease O O
. O O

Furthermore O O
, O O
this O O
assumption O O
is O O
concordant O O
with O O
the O O
historical O O
description O O
of O O
the O O
syndrome O O
in O O
Simmental O O
and O O
Brown O O
Swiss O O
. O O

The O O
allelic O O
frequency O O
of O O
the O O
arachnomelia O O
syndrome O O
in O O
the O O
current O O
population O O
is O O
well O O
above O O
3 O O
percent O O
and O O
a O O
substantial O O
number O O
of O O
progeny O O
from O O
known O O
carriers O O
with O O
superior O O
genetic O O
merit O O
shall O O
be O O
used O O
as O O
sires O O
during O O
the O O
next O O
years O O
. O O

Therefore O O
, O O
a O O
control O O
system O O
has O O
to O O
be O O
established O O
and O O
the O O
arachnomelia O O
syndrome O O
- O O
gene O O
should O O
be O O
mapped O O
as O O
a O O
prerequisite O O
for O O
the O O
development O O
of O O
an O O
indirect O O
gene O O
test O O
for O O
carrier O O
identification O O
. O O

The O O
availability O O
of O O
pathologically O O
well O O
characterized O O
cases O O
from O O
the O O
field O O
and O O
from O O
the O O
ET O O
- O O
generated O O
full O O
- O O
sib O O
families O O
will O O
be O O
an O O
excellent O O
material O O
for O O
a O O
genetic O O
mapping O O
procedure O O
. O O

Methods O O

Recording O O
system O O
for O O
congenital O O
malformations O O

A O O
system O O
for O O
monitoring O O
inherited O O
congenital O O
malformations O O
in O O
Bavarian O O
cattle B B_SPECIES[BIO]
populations O O
was O O
established O O
by O O
the O O
Institute O O
for O O
Animal O O
Breeding O O
of O O
the O O
Bavarian O O
State O O
Research O O
Centre O O
for O O
Agriculture O O
( O O
ITZ O O
) O O
in O O
cooperation O O
with O O
the O O
Bavarian O O
milk O O
recording O O
organization O O
( O O
LKV O O
) O O
[ O O
11 O O
] O O
. O O

In O O
short O O
, O O
a O O
questionnaire O O
was O O
developed O O
for O O
detailed O O
recording O O
of O O
malformed O O
calves B B_PERSON/B_BIO
. O O

The O O
malformation O O
was O O
described O O
according O O
to O O
its O O
location O O
( O O
e O O
. O O
g O O
. O O

TREATMENT O O
OF O O
TETRALOGY O O
OF O O
FALLOT O O

It O O
has O O
been O O
my O O
custom O O
to O O
follow O O
a O O
policy O O
rather O O
similar O O
to O O
that O O
outlined O O
by O O
Blalock O O
. O O

The O O
subclavian O O
branch O O
of O O
the O O
innominate O O
has O O
generally O O
been O O
preferred O O
in O O
patients B B_PERSON/B_BIO
ranging O O
between O O
two O O
and O O
twelve O O
years O O
of O O
age O O
and O O
in O O
older O O
individuals O O
in O O
whom O O
there O O
is O O
a O O
right O O
aortic O O
arch O O
. O O

In O O
others O O
the O O
thoracotomy O O
is O O
usually O O
made O O
on O O
the O O
side O O
of O O
the O O
aortic O O
arch O O
, O O
and O O
either O O
the O O
aorta O O
itself O O
or O O
the O O
subclavian O O
arising O O
from O O
the O O
aorta O O
is O O
used O O
for O O
the O O
anastomosis O O
. O O

My O O
experience O O
with O O
the O O
use O O
of O O
the O O
subclavian O O
originating O O
from O O
the O O
aorta O O
is O O
small O O
and O O
the O O
results O O
have O O
not O O
been O O
as O O
good O O
as O O
those O O
which O O
others O O
have O O
reported O O
. O O

One O O
eighteen O O
- O O
month O O
- O O
old O O
child B B_PERSON
died O O
the O O
day O O
after O O
operation O O
and O O
was O O
found O O
at O O
post O O
- O O
mortem O O
examination O O
to O O
have O O
an O O
occluded O O
anastomosis O O
. O O

In O O
one O O
three O O
- O O
year O O
- O O
old O O
child B B_PERSON
and O O
one O O
twenty O O
- O O
year O O
- O O
old O O
woman B B_PERSON
a O O
poor O O
result O O
was O O
obtained O O
and O O
a O O
second O O
operation O O
upon O O
the O O
other O O
side O O
was O O
necessary O O
. O O

In O O
two O O
additional O O
cases O O
the O O
result O O
was O O
only O O
fair O O
. O O

Excluding O O
the O O
patients B B_PERSON/B_STUDY[THERAPEUTIC_OR_PREVENTIVE_PROCEDURE]
mentioned O O
in O O
the O O
present O O
report O O
, O O
only O O
in O O
two O O
was O O
an O O
unquestionably O O
good O O
result O O
obtained O O
. O O

Recently O O
, O O
in O O
several O O
cases O O
in O O
which O O
failure O O
seemed O O
evident O O
a O O
modification O O
has O O
been O O
required O O
in O O
order O O
to O O
obtain O O
a O O
functioning O O

Since O O
these O O
modifications O O
proved O O
successful O O
and O O
since O O
these O O
threats O O
of O O
failure O O
tax O O
one O O
' O O
s O O
ingenuiity O O
at O O
the O O
time O O
of O O
operation O O
, O O
I O O
have O O
thought O O
it O O
might O O
be O O
helpful O O
to O O
describe O O
the O O
procedures O O
employed O O
and O O
to O O
illustrate O O
them O O
with O O
case O O
reports O O
. O O

One O O
is O O
a O O
method O O
which O O
obviously O O
has O O
very O O
limited O O
applicability O O
, O O
while O O
the O O
otlher O O
would O O
seem O O
to O O
be O O
rather O O
generally O O
applicable O O
. O O

The O O
first O O
consists O O
of O O
the O O

of O O
the O O
origin O O
of O O
the O O
subclavian O O
to O O
a O O
more O O
suitable O O
portion O O
of O O
the O O
aorta O O
. O O

Case O O
report O O

The O O
patient B B_PERSON
was O O
a O O
19 O O
- O O
year O O
- O O
old O O
girl B B_PERSON
who O O
had O O
been O O
cyanotic O O
since O O
the O O
age O O
of O O
six O O
months O O
. O O

She O O
had O O
developed O O
normally O O
but O O
was O O
always O O
limited O O
in O O
exercise O O
capacity O O
. O O

In O O
her O O
early O O
years O O
of O O
school O O
she O O
was O O
taken O O
to O O
school O O
by O O
her O O
parents O O
and O O
carried O O
to O O
and O O
from O O
her O O
seat O O
in O O
the O O
classroom O O
. O O

She O O
did O O
reasonably O O
well O O
in O O
high O O
school O O
, O O
being O O
driven O O

: O O
a O O

- O O

for O O
the O O
Drosophila B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_PERSON
oviduct O O

Abstract O O

Background O O

In O O
both O O
vertebrates O O
and O O
invertebrates O O
, O O
the O O
oviduct O O
is O O
an O O
epithelial O O
tube O O
surrounded O O
by O O
visceral O O
muscles O O
that O O
serves O O
as O O
a O O
conduit O O
for O O
gamete O O
transport O O
between O O
the O O
ovary O O
and O O
uterus O O
. O O

While O O
Drosophila O O
is O O
a O O
model O O
system O O
for O O
tubular O O
organ O O
development O O
, O O
few O O
studies O O
have O O
addressed O O
the O O
development O O
of O O
the O O
fly B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_PERSON
' O O
s O O
oviduct O O
. O O

Recent O O
studies O O
in O O
Drosophila O O
have O O
identified O O
mating O O
- O O
responsive O O
genes O O
and O O
proteins O O
whose O O
levels O O
in O O
the O O
oviduct O O
are O O
altered O O
by O O
mating O O
. O O

Since O O
many O O
of O O
these O O
molecules O O
( O O
e O O
. O O
g O O
. O O
Muscle O O
LIM O O
protein O O
84B O O
, O O
Coracle O O
, O O
Neuroglian O O
) O O
have O O
known O O
roles O O
in O O
the O O
differentiation O O
of O O
muscle O O
and O O
epithelia O O
of O O
other O O
organs O O
, O O
mating O O
may O O
trigger O O
similar O O
differentiation O O
events O O
in O O
the O O
oviduct O O
. O O

This O O
led O O
us O O
to O O
hypothesize O O
that O O
mating O O
mediates O O
the O O
last O O
stages O O
of O O
oviduct O O
differentiation O O
in O O
which O O
organ O O
- O O
specific O O
specializations O O
arise O O
. O O

Results O O

Using O O
electron O O
- O O
and O O
confocal O O
- O O
microscopy O O
we O O
identified O O
tissue O O
- O O
wide O O
post O O
- O O
mating O O
changes O O
in O O
the O O
oviduct O O
including O O
differentiation O O
of O O
cellular O O
junctions O O
, O O
remodeling O O
of O O
extracellular O O
matrix O O
, O O
increased O O
myofibril O O
formation O O
, O O
and O O
increased O O
innervation O O
. O O

Analysis O O
of O O
once O O
- O O
and O O
twice O O
- O O
mated O O
females O O
reveals O O
that O O
some O O
mating O O
- O O
responsive O O
proteins O O
respond O O
only O O
to O O
the O O
first O O
mating O O
, O O
while O O
others O O
respond O O
to O O
both O O
matings O O
. O O

Conclusion O O

We O O
uncovered O O
ultrastructural O O
changes O O
in O O
the O O
mated O O
oviduct O O
that O O
are O O
consistent O O
with O O
the O O
roles O O
that O O
mating O O
- O O
responsive O O
proteins O O
play O O
in O O
muscle O O
and O O
epithelial O O
differentiation O O
elsewhere O O
. O O

This O O
suggests O O
that O O
mating O O
triggers O O
the O O
late O O
differentiation O O
of O O
the O O
oviduct O O
. O O

Furthermore O O
, O O
we O O
suggest O O
that O O
mating O O
- O O
responsive O O
proteins O O
that O O
respond O O
only O O
to O O
the O O
first O O
mating O O
are O O
involved O O
in O O
the O O
final O O
maturation O O
of O O
the O O
oviduct O O
while O O
proteins O O
that O O
remain O O
responsive O O
to O O
later O O
matings O O
are O O
also O O
involved O O
in O O
maintenance O O
and O O
ongoing O O
function O O
of O O
the O O
oviduct O O
. O O

Taken O O
together O O
, O O
our O O
results O O
establish O O
the O O
oviduct O O
as O O
an O O
attractive O O
system O O
to O O
address O O
mechanisms O O
that O O
regulate O O
the O O
late O O
stages O O
of O O
differentiation O O
and O O
maintenance O O
of O O
a O O
tubular O O
organ O O
. O O

Background O O

Most O O
internal O O
organs O O
, O O
including O O
the O O
vascular O O
and O O
respiratory O O
systems O O
and O O
the O O
gastro O O
- O O
intestinal O O
and O O
urinary O O
- O O
genital O O
tracts O O
are O O
comprised O O
of O O
a O O
single O O
epithelial O O
tube O O
or O O
a O O
network O O
of O O
tubes O O
. O O

Tubular O O
organs O O
serve O O
as O O
conduits O O
for O O
the O O
transport O O
of O O
gases O O
, O O
liquids O O
, O O
or O O
solutes O O
, O O
and O O
serve O O
as O O
barriers O O
between O O
biological O O
compartments O O
. O O

To O O
create O O
tubes O O
with O O
specific O O
flow O O
and O O
barrier O O
properties O O
, O O
the O O
morphology O O
of O O
the O O
tube O O
must O O
be O O
precisely O O
specified O O
during O O
development O O
and O O
modulated O O
by O O
physiology O O
. O O

To O O
accommodate O O
specific O O
physiological O O
roles O O
, O O
tissue O O
- O O
specific O O
programs O O
for O O
differentiation O O
are O O
employed O O
at O O
the O O
last O O
stages O O
of O O
development O O
. O O

While O O
much O O
is O O
known O O
about O O
the O O
molecular O O
and O O
cellular O O
basis O O
of O O
tube O O
formation O O
[ O O
1 O O
- O O
6 O O
] O O
, O O
little O O
is O O
known O O
about O O
the O O
mechanisms O O
that O O
regulate O O
the O O
late O O
stages O O
of O O
differentiation O O
in O O
which O O
organ O O
- O O
specific O O
specializations O O
arise O O
. O O

The O O
conservation O O
of O O
genes O O
and O O
similarity O O
in O O
tubular O O
organ O O
design O O
across O O
taxa O O
make O O
Drosophila O O
an O O
excellent O O
model O O
for O O
understanding O O
organogenesis O O
in O O
higher O O
animals O O
. O O

In O O
Drosophila O O

the O O
best O O
understood O O
tubular O O
organs O O
from O O
a O O
developmental O O
point O O
of O O
view O O
are O O
the O O
trachea O O
and O O
salivary O O
gland O O
. O O

Studies O O
of O O
these O O
organs O O
reveal O O
a O O
general O O
program O O
for O O
tubular O O
organ O O
development O O
, O O
in O O
which O O
combinatorial O O
expression O O
of O O
global O O
patterning O O
genes O O
specifies O O
positions O O
within O O
the O O
embryo O O
for O O
the O O
subsequent O O
activation O O
of O O
tissue O O
- O O
specific O O
early O O
genes O O
and O O
transcription O O
factors O O
. O O

This O O
program O O
results O O
in O O
the O O
activation O O
of O O
downstream O O
genes O O
involved O O
in O O
terminal O O
differentiation O O
of O O
organ O O
- O O
specific O O
specializations O O
such O O
as O O
the O O
cuticle O O
that O O
lines O O
the O O
tracheal O O
lumen O O
[ O O
1 O O
, O O
2 O O
, O O
4 O O
, O O
7 O O
- O O
9 O O
] O O
. O O

The O O
Drosophila B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_PERSON
female O O
reproductive O O
tract O O
is O O
another O O
tubular O O
system O O
, O O
consisting O O
of O O
the O O

and O O
a O O
common O O

( O O
the O O

tube O O

branches O O
into O O
two O O
lateral O O
oviducts O O

Regional O O
differences O O
in O O

are O O
observed O O
along O O
the O O
length O O
of O O
the O O
tract O O

with O O
egg O O

largely O O
at O O
the O O

end O O

in O O
the O O
lateral O O
oviducts O O

and O O

the O O

end O O

in O O
the O O
uterus O O
[ O O
10 O O
, O O
11 O O
] O O
. O O

Unlike O O
other O O
tubular O O
organs O O
, O O
little O O
is O O
known O O
about O O
the O O
development O O
of O O
the O O
female O O
reproductive O O
tract O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
regional O O
differences O O
in O O
function O O
suggest O O
the O O

of O O
region O O
- O O
specific O O
differentiation O O
programs O O
within O O
the O O
female O O
reproductive O O
tract O O
. O O

In O O
Drosophila O O
, O O
mating O O
induces O O
changes O O
in O O
female O O

and O O
physiology O O

molecules O O

in O O

. O O

These O O

are O O
rapid O O
and O O
lead O O
to O O
a O O
mated O O
female O O
state O O
which O O
is O O
profoundly O O
different O O
from O O
the O O
unmated O O
female O O
state O O
. O O

While O O
an O O
unmated O O
female O O
lays O O
few O O
eggs O O
and O O
readily O O
accepts O O
the O O
courtship O O
efforts O O
of O O
a O O

exhibits O O
increased O O
egg O O
- O O

and O O
actively O O
rejects O O
males O O
[ O O
12 O O
- O O
19 O O
] O O
. O O

Microarray O O
studies O O
of O O
whole O O
flies B B_BIO/B_STUDY[THERAPEUTIC_OR_PREVENTIVE_PROCEDURE]
reveal O O
that O O
the O O

in O O

by O O
a O O

in O O

. O O

Within O O

of O O

is O O

in O O

of O O

of O O

as O O

[ O O

, O O

In O O

( O O

At O O

of O O

. O O

( O O

To O O

of O O
oviduct O O

Our O O

Furthermore O O

Our O O

that O O

to O O

This O O

for O O

. O O

Results O O

Mating O O
induces O O
changes O O
in O O
oviduct O O
lumen O O

that O O

[ O O
23 O O
] O O
. O O

. O O

In O O

) O O

) O O
. O O

This O O

- O O

] O O

In O O

) O O
[ O O

] O O

Our O O

region O O

Based O O

of O O
lumen O O

. O O

Mating O O
modulates O O

activity O O
in O O
the O O
oviduct O O

of O O

( O O

( O O
additional O O
file O O
2B O O
and O O
2B O O
) O O
. O O

Matrix O O
- O O
like O O
material O O
was O O
not O O
observed O O
in O O
the O O
center O O
of O O
the O O
lumen O O
, O O
but O O
small O O
pools O O
of O O
very O O
electron O O
dense O O
material O O
were O O
detected O O
in O O
the O O
spaces O O
between O O
the O O
epithelial O O
folds O O
( O O
additional O O
file O O
2C O O
and O O
2C O O
) O O
. O O

This O O
may O O
explain O O
why O O
lumenal O O
matrix O O
was O O
not O O
detected O O
at O O
the O O
light O O
microscopic O O
level O O
in O O
the O O
mated O O
female O O
oviduct O O
( O O
see O O
Figure O O
1E O O
and O O
1F O O
) O O
. O O

Taken O O
together O O
, O O
our O O
observations O O
suggest O O
that O O
the O O
lower O O
common O O
oviduct O O
is O O
a O O
site O O
of O O
active O O
apical O O
secretion O O
in O O
both O O
mated O O
and O O
unmated O O
females O O
, O O
and O O
that O O
matrix O O
secretion O O
, O O
particularly O O
in O O
the O O
lumen O O
, O O
is O O
reduced O O
post O O
- O O
mating O O
. O O

These O O
findings O O
raise O O
the O O
intriguing O O
possibility O O
that O O
the O O
AECM O O
and O O
lumenal O O
matrix O O
function O O
as O O
a O O
plug O O
in O O
the O O
lower O O
oviduct O O
, O O
and O O
that O O
mating O O
induces O O
the O O
breakdown O O
of O O
this O O
plug O O
. O O

Mating O O
induces O O
changes O O
in O O
hemi O O
- O O
adherens O O
junctions O O
in O O
upper O O
oviduct O O

In O O
addition O O
to O O
modulating O O
secretion O O
at O O
the O O
apical O O
membrane O O
, O O
mating O O
induces O O
changes O O
at O O
the O O
basolateral O O
membrane O O
. O O

In O O
many O O
epithelia O O
, O O
one O O
of O O
the O O
last O O
steps O O
of O O
differentiation O O
is O O
the O O
development O O
of O O
a O O
layer O O
of O O
extracellular O O
matrix O O
( O O
ECM O O
) O O
called O O
the O O
basal O O
lamina O O
that O O
covers O O
the O O
apical O O
and O O
/ O O
or O O
basal O O
membranes O O
and O O
the O O
concomitant O O
development O O
of O O
hemi O O
- O O
adherens O O
junctions O O
( O O
HAJs O O
) O O
. O O

HAJs O O
connect O O
the O O
cell O O
cytoskeleton O O
with O O
the O O
ECM O O
and O O
are O O
formed O O
at O O
virtually O O
all O O
cell O O
surfaces O O
that O O
contact O O
an O O
ECM O O
. O O

HAJs O O
can O O
be O O
distinguished O O
at O O
the O O
ultrastructural O O
level O O
as O O
a O O
patch O O
- O O
like O O
, O O
electron O O
dense O O
undercoat O O
of O O
the O O
plasma O O
membrane O O
that O O
opposes O O
the O O
basal O O
lamina O O
( O O
[ O O
26 O O
] O O
; O O
Figure O O
3G O O
, O O
3H O O
) O O
. O O

In O O
the O O
Drosophila B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_PERSON
embryo O O
, O O
the O O
HAJs O O
and O O
basal O O
lamina O O
are O O
formed O O
at O O
the O O
same O O
time O O
[ O O
26 O O
] O O
. O O

Because O O
the O O
basal O O
lamina O O
is O O
established O O
at O O
a O O
time O O
when O O
the O O
majority O O
of O O
extracellular O O
matrix O O
molecules O O
are O O
actively O O

[ O O
26 O O
, O O
29 O O
] O O

this O O
suggests O O
that O O
the O O

of O O
HAJs O O
is O O
tightly O O
coordinated O O
with O O
the O O
secretion O O
of O O
the O O
ECM O O
. O O

One O O
of O O
the O O
most O O
striking O O
post O O
- O O

changes O O

in O O
the O O
oviduct O O

was O O
the O O

of O O
numerous O O

along O O
the O O
basolateral O O
membrane O O
in O O
the O O
upper O O
oviduct O O
( O O
Figure O O
3 O O
) O O
. O O

The O O
importance O O
of O O
HAJs O O
, O O
particularly O O
in O O
the O O
upper O O
oviduct O O

is O O
underscored O O
by O O
the O O

of O O
the O O

is O O
observed O O
in O O
both O O
unmated O O
and O O
mated O O
females O O
( O O
Figure O O
3A O O
and O O
3E O O
) O O

The O O
infolded O O
membrane O O
gives O O
rise O O
to O O

intercellular O O
space O O
that O O

an O O
ECM O O
( O O
Figure O O
3C O O
and O O
3G O O
) O O
. O O

This O O

is O O
contiguous O O
with O O
the O O
basal O O
lamina O O
that O O
surrounds O O
the O O
epithelia O O
. O O

Few O O

were O O
observed O O
in O O
the O O

oviduct O O
of O O
the O O
unmated O O
female O O

and O O

to O O
the O O

membrane O O

and O O
not O O
observed O O
along O O
the O O

( O O
Figure O O

) O O
. O O

In O O
contrast O O

HAJs O O
appear O O
along O O
the O O

post O O
- O O
mating O O
in O O
this O O
region O O
of O O
the O O
oviduct O O
( O O
Figure O O
3F O O
- O O

) O O

In O O
addition O O
, O O

appears O O
wider O O
post O O
- O O

( O O

and O O

- O O

) O O
, O O
suggesting O O
that O O
mating O O
induces O O
increased O O
secretion O O
and O O
/ O O
or O O
deposition O O
of O O
the O O
ECM O O
in O O
this O O

compartment O O
and O O
brings O O
the O O

to O O
a O O
threshold O O
concentration O O

can O O
support O O
the O O

of O O
HAJs O O

HAJs O O
were O O
also O O
detected O O
along O O
the O O

membrane O O

but O O
they O O
were O O
not O O

along O O

even O O

this O O

was O O
covered O O
by O O
an O O

. O O

Interestingly O O
, O O

the O O

folds O O

( O O

file O O
2 O O
) O O

were O O

along O O
this O O

tracts O O
( O O
data O O
not O O
shown O O
) O O

thus O O
suggesting O O
that O O
the O O
epithelia O O
is O O
more O O
differentiated O O
in O O
this O O
region O O
of O O
the O O
oviduct O O
, O O
and O O
that O O
the O O

of O O
the O O
upper O O
and O O
lower O O
oviduct O O
may O O
be O O
under O O
different O O
control O O
. O O

Muscle O O
differentiation O O
is O O
enhanced O O
post O O
- O O
mating O O

While O O
we O O
uncovered O O
post O O
- O O
mating O O
changes O O
in O O
the O O
oviduct O O
epithelia O O
that O O
might O O
facilitate O O
its O O
transition O O
to O O
a O O
high O O
egg O O
- O O
laying O O
state O O
, O O
this O O
transition O O
may O O
also O O
be O O
mediated O O
by O O
changes O O
in O O
oviduct O O
muscle O O
properties O O
and O O
/ O O
or O O
activity O O
. O O

The O O
oviduct O O
is O O
lined O O
by O O
circular O O
muscle O O
fibers O O
with O O
supercontractile O O
characteristics O O
[ O O
30 O O
] O O
. O O

Our O O
previous O O
studies O O
showed O O
that O O
mef2 O O
and O O
mlp84B O O
genes O O
that O O
regulate O O
muscle O O
differentiation O O
, O O
are O O
expressed O O
and O O
increased O O
post O O
- O O
mating O O
in O O
the O O
oviduct O O
, O O
as O O
well O O
as O O
in O O
the O O
sperm O O
storage O O
regions O O
of O O
the O O
reproductive O O
tract O O
[ O O
22 O O
, O O
23 O O
] O O
. O O

This O O
suggests O O
that O O
mating O O
induces O O
muscle O O
differentiation O O
in O O
the O O
reproductive O O
tract O O
. O O

Muscle O O
differentiation O O
is O O
characterized O O
by O O
the O O
assembly O O
of O O
myofilaments O O
into O O
bundles O O
called O O
myofibrils O O
. O O

As O O
muscles O O
differentiate O O
, O O
myofibrils O O
and O O
z O O
- O O
bodies O O
appear O O
simultaneously O O
, O O
and O O
increase O O
in O O
number O O
until O O
the O O
cytoplasm O O
is O O
filled O O
with O O
myofibrils O O
[ O O
31 O O
] O O
. O O

Like O O
epithelia O O
, O O
one O O
of O O
the O O
last O O
steps O O
of O O
muscle O O
differentiation O O
is O O
the O O
secretion O O
of O O
a O O
basal O O
lamina O O
that O O
surrounds O O
the O O
muscle O O
fiber O O
. O O

To O O
determine O O
if O O
mating O O
induces O O
structural O O
changes O O
in O O
muscles O O
( O O
such O O
as O O
increased O O
myofibrils O O
) O O
we O O
examined O O
the O O
ultrastructure O O
of O O
muscle O O
fibers O O
in O O
the O O
upper O O
and O O
lower O O
parts O O
of O O
the O O
oviduct O O
. O O

Our O O
analysis O O
revealed O O
that O O
, O O
in O O
both O O
unmated O O
and O O
mated O O
reproductive O O
tracts O O
, O O
the O O
muscles O O
of O O
the O O
lower O O
oviduct O O
are O O
highly O O
differentiated O O
as O O
evidenced O O
by O O
the O O
high O O
density O O
of O O
myofibrils O O
, O O
well O O
developed O O
and O O
aligned O O
z O O
- O O
bodies O O
, O O
and O O
secretion O O
of O O
a O O
thick O O
, O O
electron O O
dense O O
basal O O
lamina O O
( O O
Figure O O
4E O O
and O O
4F O O
) O O
. O O

In O O
contrast O O
, O O
muscle O O
fibers O O
in O O
the O O
lateral O O
oviducts O O
and O O
upper O O
common O O
oviduct O O
appear O O
less O O
differentiated O O
than O O
muscles O O
in O O
the O O
lower O O
common O O
oviduct O O
, O O
as O O
evidenced O O
by O O
the O O

density O O
of O O

and O O
z O O
- O O
bodies O O
, O O
and O O
little O O
or O O
no O O
basal O O
lamina O O
( O O
Figure O O
4A O O
and O O
4B O O
) O O
. O O

Moreover O O
, O O
the O O
muscles O O
of O O
the O O
upper O O
oviduct O O
appear O O
more O O
differentiated O O
in O O

than O O
in O O
unmated O O
reproductive O O
tracts O O
( O O
Figure O O
4A O O
- O O
4D O O
) O O
. O O

Interestingly O O
, O O
we O O
observed O O
neighboring O O
muscle O O
fibers O O
in O O
different O O
states O O
of O O
differentiation O O
in O O
the O O

oviducts O O
in O O
both O O

and O O
mated O O
reproductive O O
tracts O O
, O O
but O O
not O O
elsewhere O O
in O O
the O O
oviduct O O
( O O
Figure O O
4B O O
) O O
. O O

These O O
results O O
suggest O O
that O O
mating O O
enhances O O
the O O
rate O O
of O O
muscle O O
differentiation O O
in O O
the O O

and O O
that O O

is O O
delayed O O
in O O
the O O

compared O O
to O O
the O O
lower O O
oviduct O O
. O O

The O O
increased O O
muscle O O
differentiation O O
in O O
the O O
upper O O

is O O
not O O
dramatic O O
and O O
likely O O
reflects O O
the O O
short O O
post O O
- O O
mating O O
period O O
examined O O
in O O
this O O
study O O
. O O

The O O
delayed O O
differentiation O O
of O O
the O O
upper O O
oviduct O O
muscles O O
resembles O O
the O O
delay O O
in O O
the O O
onset O O
of O O
development O O
between O O
the O O
adult O O
thoracic O O
muscles O O
and O O
abdominal O O
muscles O O
during O O
metamorphosis O O
[ O O
32 O O
] O O
. O O

Since O O
the O O
ovaries O O
and O O
the O O
other O O
parts O O
of O O
the O O
reproductive O O
tract O O
are O O
known O O
to O O
have O O
different O O
segmental O O
origins O O
[ O O
33 O O
] O O
, O O
we O O
hypothesize O O
that O O
different O O
parts O O
of O O
the O O
oviduct O O
develop O O
at O O
different O O
rates O O
or O O
begin O O
development O O
at O O
different O O
times O O
. O O

Increased O O
innervation O O
in O O
the O O
oviduct O O
post O O
- O O
mating O O

Nerve O O
- O O
muscle O O
interactions O O
play O O
an O O
important O O
role O O
in O O
regulating O O
adult O O
muscle O O
development O O
and O O
refining O O
the O O
final O O
pattern O O
of O O
innervation O O
[ O O
34 O O
, O O
35 O O
] O O
. O O

Given O O
that O O
oviduct O O
muscle O O
differentiation O O
is O O
enhanced O O
post O O
- O O
mating O O
, O O
we O O
predicted O O
that O O
mating O O
either O O
directly O O
or O O
indirectly O O
induces O O
changes O O
in O O
innervation O O
. O O

To O O
address O O
this O O
prediction O O
, O O
we O O
quantified O O
the O O
number O O
of O O
nerve O O
terminals O O
or O O
boutons O O
innervating O O
the O O
lateral O O
oviducts O O
and O O
common O O
oviduct O O
in O O
unmated O O
and O O
mated O O
reproductive O O
tracts O O
. O O

Studies O O
of O O
oviduct O O
innervation O O
in O O
Drosophila O O
reveal O O
that O O
the O O
fly B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_PERSON
' O O
s O O
oviduct O O
receives O O
aminergic O O
, O O
peptidergic O O
and O O
glutamatergic O O
input O O
[ O O
30 O O
, O O
36 O O
- O O
39 O O
] O O
. O O

In O O
both O O
larval O O
and O O
adult O O
Drosophila O O
, O O
different O O
types O O
of O O
boutons O O
are O O
formed O O
by O O
neurons O O
that O O
express O O
different O O
neurotransmitters O O
and O O
modulators O O
[ O O
40 O O
- O O
42 O O
] O O
. O O

By O O
similarity O O
to O O
the O O
boutons O O
described O O
at O O
the O O
larval O O
and O O
adult O O
neuromuscular O O
junction O O
, O O
Middleton O O
et O O
al O O
. O O

[ O O
30 O O
] O O
report O O
that O O
the O O
fly B B_SPECIES[BIO]
' O O
s O O
oviduct O O
is O O
innervated O O
by O O
glutamatergic O O
type O O
I O O
boutons O O
and O O
tyraminergic O O
/ O O
octopaminergic O O
type O O
II O O
boutons O O
. O O

Rodgriguez O O
- O O
Valentin O O
et O O
al O O
. O O

[ O O
43 O O
] O O
further O O
report O O
that O O
the O O
oviduct O O
type O O
II O O
boutons O O
co O O
- O O
express O O
octopamine O O
and O O
glutamate O O
. O O

The O O
neurons O O
that O O
give O O
rise O O
to O O
the O O
type O O
I O O
innervation O O
have O O
not O O
been O O
identified O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
it O O
is O O
well O O
established O O
that O O
type O O
II O O
innervation O O
arises O O
from O O
octopaminergic O O
neurons O O
located O O
in O O
the O O
abdominal O O
ganglion O O
[ O O
30 O O
, O O
43 O O
] O O
. O O

In O O
addition O O
, O O
it O O
has O O
been O O
shown O O
that O O
some O O
or O O
all O O
of O O
these O O
neurons O O
express O O
a O O
GAL4 O O
insertion O O
line O O
for O O
the O O
bullwinkle O O
( O O
bwk O O
) O O
gene O O
[ O O
43 O O
] O O
. O O

Bwk O O
encodes O O
a O O
HMG O O
- O O
box O O
containing O O
putative O O
transcription O O
factor O O
[ O O
44 O O
] O O
. O O

To O O
determine O O
if O O
mating O O
induces O O
any O O
changes O O
in O O
the O O
number O O
of O O
type O O
I O O
and O O
II O O
boutons O O
innervating O O
the O O
oviduct O O
muscles O O
, O O
we O O
used O O
the O O
pan O O
- O O
neural O O
marker O O
, O O
anti O O
- O O
HRP O O
to O O
label O O
all O O
oviduct O O
boutons O O
in O O
unmated O O
and O O
mated O O
females O O
. O O

To O O
distinguish O O
between O O
type O O
I O O
and O O

) O O

We O O

Because O O

that O O

post O O
- O O

( O O

and O O

in O O

) O O

Studies O O
in O O

that O O

inhibits O O
oviduct O O
contraction O O
, O O
while O O

activates O O
oviduct O O

[ O O
30 O O
, O O
43 O O
, O O
48 O O
] O O
. O O

In O O
Drosophila O O

stimulation O O
of O O
the O O

nerve O O
gives O O
rise O O
to O O

of O O

of O O

[ O O

This O O

of O O

. O O

In O O

[ O O

It O O
is O O

that O O

in O O

show O O
that O O

and O O

To O O

in O O

to O O

We O O

We O O
observed O O

( O O

) O O

Because O O

to O O

Alternatively O O
, O O

is O O

to O O

of O O

through O O
the O O

. O O

Taken O O

, O O

suggest O O
that O O

is O O
essential O O
to O O
fine O O
- O O

of O O

- O O

proteins O O
examined O O
in O O

Because O O
the O O

in O O

protein O O

are O O
different O O
in O O

and O O

this O O
suggests O O
that O O

- O O

are O O
mating O O
- O O

. O O

Furthermore O O
, O O
we O O
suggest O O
that O O

are O O
linked O O
to O O
changes O O
in O O
oviduct O O
function O O
. O O

Early O O
or O O
prior O O
mating O O
increases O O
fecundity O O

In O O
Drosophila O O
, O O
female O O
fecundity O O
decreases O O
with O O
age O O
[ O O
51 O O
- O O
54 O O
] O O
. O O

It O O
has O O
been O O
proposed O O
that O O

Using O O

( O O

. O O

and O O

. O O

Since O O

increases O O

( O O

from O O

is O O
likely O O
that O O

to O O

. O O

We O O
suggest O O
that O O

of O O

includes O O
a O O
mating O O

stage O O
. O O

We O O
propose O O
that O O

days O O

- O O

of O O

Mating O O

For O O

( O O

) O O

and O O

of O O

are O O

. O O

The O O
oviduct O O
musculature O O
is O O
an O O
example O O
where O O
both O O
mating O O
- O O
independent O O
and O O
- O O

play O O
a O O

. O O

Muscles O O
are O O
highly O O
differentiated O O
in O O
the O O

Although O O

of O O

. O O

Another O O

interpretation O O
of O O

of O O

on O O

is O O
that O O

and O O

that O O

for O O
the O O

It O O

to O O

of O O

the O O

of O O

. O O

What O O
is O O
the O O
benefit O O
of O O
mating O O
- O O
induced O O
differentiation O O
of O O
the O O
oviduct O O

? O O

Unmated O O

are O O

of O O
laying O O
eggs O O
, O O
albeit O O
at O O
a O O
reduced O O
rate O O
as O O
compared O O
to O O
mated O O

of O O

. O O

One O O
possible O O

is O O
that O O

is O O

thus O O

until O O
sperm O O
is O O
available O O

to O O

female O O
. O O

This O O
may O O
reflect O O
the O O
evolution O O
of O O
a O O
mechanism O O
to O O
optimize O O
reproductive O O
capacity O O
in O O
early O O
adulthood O O
in O O
short O O
- O O
lived O O
animals O O
. O O

In O O
summary O O
, O O
we O O
have O O
identified O O
events O O
at O O
the O O
cellular O O
, O O
molecular O O
and O O

levels O O
that O O
are O O
part O O
of O O
an O O
efficient O O
and O O
specific O O
program O O
for O O
reproduction O O
. O O

Drosophila O O
affords O O
us O O
the O O
opportunity O O
to O O
uncover O O
the O O
signaling O O
pathways O O
that O O
coordinate O O
these O O
events O O
to O O
produce O O
a O O
physiologically O O
functional O O
organ O O
. O O

Methods O O

Flies O O

Wild O O
- O O
type O O
Canton O O
- O O
S O O
flies B B_BIO/B_STUDY[THERAPEUTIC_OR_PREVENTIVE_PROCEDURE]
were O O
used O O
for O O
the O O
fecundity O O
/ O O
fertility O O
experiments O O
and O O
confocal O O
analysis O O
. O O

All O O
flies B B_BIO/B_STUDY[THERAPEUTIC_OR_PREVENTIVE_PROCEDURE]
were O O
kept O O
in O O
a O O
12 O O
hrs O O
light O O
/ O O
dark O O
cycle O O
at O O
23 O O
+/- O O
2 O O
degrees O O
C O O
. O O

Upon O O
eclosion O O
, O O
females O O
and O O
males O O
were O O
collected O O
on O O
ice O O
and O O
held O O
separately O O
until O O
3 O O
( O O
females O O
and O O
males O O
) O O
or O O
10 O O
( O O
females O O
) O O
days O O
of O O
age O O
. O O

Sample O O
preparation O O

For O O
all O O
assays O O
( O O
unless O O
described O O
differently O O
) O O
unmated O O
females O O
were O O
placed O O
with O O
3 O O
- O O
day O O
- O O
old O O
unmated O O
males O O
and O O
observed O O
until O O
mating O O
initiated O O
. O O

At O O
the O O
end O O
of O O
mating O O
, O O
females O O
were O O
aspirated O O
into O O
fresh O O
vials O O
and O O
held O O
for O O
6 O O
hrs O O
. O O

At O O
6 O O
hrs O O
after O O
the O O
start O O
of O O
mating O O
, O O
females O O
were O O
placed O O
on O O
ice O O
for O O
dissection O O
. O O

Previous O O
molecular O O
studies O O
indicate O O
changes O O
in O O
protein O O
abundance O O
at O O
3 O O
hrs O O
post O O
- O O
mating O O
. O O

We O O
hypothesize O O
that O O
these O O
molecular O O
changes O O
will O O
translate O O
into O O
morphological O O
changes O O
in O O
the O O
next O O
few O O
hours O O
. O O

We O O
chose O O
to O O
analyze O O
the O O
morphology O O
of O O
mated O O
females O O
at O O
6 O O
h O O
post O O
- O O
mating O O
as O O
opposed O O
to O O
later O O
times O O
post O O
- O O
mating O O
because O O
the O O
changes O O
observed O O
at O O
later O O
times O O
may O O
be O O
due O O
, O O
in O O
part O O
, O O
to O O
the O O
high O O
rate O O
of O O
eggs O O
passing O O
through O O
the O O
oviduct O O
. O O

Quantitation O O

1 O O

, O O
National O O

of O O

of O O

Particle O O

Briefly O O
, O O

between O O
the O O

particle O O

tool O O

to O O
be O O
a O O
" O O
binary O O
" O O
image O O
( O O
i O O
. O O
e O O
. O O

white O O
) O O

thus O O
we O O
first O O
converted O O

images O O
to O O
gray O O
scale O O
. O O

We O O
then O O
set O O
a O O
" O O
threshold O O
" O O
range O O
so O O
that O O
pixels O O
in O O
the O O
image O O
whose O O
value O O
lies O O
in O O
this O O
range O O

to O O
black O O
; O O

outside O O

. O O

next O O

a O O
region O O
of O O

( O O

) O O

the O O

( O O
i O O
. O O

. O O
count O O
boutons O O
) O O
. O O

This O O

was O O

and O O
served O O
to O O

of O O
boutons O O
per O O
unit O O
area O O
in O O
each O O
treatment O O
. O O

We O O

Analysis O O

Abstract O O

Background O O

Osteoarthritis O O
of O O
the O O
first O O
metatarsophalangeal O O
joint O O
( O O
MPJ O O
) O O
of O O
the O O
foot O O
, O O
termed O O
hallux O O
limitus O O
, O O
is O O
common O O
and O O
painful O O
. O O

Numerous O O
non O O
- O O
surgical O O
interventions O O
have O O
been O O
proposed O O
for O O
this O O
disorder O O
, O O
however O O
there O O
is O O
limited O O
evidence O O
for O O
their O O
efficacy O O
. O O

Intra O O
- O O
articular O O
injections O O
of O O
hyaluronan O O
have O O
shown O O
beneficial O O
effects O O
in O O
case O O
- O O
series O O
and O O
clinical O O
trials O O
for O O
the O O
treatment O O
of O O
osteoarthritis O O
of O O
the O O
first O O
metatarsophalangeal O O
joint O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
no O O
study O O
has O O
evaluated O O
the O O
efficacy O O
of O O
this O O
form O O
of O O
treatment O O
using O O
a O O
randomised O O
placebo O O
controlled O O
trial O O
. O O

This O O
article O O
describes O O
the O O
design O O
of O O
a O O
randomised O O
placebo O O
controlled O O
trial O O
to O O
evaluate O O
the O O
efficacy O O
of O O
intra O O
- O O
articular O O
hyaluronan O O
( O O
Synvisc O O
(R) O O
) O O
to O O
reduce O O
pain O O
and O O
improve O O
function O O
in O O
people B B_PERSON/B_BIO
with O O
hallux O O
limitus O O
. O O

Methods O O

One O O
hundred O O
and O O
fifty O O
community O O
- O O
dwelling O O
men B B_PERSON
and O O
women B B_PERSON
aged O O
18 O O
years O O
and O O
over O O
with O O
hallux O O
limitus O O
( O O
who O O
satisfy O O
inclusion O O
and O O
exclusion O O
criteria O O
) O O
will O O
be O O
recruited O O
. O O

Participants B B_PERSON
will O O
be O O
randomised O O
, O O
using O O
a O O
computer O O
- O O
generated O O
random O O
number O O
sequence O O
, O O
to O O
receive O O
a O O
single O O
intra O O
- O O
articular O O
injection O O
of O O
up O O
to O O
1 O O
ml O O
hyaluronan O O
( O O
Synvisc O O
(R) O O
) O O
or O O
sterile O O
saline O O
( O O
placebo O O
) O O
into O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
. O O

The O O
injections O O
will O O
be O O
performed O O
by O O
an O O
interventional O O
radiologist O O
using O O
fluoroscopy O O
to O O
ensure O O
accurate O O

of O O
the O O

in O O
the O O
joint O O
. O O

Participants B B_PERSON
will O O
be O O
given O O
the O O
option O O
of O O
a O O
second O O
and O O
final O O
intra O O
- O O
articular O O

( O O
of O O
Synvisc O O
(R) O O
or O O
sterile O O
saline O O
according O O
to O O
the O O
treatment O O
group O O
they O O
are O O
in O O
) O O
either O O
1 O O
or O O
3 O O
months O O
post O O
- O O
treatment O O
if O O
there O O
is O O
no O O
improvement O O
in O O
pain O O
and O O
the O O
participant B B_PERSON
has O O
not O O
experienced O O
severe O O
adverse O O
effects O O
after O O
the O O
first O O
injection O O
. O O

The O O
primary O O
outcome O O
measures O O
will O O
be O O
the O O
pain O O
and O O
function O O
subscales O O
of O O
the O O
Foot O O
Health O O
Status O O
Questionnaire O O
. O O

The O O

be O O

at O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
( O O
during O O
walking O O
and O O
at O O
rest O O
) O O
, O O

at O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
, O O
passive O O
non O O
- O O
weightbearing O O
dorsiflexion O O
of O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
, O O
plantar O O
flexion O O
strength O O
of O O
the O O
toe O O
- O O
flexors O O
of O O
the O O
hallux O O
, O O
global O O
satisfaction O O
with O O
the O O
treatment O O
, O O
health O O
- O O
related O O
quality O O
of O O
life O O
( O O
assessed O O
using O O
the O O
Short O O
- O O
Form O O
- O O
36 O O
version O O
two O O
questionnaire O O
) O O
, O O
magnitude O O
of O O
symptom O O
change O O
, O O
use O O
of O O
pain O O
- O O
relieving O O
medication O O
and O O
changes O O
in O O
dynamic O O
plantar O O
pressure O O
distribution O O
( O O
maximum O O
force O O
and O O
peak O O
pressure O O
) O O
during O O
walking O O
. O O

Data O O
will O O
be O O
collected O O
at O O
baseline O O
, O O
then O O
1 O O
, O O
3 O O
and O O
6 O O
months O O
post O O
- O O
treatment O O
. O O

Data O O
will O O
be O O
analysed O O
using O O
the O O
intention O O
to O O
treat O O
principle O O
. O O

Discussion O O

This O O
study O O
is O O
the O O
first O O
randomised O O
placebo O O
controlled O O
trial O O
to O O
evaluate O O
the O O
efficacy O O
of O O
intra O O
- O O
articular O O
hyaluronan O O
( O O
Synvisc O O
(R) O O
) O O
for O O
the O O
treatment O O
of O O
osteoarthritis O O
of O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
( O O
hallux O O
limitus O O
) O O
. O O

The O O
study O O
has O O
been O O
pragmatically O O
designed O O
to O O
ensure O O
that O O
the O O
study O O
findings O O
can O O
be O O
implemented O O
into O O
clinical O O
practice O O
if O O
this O O
form O O
of O O
treatment O O
is O O
found O O
to O O
be O O
an O O
effective O O
treatment O O
strategy O O
. O O

Trial O O
registration O O

Australian O O
New O O
Zealand O O
Clinical O O
Trials O O
Registry O O
: O O
ACTRN12607000654459 O O

Background O O

Osteoarthritis O O
( O O
OA O O
) O O
is O O
a O O
degenerative O O
joint O O
disease O O
that O O
commonly O O
presents O O
within O O
the O O
first O O
metatarsophalangeal O O
joint O O
( O O
MPJ O O
) O O
of O O
the O O
foot O O
. O O

The O O
terms O O
hallux O O
limitus O O
and O O
hallux O O
rigidus O O
have O O
frequently O O
been O O
used O O
interchangeably O O
to O O
describe O O
differing O O
severities O O
of O O
pain O O
and O O
limitation O O
of O O
motion O O
associated O O
with O O
OA O O
at O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
[ O O
1 O O
] O O
. O O

Hallux O O
limitus O O
is O O
a O O
progressive O O
osteoarthritic O O
condition O O
of O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
that O O
may O O
advance O O
to O O
an O O
end O O
- O O
stage O O
presentation O O
of O O
hallux O O
rigidus O O
where O O
the O O
joint O O
fuses O O
and O O
there O O
is O O
a O O
complete O O
restriction O O
of O O
motion O O
[ O O
1 O O
] O O
. O O

First O O
MPJ O O
OA O O
is O O
the O O
second O O
most O O
common O O
disorder O O
affecting O O
the O O
foot O O
after O O
hallux O O
valgus O O
[ O O
2 O O
] O O
. O O

The O O
prevalence O O
of O O
the O O
condition O O
increases O O
with O O
age O O
, O O
and O O
it O O
has O O
been O O
reported O O
that O O
radiographic O O
changes O O
in O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
affect O O
are O O
evident O O
in O O
approximately O O
46 O O
% O O
of O O
women B B_PERSON/B_BIO
and O O
32 O O
% O O
of O O
men B B_PERSON
at O O
60 O O
years O O
of O O
age O O
[ O O
3 O O
] O O
. O O

Osteoarthritis O O
at O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
is O O
characterised O O
by O O
the O O
symptoms O O
of O O
pain O O
and O O
stiffness O O
at O O
the O O
joint O O
[ O O
1 O O
] O O
. O O

Secondary O O
painful O O
symptoms O O
relate O O
to O O
compensations O O
during O O
gait O O
that O O
may O O
occur O O
due O O
to O O
the O O
reduced O O
motion O O
of O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
[ O O
1 O O
] O O
. O O

The O O
presence O O
of O O
pain O O
associated O O
with O O
first O O
MPJ O O
OA O O
impacts O O
on O O
normal O O
walking O O
and O O
quality O O
of O O
life O O
[ O O
4 O O
] O O
. O O

Treatment O O
of O O
hallux O O
limitus O O
involves O O
conservative O O
measures O O
( O O
such O O
as O O
physical O O
therapy O O
, O O
foot O O
orthoses O O
, O O
footwear O O
modification O O
, O O
joint O O
manipulation O O
and O O
injection O O
with O O
corticosteroid O O
) O O
[ O O
5 O O
] O O
, O O
or O O
surgical O O
intervention O O
( O O
either O O
joint O O
- O O
salvage O O
or O O
joint O O
- O O
destructive O O
procedures O O
) O O
[ O O
6 O O
] O O
. O O

Pharmacological O O
treatment O O
is O O
also O O
often O O
undertaken O O
as O O
an O O
adjunct O O
for O O
pain O O
relief O O
in O O
the O O
management O O
of O O
hallux O O
limitus O O
[ O O
6 O O
] O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
although O O
non O O
- O O
steroidal O O
anti O O
- O O
inflammatory O O
drugs O O
( O O
NSAIDs O O
) O O
and O O
cyclooxygenase O O
- O O
2 O O
inhibitors O O
have O O
been O O
found O O
to O O
be O O
effective O O
in O O
the O O
management O O
of O O
various O O
forms O O
of O O
OA O O
, O O
gastrointestinal O O
complications O O
remain O O
a O O
concern O O
[ O O
7 O O
] O O
. O O

In O O
light O O
of O O
these O O
limitations O O
with O O
existing O O
treatments O O
, O O
an O O
alternative O O
treatment O O
termed O O
' O O
viscosupplementation O O
' O O
- O O
the O O
intra O O
- O O
articular O O
injection O O
of O O
hyaluronan O O
into O O
arthritic O O
joints O O
with O O
the O O
aim O O
of O O
restoring O O
the O O
viscoelasticity O O
of O O
the O O
synovial O O
fluid O O
[ O O
8 O O
] O O
- O O
has O O
been O O
proposed O O
and O O
has O O
attracted O O
considerable O O
attention O O
in O O
the O O
medical O O
literature O O
as O O
a O O
treatment O O
for O O
OA O O
[ O O
9 O O
] O O
. O O

In O O
particular O O
, O O
both O O
the O O
American O O
College O O
of O O
Rheumatology O O
( O O
ACR O O
) O O
and O O
European O O
League O O
Against O O
Rheumatism O O
( O O
EULAR O O
) O O
recommend O O
hyaluronan O O
in O O
the O O
management O O
of O O
OA O O
of O O
the O O
knee O O
[ O O
10 O O
, O O
11 O O
] O O
. O O

Although O O
the O O
results O O
of O O
systematic O O
reviews O O
investigating O O
the O O
effectiveness O O
of O O
this O O
type O O
of O O
treatment O O
for O O
knee O O
OA O O
are O O
controversial O O
, O O
the O O
most O O
recent O O
update O O
of O O
the O O
Cochrane O O
systematic O O
review O O
evaluating O O
viscosupplementation O O
for O O
the O O
treatment O O
of O O
knee O O
OA O O
concluded O O
that O O
viscosupplementation O O
was O O
both O O
safe O O
and O O
effective O O
for O O
the O O
treatment O O
of O O
OA O O
and O O
was O O
superior O O
or O O
equivalent O O
to O O
any O O
form O O
of O O
systemic O O
intervention O O
or O O
intra O O
- O O
articular O O
corticosteroids O O
[ O O
9 O O
, O O
12 O O
] O O
. O O

Despite O O
there O O
being O O
a O O
large O O
number O O
of O O
studies O O
investigating O O
the O O
effectiveness O O
of O O
hyaluronan O O
for O O
knee O O
OA O O
, O O
few O O
studies O O
have O O
investigated O O
the O O
effects O O
of O O
this O O
form O O
of O O
treatment O O
for O O
OA O O
at O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
[ O O
13 O O
] O O
. O O

In O O
a O O
case O O
- O O
series O O
retrospective O O
study O O
, O O
14 O O
patients B B_PERSON
with O O
radiographically O O
confirmed O O
OA O O
at O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
that O O
received O O
up O O
to O O
3 O O
intra O O
- O O
articular O O
injections O O
of O O
1 O O
ml O O
hyaluronan O O
( O O
Ostenil O O
(R) O O
Mini O O
) O O
( O O
sodium O O
hyaluronate O O
) O O
reported O O
a O O
statistically O O
significant O O
reduction O O
in O O
pain O O
( O O
reported O O
using O O
a O O
visual O O
analogue O O
scale O O
) O O
after O O
6 O O
months O O
[ O O
14 O O
] O O
. O O

The O O
treatment O O
was O O
well O O
tolerated O O
, O O
with O O
3 O O
/ O O
14 O O
( O O
21 O O
% O O
) O O
participants B B_PERSON
reporting O O
mild O O
adverse O O
reactions O O
at O O
the O O
injection O O
site O O
. O O

In O O
another O O
study O O
, O O
Pons O O
et O O
al O O
[ O O
13 O O
] O O
compared O O
a O O
single O O
intra O O
- O O
articular O O
injection O O
of O O
1 O O
ml O O
Ostenil O O
(R) O O
Mini O O
( O O
sodium O O
hyaluronate O O
) O O
with O O
1 O O
ml O O
Trigon O O
depot O O
(R) O O
( O O
triamcinolone O O
acetonide O O
, O O
a O O
corticosteroid O O
) O O
for O O
the O O
treatment O O
of O O
painful O O
, O O
grade O O
1 O O
hallux O O
limitus O O
( O O
Karasick O O
and O O
Wapner O O
[ O O
15 O O
] O O
scale O O
) O O
in O O
37 O O
participants B B_PERSON/B_MEASURE
( O O
40 O O
feet O O
) O O
[ O O
13 O O
] O O
. O O

Both O O
treatment O O
groups O O
showed O O
statistically O O
significant O O
reductions O O
in O O
pain O O
at O O
rest O O
or O O
on O O
palpation O O
for O O
up O O
to O O
12 O O
weeks O O
post O O
- O O
injection O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
hyaluronan O O
treatment O O
resulted O O
in O O
a O O
statistically O O
significant O O
greater O O
reduction O O
in O O
pain O O
during O O
walking O O
and O O
greater O O
improvement O O
in O O
the O O
American O O
Orthopaedic O O
Foot O O
and O O
Ankle O O
Society O O
( O O
AOFAS O O
) O O
hallux O O
MPJ O O
score O O
compared O O
to O O
treatment O O
with O O
triamcinolone O O
acetonide O O
. O O

The O O
treatment O O
with O O
hyaluronan O O
was O O
well O O
tolerated O O
, O O
with O O
2 O O
/ O O
20 O O
( O O
10 O O
% O O
) O O
participants B B_PERSON
reporting O O
mild O O
adverse O O
reactions O O
at O O
the O O
injection O O
site O O
. O O

Although O O
both O O
of O O
these O O
studies O O
suggest O O
that O O
intra O O
- O O
articular O O
hyaluronan O O
is O O
safe O O
and O O
effective O O
for O O
the O O
treatment O O
of O O
hallux O O
limitus O O
, O O
neither O O
used O O
a O O
placebo O O
control O O
group O O
[ O O
13 O O
, O O
14 O O
] O O
. O O

This O O
limitation O O
is O O
significant O O
as O O
a O O
placebo O O
effect O O
can O O
account O O
for O O
79 O O
% O O
of O O
the O O
efficacy O O
of O O
intra O O
- O O
articular O O
hyaluronan O O
treatment O O
[ O O
16 O O
] O O
. O O

Further O O
, O O
both O O
studies O O
are O O
limited O O
in O O
that O O
neither O O
of O O
the O O
studies O O
used O O
blinding O O
of O O
both O O
the O O
participants B B_PERSON
and O O
assessors O O
in O O
their O O
protocols O O
. O O

It O O
is O O
therefore O O
possible O O
that O O
the O O
positive O O
effects O O
of O O
hyaluronan O O
may O O
have O O
been O O
overestimated O O
. O O

Accordingly O O
, O O
the O O
aims O O
of O O
this O O
project O O
are O O
to O O
conduct O O
a O O
double O O
blind O O
randomised O O
controlled O O
trial O O
to O O
determine O O
the O O
effectiveness O O
of O O
intra O O
- O O
articular O O
hyaluronan O O
( O O
Synvisc O O
(R) O O
) O O
on O O
( O O
i O O
) O O
foot O O
pain O O
and O O
function O O
; O O
( O O
ii O O
) O O
the O O
range O O
of O O
motion O O
of O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
; O O
( O O
iii O O
) O O
the O O
strength O O
of O O
the O O
plantarflexor O O
muscles O O
of O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
; O O
( O O
iv O O
) O O
the O O
health O O
related O O
quality O O
of O O
life O O

v O O
) O O
the O O
use O O
of O O
pain O O
- O O
relieving O O
medications O O
in O O
people B B_PERSON/B_ORGANIZATION
with O O
hallux O O
limitus O O
. O O

The O O
study O O
protocol O O
is O O
presented O O
in O O
this O O
paper O O
, O O
consistent O O
with O O
the O O
recommendations O O
of O O
Editorial O O
Board O O
of O O
BioMed O O
Central O O
[ O O
17 O O
] O O
. O O

Methods O O

Design O O

This O O
study O O
is O O
a O O
parallel O O
group O O
, O O
participant B B_PERSON
and O O
assessor O O
blinded O O
, O O
randomised O O
controlled O O
trial O O
with O O
a O O
6 O O
month O O
follow O O
- O O
up O O
( O O
Figure O O
1 O O
) O O
. O O

It O O
has O O
been O O
developed O O
using O O
the O O
principles O O
described O O
by O O
Osteoarthritis O O
Research O O
Society O O
International O O
( O O
OARSI O O
) O O
Clinical O O
Trials O O
Task O O
Force O O
guidelines O O
[ O O
18 O O
] O O
. O O

Participants B B_PERSON
will O O
be O O
randomised O O
to O O
receive O O
a O O
single O O
intra O O
- O O
articular O O
injection O O
of O O
up O O
to O O
1 O O
ml O O
hyaluronan O O
( O O
Synvisc O O
(R) O O
) O O
or O O
sterile O O
saline O O
( O O
placebo O O
) O O
into O O
the O O
first O O
MPJ O O
. O O

Allocation O O
to O O
either O O
the O O
Synvisc O O
(R) O O
or O O
placebo O O
groups O O
will O O
be O O
achieved O O
using O O
a O O
computer O O
- O O
generated O O
random O O
number O O
sequence O O
. O O

The O O
allocation O O
sequence O O
will O O
be O O
generated O O
and O O
held O O
by O O
an O O
external O O
person B B_PERSON/B_ORGANIZATION
not O O
directly O O
involved O O
in O O
the O O
trial O O
. O O

Concealment O O
of O O
the O O
allocation O O
sequence O O
will O O
be O O
ensured O O
as O O
each O O
participant B B_PERSON/B_ORGANIZATION
' O O
s O O
allocation O O
will O O
be O O
contained O O
in O O
a O O
sealed O O
opaque O O
envelope O O
. O O

Envelopes O O
will O O
be O O
made O O
opaque O O
by O O
using O O
a O O
sheet O O
of O O
aluminium O O
foil O O
inside O O
the O O
envelope O O
. O O

In O O
addition O O
, O O
a O O
system O O
using O O
carbon O O
paper O O
will O O
be O O
employed O O
so O O
the O O
details O O
( O O
name O O
and O O
date O O
of O O
recruitment O O
) O O
are O O
transferred O O
from O O
the O O
outside O O
of O O
the O O
envelope O O
to O O
the O O
paper O O
inside O O
the O O
envelope O O
containing O O
the O O
allocation O O
prior O O
to O O
opening O O
the O O
seal O O
. O O

Assessors O O
and O O
participants B B_PERSON
will O O
be O O
blinded O O
to O O
group O O
allocation O O
. O O

Participants B B_PERSON
will O O
be O O
given O O
the O O
option O O
of O O
a O O
second O O
and O O
final O O
intra O O
- O O
articular O O
injection O O
( O O
of O O
Synvisc O O
(R) O O
or O O
sterile O O
saline O O
according O O
to O O
the O O
treatment O O
group O O
they O O
are O O
in O O
) O O
on O O
days O O
30 O O
or O O
90 O O
if O O
there O O
is O O
no O O
improvement O O
in O O
pain O O
and O O
the O O
participant B B_PERSON
has O O
not O O
experienced O O
severe O O
adverse O O
effects O O
after O O
the O O
first O O
injection O O
) O O
. O O

Participants B B_PERSON/B_STUDY[THERAPEUTIC_OR_PREVENTIVE_PROCEDURE]

( O O

) O O

The O O
FHSQ O O
includes O O
13 O O
questions O O
that O O

of O O

. O O

The O O

has O O

to O O

( O O

, O O

and O O
construct O O

) O O
process O O
. O O

It O O
has O O

high O O
test O O
- O O
retest O O
reliability O O
( O O

correlation O O
coefficients O O
ranging O O
from O O
0 O O
. O O
74 O O
to O O
0 O O
. O O
92 O O
) O O
and O O
a O O
high O O
degree O O
of O O
internal O O

This O O

( O O

articular O O

for O O

Abstract O O

Background O O

p8 O O
is O O
a O O
stress O O
- O O
induced O O
protein O O
with O O
multiple O O
functions O O
and O O
biochemically O O
related O O
to O O
the O O
architectural O O
factor O O
HMG O O
- O O
I O O
/ O O
Y O O
. O O

We O O
analyzed O O
the O O
expression O O
and O O
function O O
of O O
p8 O O
in O O
pancreatic O O
cancer O O
- O O
derived O O
cells O O
. O O

Methods O O

Expression O O
of O O
p8 O O
was O O
silenced O O
in O O
the O O
human B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_DISEASE_ADJECTIVE[DISEASE]
pancreatic O O
cancer O O
cell O O
lines O O
Panc O O
- O O
1 O O
and O O
BxPc O O
- O O
3 O O
by O O
infection O O
with O O
a O O
retrovirus O O
expressing O O
p8 O O
RNA O O
in O O
the O O
antisense O O
orientation O O
. O O

Cell O O
growth O O
was O O
measured O O
in O O
control O O
and O O
p8 O O
- O O
silenced O O
cells O O
. O O

Influence O O
on O O
p8 O O
expression O O
of O O
the O O
induction O O
of O O
intracellular O O
pathways O O
promoting O O
cellular O O
growth O O
or O O
growth O O
arrest O O
was O O
monitored O O
. O O

Results O O

p8 O O
- O O
silenced O O
cells O O
grew O O
more O O
rapidly O O
than O O
control O O
cells O O
transfected O O
with O O
the O O
empty O O
retrovirus O O
. O O

Activation O O
of O O
the O O
Ras O O
--> O O
Raf O O
--> O O
MEK O O
--> O O
ERK O O
and O O
JNK O O
intracellular O O
pathways O O
down O O
- O O
regulated O O
p8 O O
expression O O
. O O

In O O
addition O O
, O O
the O O
MEK1 O O
/ O O
2 O O
inhibitor O O
U0126 O O
and O O
the O O
JNK O O
inhibitor O O
SP600125 O O
up O O
- O O
regulates O O
expression O O
of O O
p8 O O
. O O

Conversely O O
, O O
p38 O O
or O O
TGF O O
beta O O
- O O
1 O O
induced O O
p8 O O
expression O O
whereas O O
the O O
specific O O
p38 O O
inhibitor O O
SB203580 O O
down O O
- O O
regulated O O
p8 O O
expression O O
. O O

Finally O O
, O O
TGF O O
beta O O
- O O
1 O O
induction O O
was O O
in O O
part O O
mediated O O
through O O
p38 O O
. O O

Conclusions O O

p8 O O
inhibits O O
the O O
growth O O
of O O
human B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_DISEASE_ADJECTIVE[DISEASE]
pancreatic O O
cancer O O
cells O O
. O O

p8 O O
expression O O
is O O
induced O O
through O O
pathways O O
involved O O
in O O
growth O O
inhibition O O
and O O
repressed O O
by O O
factors O O
that O O
promote O O
cell O O
growth O O
. O O

These O O
results O O
suggest O O
that O O
p8 O O
belongs O O
to O O
a O O
pathway O O
regulating O O
the O O
growth O O
of O O
pancreatic O O
cancer O O
cells O O
. O O

Background O O

While O O
studying O O
the O O
molecular O O
response O O
of O O
the O O
injured O O
pancreas O O
, O O
we O O
identified O O
a O O
new O O
gene O O
, O O
called O O
p8 O O
, O O
whose O O
expression O O
is O O
strongly O O
induced O O
during O O
the O O
acute O O
phase O O
of O O
pancreatitis O O
[ O O
1 O O
] O O
. O O

Further O O
experiments O O
have O O
shown O O
that O O
p8 O O
mRNA O O
is O O
activated O O
in O O
almost O O
all O O
cells O O
in O O
response O O
to O O
several O O
stresses O O
[ O O
2 O O
] O O
, O O
including O O
minimal O O
stresses O O
such O O
as O O
after O O
routine O O
change O O
of O O
the O O
culture O O
medium O O
in O O
the O O
absence O O
of O O
any O O
added O O
substance O O
[ O O
3 O O
] O O
, O O
indicating O O
that O O
p8 O O
is O O
a O O
ubiquitous O O
protein O O
induced O O
by O O
cellular O O
stress O O
. O O

The O O
p8 O O
gene O O
was O O
cloned O O
in O O
human B B_SPECIES[BIO]
, O O
rat B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_GENE
, O O
mouse B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_DISEASE
, O O
and O O
Xenopus B B_SPECIES[BIO]
laevis I I_SPECIES[BIO]
[ O O
1 O O
, O O
4 O O
- O O
6 O O
] O O
, O O
conceptually O O
translated O O
from O O
the O O
Drosophila B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_MEASURE
melanogaster I I_SPECIES[BIO]/I_MEASURE
genome O O
or O O
deduced O O
from O O
EST O O
libraries O O
( O O

Discussion O O

Pancreatic O O
adenocarcinoma O O
is O O
the O O
fourth O O
leading O O
cause O O
of O O
death O O
from O O
malignant O O
diseases O O
[ O O
26 O O
] O O
. O O

The O O
aggressive O O
nature O O
of O O
the O O
neoplasia O O

the O O
lack O O
of O O
early O O
detection O O
, O O
and O O
the O O

response O O
to O O
treatments O O
such O O
as O O

and O O

contribute O O
to O O
the O O

mortality O O
rate O O
of O O
the O O
disease O O
. O O

Therefore O O

better O O

of O O
the O O
molecular O O
mechanism O O
leading O O
to O O
pancreatic O O
cancer O O

a O O
major O O

it O O
may O O
help O O

strategies O O
for O O

better O O

. O O

most O O
commonly O O

genes O O

- O O

( O O

% O O
) O O
[ O O

- O O

Whereas O O

is O O
a O O
proto O O

for O O

, O O
at O O
least O O
in O O
part O O
, O O
at O O
the O O
transcription O O
level O O
. O O

Interestingly O O
, O O
expression O O
of O O
p8 O O
mRNA O O
seems O O
to O O
be O O
regulated O O
in O O
a O O
cell O O
type O O
- O O
and O O
stimulus O O
- O O
specific O O
manner O O
since O O
, O O
for O O
example O O
, O O
p38 O O
can O O
induce O O
p8 O O
expression O O
in O O
response O O
to O O
stress O O
in O O
fibroblasts O O
[ O O
3 O O
] O O
but O O
not O O
in O O
renal O O
mesangial O O
cells O O
treated O O
with O O
endothelin O O
[ O O
13 O O
] O O
. O O

In O O
pancreatic O O
cancer O O
- O O
derived O O
cells O O
p38 O O
seems O O
to O O
play O O
a O O
major O O
role O O
since O O
it O O
is O O
involved O O
in O O
p8 O O
activation O O
as O O
judged O O
by O O
transient O O
transfection O O
assays O O
and O O
using O O
a O O
specific O O
p38 O O
inhibitor O O
( O O
Figures O O
10 O O
and O O
11 O O
) O O
. O O

In O O
addition O O
, O O
p38 O O
is O O
also O O
involved O O
in O O
TGF O O
beta O O
- O O
1 O O
- O O
induced O O
p8 O O
expression O O
because O O
about O O
40 O O
% O O
of O O
the O O
TGF O O
beta O O
- O O
1 O O
effect O O
was O O
abolished O O
when O O
p38 O O
activity O O
was O O
specifically O O
blocked O O
( O O
Figure O O
13 O O
) O O
. O O

On O O
the O O
other O O
hand O O
, O O
ERK O O
and O O
JNK O O
are O O
inducers O O
of O O
p8 O O
expression O O
in O O
mesangial O O
cells O O
treated O O
with O O
endothelin O O
, O O
but O O
not O O
involved O O
in O O
the O O
activation O O
of O O
p8 O O
in O O
response O O
to O O
stress O O
in O O
fibroblasts O O
[ O O
3 O O
] O O
, O O
and O O
even O O
repressors O O
in O O
pancreatic O O
cells O O
( O O
Figures O O
5 O O
, O O
6 O O
, O O
7 O O
, O O
8 O O
and O O
9 O O
) O O
. O O

Finally O O
, O O
PI3 O O
kinase O O
is O O
an O O
inducer O O
of O O
p8 O O
expression O O
in O O
both O O
endothelin O O
- O O
mediated O O
p8 O O
activation O O
in O O
mesangial O O
cells O O
[ O O
13 O O
] O O
and O O
pancreatic O O
cells O O
( O O
data O O
not O O
shown O O
) O O
. O O

Based O O
on O O
these O O
observations O O
, O O
overexpression O O
of O O
p8 O O
could O O
be O O
considered O O
a O O
possible O O
goal O O
for O O
treating O O
pancreatic O O
tumours O O
, O O
in O O
order O O
to O O
limit O O
their O O
growth O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
we O O
previously O O
reported O O
that O O
p8 O O
repression O O
would O O
prevent O O
rasV12 O O
/ O O
E1A O O
transformed O O
fibroblasts O O
from O O
evolving O O
as O O
tumours O O
in O O
nude B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_STUDY[THERAPEUTIC_OR_PREVENTIVE_PROCEDURE]
mice I I_SPECIES[BIO]/I_STUDY[THERAPEUTIC_OR_PREVENTIVE_PROCEDURE]
[ O O
16 O O
] O O
. O O

This O O
apparent O O
contradiction O O
needs O O
to O O
be O O
resolved O O
before O O
considering O O
p8 O O
as O O
a O O
target O O
for O O
treating O O
cancer O O
progression O O
. O O

Conclusions O O

In O O
conclusion O O
( O O
see O O
Figure O O
14 O O
) O O
, O O
we O O
report O O
in O O
this O O
paper O O
that O O
inhibition O O
of O O
p8 O O
expression O O
by O O
an O O
anti O O
- O O
sense O O
strategy O O
increases O O
the O O
growth O O
rate O O
of O O
both O O
Panc O O
- O O
1 O O
and O O
BxPc O O
- O O
3 O O
pancreatic O O
cancer O O
- O O
derived O O
cells O O
. O O

Moreover O O
, O O
ERK O O
- O O
and O O
JNK O O
- O O
mediated O O
pathways O O
down O O
- O O
regulate O O
p8 O O
expression O O
, O O
whereas O O
p38 O O
and O O
TGF O O
beta O O
- O O
1 O O
pathways O O
induce O O
p8 O O
expression O O
. O O

Also O O
, O O
cell O O
growth O O
triggered O O
by O O
expression O O
of O O
a O O
RAS O O
mutated O O
protein O O
or O O
by O O
10 O O
% O O
fetal O O
calf B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_BODY_PART_OR_ORGAN_COMPONENT
serum O O
induces O O
down O O
- O O
regulation O O
of O O
p8 O O
expression O O
. O O

Together O O
, O O
these O O
results O O
indicate O O
that O O
p8 O O
is O O
an O O
intracellular O O
cell O O
growth O O
inhibitor O O
and O O
that O O
it O O
is O O
oppositely O O
regulated O O
by O O
growth O O
- O O
promoting O O
or O O
growth O O
- O O
inhibiting O O
factors O O
in O O
pancreatic O O
cancer O O
- O O
derived O O
cells O O
. O O

were O O
co O O
- O O
transfected O O
with O O
p8 O O
- O O
CAT O O
and O O
pCMV O O
/ O O
beta O O
gal O O
plasmids O O
as O O
indicated O O
. O O

RT O O
- O O
PCR O O
analysis O O

RNA O O
was O O
extracted O O
using O O
the O O
Trizol O O
( O O

Technologies O O
) O O
procedure O O
. O O

Total O O

( O O
1 O O

) O O
was O O
analyzed O O
by O O
RT O O
- O O

with O O
the O O
SuperScript O O
(TM) O O
One O O
- O O
step O O
RT O O
- O O
PCR O O
System O O
and O O
the O O
Platinum O O
Taq O O
kit O O
( O O
Life O O
Technologies O O
) O O
. O O

RT O O
- O O
PCR O O
was O O
performed O O
using O O
different O O
numbers O O
of O O
cycles O O
to O O
verify O O
that O O
the O O
conditions O O
chosen O O
were O O
within O O
the O O
linear O O
range O O
. O O

coding O O
for O O

with O O

( O O
5 O O
' O O

) O O

( O O

) O O

and O O

of O O
the O O

( O O

# O O

012385 O O
) O O

respectively O O
. O O

for O O

Enzymatic O O
multiplex O O
DNA O O
sequencing O O
. O O

Abstract O O

The O O
problem O O
of O O
reading O O
DNA O O
sequence O O
films O O
has O O
been O O
reformulated O O
using O O
an O O
easily O O
implemented O O
, O O
multiplex O O
version O O
of O O
enzymatic O O
DNA O O
sequencing O O
. O O

By O O
utilizing O O
a O O
uniquely O O
tagged O O
primer O O
for O O
each O O
base O O
- O O
specific O O
sequencing O O
reaction O O
, O O
the O O
four O O
reactions O O
can O O
be O O
pooled O O
and O O
electrophoresed O O
in O O
a O O
single O O
lane O O
. O O

This O O
approach O O
has O O
been O O
previously O O
proposed O O
for O O
use O O
with O O
fluorescently O O
labelled O O
probes O O
( O O
1 O O
) O O
, O O
and O O
is O O
analogous O O
to O O
the O O
principle O O
used O O
in O O
four O O
- O O
dye O O
fluorescence O O
sequencing O O
except O O
that O O
the O O
signals O O
are O O
resolved O O
following O O
electrophoresis O O
( O O
2 O O
) O O
. O O

After O O
transfer O O
to O O
a O O
nylon O O
membrane O O
, O O
images O O
are O O
obtained O O
separately O O
for O O
each O O
of O O
the O O
four O O
reactions O O
by O O
hybridization O O
using O O
oligonucleotide O O
probes O O
. O O

The O O
images O O
can O O
then O O
be O O
superimposed O O
to O O
reconstitute O O
a O O
complete O O
sequence O O
pattern O O
. O O

In O O
this O O
way O O
the O O
correction O O
of O O
gel O O
distortion O O
effects O O
and O O
accurate O O
band O O
registration O O
are O O
considerably O O
simplified O O
, O O
as O O
each O O
of O O
the O O
four O O
base O O
- O O
specific O O
ladders O O
require O O
very O O
similar O O
corrections O O
. O O

The O O
methods O O
therefore O O
provide O O
the O O
basis O O
for O O
a O O
second O O
generation O O
of O O
more O O
accurate O O
and O O
reliable O O
film O O
reading O O
programs O O
, O O
as O O
well O O
as O O
being O O
useful O O
for O O
conventional O O
multiplex O O
sequencing O O
. O O

Unlike O O
the O O
original O O
multiplex O O
protocol O O
( O O
3 O O
) O O
, O O
the O O
approach O O
described O O
is O O
suitable O O
for O O
small O O
projects O O
, O O
as O O
multiple O O
cloning O O
vectors O O
are O O
not O O
used O O
. O O

Acids O O

, O O

. O O

ABSTRACT O O

The O O
problem O O
of O O
reading O O
DNA O O
sequence O O
films O O

using O O
an O O
easily O O
implemented O O
