multiplex O O
version O O
of O O
enzymatic O O
DNA O O
sequencing O O
. O O

By O O
utilizing O O
a O O
uniquely O O
tagged O O
primer O O
for O O
each O O
base O O
- O O
specific O O
sequencing O O
reaction O O
, O O
the O O
four O O
reactions O O
can O O
be O O
pooled O O
and O O
electrophoresed O O
in O O
a O O
single O O
lane O O
. O O

This O O
approach O O
has O O
been O O
previously O O
proposed O O
for O O
use O O
with O O
fluorescently O O
labelled O O
probes O O
( O O
1 O O
) O O
, O O
and O O
is O O
analogous O O
to O O
the O O
principle O O
used O O
in O O
four O O
- O O
dye O O
fluorescence O O
sequencing O O
except O O
that O O
the O O
signals O O
are O O
resolved O O
following O O
electrophoresis O O
( O O
2 O O
) O O
. O O

After O O
transfer O O
to O O
a O O
nylon O O
membrane O O
, O O
images O O
are O O
obtained O O
separately O O
for O O
each O O
of O O
the O O
four O O
reactions O O
by O O
hybridization O O
using O O
oligonucleotide O O
probes O O
. O O

The O O
images O O
can O O
then O O
be O O
superimposed O O
to O O
reconstitute O O
a O O
complete O O
sequence O O
pattern O O
. O O

In O O
this O O
way O O
the O O
correction O O
of O O
gel O O
distortion O O
effects O O
and O O
accurate O O
band O O
registration O O
are O O
considerably O O
simplified O O

as O O
each O O
of O O
the O O
four O O
basespecific O O
ladders O O
require O O
very O O
similar O O
corrections O O
. O O

The O O
methods O O
therefore O O
provide O O
the O O
basis O O
for O O
a O O
second O O
generation O O
of O O
more O O
accurate O O
and O O
reliable O O
film O O
reading O O

as O O
well O O
as O O
being O O
useful O O
for O O
conventional O O
multiplex O O
sequencing O O
. O O

Unlike O O
the O O
original O O
multiplex O O
protocol O O
( O O
3 O O
) O O
, O O
the O O
approach O O
described O O
is O O
suitable O O
for O O
small O O
projects O O
, O O
as O O
multiple O O
cloning O O
vectors O O
are O O
not O O
used O O
. O O

INTRODUCTION O O

However O O
, O O
the O O
largest O O
contiguous O O
DNA O O
sequences O O
which O O
have O O
been O O
determined O O
so O O
far O O
are O O
the O O
genomes O O
of O O
several O O
dsDNA O O
eukaryotic O O
viruses O O
( O O
5 O O
, O O
6 O O
, O O
7 O O
, O O
8 O O
, O O
9 O O
) O O
and O O
plant O O
chloroplasts O O
( O O
10 O O
, O O
11 O O
, O O
12 O O
) O O
. O O

The O O
largest O O
of O O
these O O
is O O
the O O
229kb O O
genome O O
of O O
human B B_SPECIES[BIO]
cytomegalovirus I I_SPECIES[BIO]
( O O
8 O O
) O O
. O O

The O O
difficulty O O
in O O
sequencing O O
millions O O
of O O
base O O
pairs O O
of O O
DNA O O
is O O
that O O
several O O
steps O O
in O O
the O O
methods O O
are O O
relatively O O
labour O O
intensive O O
, O O
although O O
the O O
sequencing O O
reactions O O
themselves O O
are O O
rapid O O
and O O
easily O O
performed O O
. O O

Two O O
limiting O O
steps O O
in O O
conventional O O
procedures O O
are O O
the O O
size O O
fractionation O O
of O O
sequencing O O
reaction O O
products O O
by O O
gel O O
electrophoresis O O
and O O
the O O
subsequent O O
reading O O
of O O
sequence O O
ladders O O
. O O

The O O
former O O
problem O O
can O O
be O O
overcome O O
by O O
multiplexing O O
, O O
which O O
theoretically O O
allows O O
an O O
enormous O O
amount O O
of O O

data O O
to O O
be O O
obtained O O
from O O
a O O
single O O
gel O O
by O O
processing O O
clones O O
as O O
mixtures O O
rather O O
than O O
individually O O
( O O
3 O O
) O O
. O O

Each O O
sequence O O
in O O
the O O
mixture O O
is O O
labelled O O
by O O
a O O
unique O O
short O O
oligonucleotide O O
' O O
tag O O
' O O
sequence O O
. O O

This O O
allows O O
the O O
mixture O O
to O O
be O O
resolved O O
following O O
electrophoresis O O
: O O
the O O
superimposed O O
sequence O O
ladders O O
are O O
blotted O O
from O O
the O O
gel O O
to O O
a O O
nylon O O
membrane O O
, O O
and O O
detected O O
one O O
at O O
a O O
time O O
by O O
hybridization O O
using O O
tag O O
- O O
specific O O
oligonucleotide O O
probes O O
. O O

In O O
practice O O
, O O
at O O
least O O
50 O O
sets O O
of O O
sequences O O
can O O
be O O
obtained O O
from O O
a O O
single O O
gel O O
( O O
3 O O
) O O
. O O

Unfortunately O O
, O O
a O O
bottleneck O O
in O O
the O O
multiplex O O
procedure O O
is O O
the O O
reading O O
of O O
sequence O O
films O O
. O O

In O O
previous O O
large O O
- O O
scale O O
sequencing O O
projects O O
this O O
task O O
has O O
been O O
performed O O
with O O
the O O
aid O O
of O O
a O O
sonic O O
digitizer O O
( O O
13 O O
, O O
14 O O
) O O
. O O

Although O O
film O O
reading O O
programs O O
have O O
been O O
under O O
development O O
for O O
some O O
time O O
( O O
15 O O
) O O
, O O
and O O
some O O
programs O O
are O O
commercially O O
available O O
, O O
their O O
error O O
rates O O
are O O
presently O O
more O O
variable O O
and O O
unpredictable O O
than O O
that O O
of O O
a O O
skilled O O
person O O
and O O
the O O
accurate O O
interpretation O O
of O O
film O O
- O O
imaged O O
sequence O O
ladders O O
by O O
computer O O
programs O O
is O O
difficult O O
to O O
achieve O O
in O O
routine O O
practice O O
. O O

Programs O O
specifically O O
designed O O
to O O
read O O
multiplex O O
films O O
have O O
an O O
advantage O O
. O O

This O O
is O O
because O O
a O O
sequence O O
image O O
can O O
be O O
used O O
as O O
an O O
' O O
internal O O
standard O O
' O O
to O O
help O O
interpret O O
other O O
images O O
derived O O
from O O
the O O
same O O
membrane O O
( O O
3 O O
) O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
the O O
original O O
implementation O O
of O O
the O O
multiplex O O
strategy O O
used O O
chemical O O
sequencing O O
( O O
16 O O
) O O
, O O
which O O
yields O O
a O O
more O O
complex O O
sequence O O
ladder O O
than O O
the O O
enzymatic O O
dideoxynucleotide O O
chain O O
- O O
termination O O
method O O
( O O
17 O O
) O O
. O O

Most O O
successful O O
large O O
scale O O
sequencing O O
projects O O
have O O
used O O
the O O
chaintermination O O
method O O
and O O
bacteriophage B B_BIO/B_DISEASE
M13 I I_BIO/I_DISEASE
vectors O O
, O O
which O O
allows O O
the O O
routine O O
production O O
of O O
clean O O
and O O
easily O O
interpretable O O
sequences O O
( O O
18 O O
) O O
. O O

It O O
was O O
therefore O O
decided O O
to O O
adapt O O
the O O
original O O
multiplex O O
protocol O O
for O O
use O O
with O O
enzymatic O O
sequencing O O
, O O
using O O
tagged O O
primers O O
. O O

MATERIALS O O
AND O O
METHODS O O

Eight O O
oligonucleotide O O
sequencing O O
primers O O
were O O
synthesized O O
, O O
each O O
37 O O
nucleotides O O
in O O
length O O
. O O

The O O
3 O O
' O O
end O O
of O O
each O O
primer O O
consists O O
of O O
the O O
17 O O
nucleotide O O
M13 O O
universal O O
priming O O
sequence O O
[ O O
GTAAAACGACGGCCAGT3 O O
' O O
] O O
. O O

The O O
5 O O
' O O
ends O O
of O O
the O O
primers O O
bear O O
different O O
20mer O O
tag O O
sequences O O
( O O
Figure O O
1 O O
) O O
. O O

In O O
four O O
of O O
the O O
primers O O
, O O
UEO1C O O
, O O
UPOIC O O
, O O
UE02C O O
and O O
UP02C O O
, O O
these O O
tags O O
are O O
complementary O O
to O O
the O O
EO1 O O
, O O
PO1 O O
, O O
E02 O O
and O O
P02 O O
probe O O
sequences O O
respectively O O
( O O
copied O O
from O O
the O O
original O O
' O O

' O O
vectors O O
( O O
3 O O
) O O
) O O
. O O

A O O
second O O
set O O
of O O
four O O
primers O O
, O O
UJOL14C O O
, O O
UJOL15C O O
, O O
UJOL16C O O
and O O
UJOL17C O O
, O O
have O O
the O O
following O O
tag O O
sequences O O
: O O
5 O O
' O O
CAAGTTTGAAGGTACTCATT O O
, O O
TATCAATTAAATTGTllTGAC O O
, O O
GTGTTGCTACCCAAGAAGCA O O
, O O
and O O
TGTCACTAGAGCTGTCACTT O O
, O O
respectively O O
. O O

The O O

oligonucleotides O O
were O O

- O O

( O O

) O O
and O O
used O O
to O O

templates O O

or O O

) O O
. O O

Conventional O O
sequencing O O
reactions O O
were O O
performed O O
as O O
previously O O
described O O
( O O
20 O O
) O O
. O O

were O O

as O O

of O O

in O O

. O O

Apart O O

the O O

( O O

) O O
. O O

Sequencing O O
reactions O O
were O O
pooled O O
and O O
ethanol O O
precipitated O O
as O O
appropriate O O
. O O

Precipitation O O
in O O
microtitre O O
trays O O
was O O
carried O O
out O O
as O O
follows O O
: O O
a O O

of O O
3 O O
. O O

3M O O

pH O O
5 O O
. O O

overlaid O O

dimensional O O
optical O O
density O O
profiles O O
for O O
a O O
single O O
clone O O
shown O O
in O O
two O O
overlapping O O
sections O O
. O O

The O O
optical O O
density O O
profiles O O
are O O
unprocessed O O
, O O
except O O
for O O
a O O
simple O O
transform O O
to O O
correct O O
for O O
the O O
relative O O
displacement O O
( O O
translation O O
and O O
rotation O O
) O O
of O O
the O O
four O O
images O O
from O O
which O O
they O O
are O O
extracted O O
. O O

The O O
profiles O O
read O O
5 O O
' O O
to O O
3 O O
' O O
from O O
right O O
to O O
left O O
. O O

Nucleotides O O
positions O O
66 O O
to O O
214 O O
from O O
the O O

of O O
the O O

. O O

specific O O
reactions O O

. O O

Four O O
separate O O
base O O
- O O
specific O O
reactions O O
imaged O O
from O O
a O O
single O O
lane O O
using O O

detection O O
. O O

Nucleotide O O
positions O O
shown O O
on O O
the O O
figure O O
are O O
numbered O O
from O O
the O O
start O O
of O O
the O O
universal O O
priming O O
site O O
. O O

The O O
clones O O
were O O
sequenced O O
using O O
UEOlC O O
, O O
UPOIC O O
, O O
UE02C O O
, O O
and O O
UP02C O O
for O O
the O O
T O O
, O O
C O O
, O O
G O O
and O O
A O O
specific O O
reactions O O
respectively O O
. O O

The O O
blot O O
was O O
probed O O
with O O
corresponding O O
DIG O O
- O O
11 O O
- O O
dUTP O O
labelled O O
oligonucleotides O O
. O O

radioactivity O O
on O O
the O O
scale O O
envisioned O O
for O O
a O O
large O O
sequencing O O
project O O
is O O
undesirable O O
for O O
reasons O O
of O O
safety O O
. O O

The O O
relatively O O
long O O
exposure O O
times O O
required O O
( O O
6 O O
to O O
24 O O
hours O O
) O O
and O O
the O O
short O O
half O O
lives O O
of O O
the O O
probes O O
might O O
also O O
be O O
inconvenient O O
. O O

It O O
has O O
been O O
shown O O
that O O
a O O
biotin O O
/ O O
streptavidin O O
/ O O
alkaline O O
phosphatase O O
based O O
detection O O
system O O
used O O
in O O
conjunction O O
with O O
a O O
chemiluminescent O O
dioxetane O O
substrate O O
overcomes O O
these O O
disadvantages O O
( O O
24 O O
, O O
25 O O
, O O
26 O O
) O O
. O O

We O O
utilized O O
a O O
different O O
bridging O O
system O O
with O O
similar O O
results O O
. O O

Digoxigenin O O
( O O
DIG O O
) O O
labelled O O
oligonucleotide O O
probes O O
were O O
detected O O
using O O
anti O O
- O O
DIG O O
antibody O O
- O O
alkaline O O
phosphatase O O
conjugates O O
and O O
a O O
chemiluminescent O O
dioxetane O O
substrate O O
. O O

Exposure O O
times O O
of O O
10 O O
to O O
15 O O
minutes O O
were O O
typically O O
required O O
, O O
following O O
a O O
one O O
hour O O
preincubation O O
period O O
( O O
Figure O O
3 O O
) O O
. O O

In O O
our O O
hands O O
the O O
DIG O O
bridging O O
system O O
was O O
similar O O
in O O
sensitivity O O
to O O
the O O
streptavidin O O
based O O
system O O
( O O
24 O O
) O O
, O O
and O O
the O O
practical O O
lower O O
limit O O
of O O
template O O
ssDNA O O
required O O
in O O
order O O
to O O
obtain O O
an O O
easily O O
interpretable O O
sequencing O O
ladder O O
was O O
estimated O O
to O O
be O O
in O O
the O O
range O O
of O O
20 O O
to O O
50fmols O O
per O O
reaction O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
the O O
sensitivity O O
of O O
detection O O
was O O
limited O O
only O O
by O O
enzymaticallytriggered O O
background O O
luminescence O O
, O O
and O O
not O O
by O O
the O O
level O O
of O O
signal O O
obtained O O
. O O

The O O
nonradioactive O O
methods O O
described O O
have O O
been O O
used O O
successfully O O
in O O
an O O
8 O O
- O O
plex O O
system O O
. O O

DISCUSSION O O

Although O O
the O O
original O O
multiplex O O
protocol O O
was O O
based O O
on O O
a O O
set O O
of O O
tagged O O
vectors O O
( O O
3 O O
) O O
, O O
tagged O O
primers O O
have O O
also O O
been O O
used O O
or O O
proposed O O
for O O
various O O
forms O O
of O O
multiplex O O
DNA O O
sequencing O O
( O O
George O O
Church O O
, O O
personal O O
communication O O
; O O
2 O O
, O O
27 O O
) O O
. O O

For O O
example O O
, O O
a O O
proposal O O
was O O
recently O O
put O O
forward O O
for O O
multiplex O O
sequencing O O
using O O
sequence O O
- O O
labelled O O
primers O O
and O O
fluorophor O O
- O O
labelled O O
probes O O

( O O
1 O O
) O O
, O O
similar O O
in O O
principle O O
to O O
the O O
methods O O
used O O
here O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
we O O
use O O
tagged O O
primers O O
and O O
the O O
superposition O O
of O O
the O O
four O O
sequencing O O
reactions O O
to O O
address O O
the O O
problem O O
of O O
reading O O
DNA O O
sequence O O
films O O
; O O
a O O
part O O
of O O
this O O
solution O O
is O O
to O O
utilize O O
M13 O O
dideoxynucleotide O O
sequencing O O
, O O
thereby O O
improving O O
the O O
quality O O
of O O
the O O
data O O
to O O
be O O
analyzed O O
. O O

In O O
addition O O
, O O
the O O
proposal O O
for O O
fluorophor O O
- O O
labelled O O
probes O O
does O O
not O O
take O O
into O O
consideration O O
any O O
of O O
the O O
practical O O
sequencing O O
problems O O
addressed O O
here O O
, O O
and O O
, O O
in O O
the O O
version O O
described O O
, O O
remains O O
a O O
promising O O
but O O
unproven O O
scheme O O
for O O
large O O
scale O O
DNA O O
sequencing O O
. O O

There O O
are O O
several O O
advantages O O
to O O
tagging O O
primers O O
instead O O
of O O
vectors O O
. O O

Firstly O O
, O O
there O O
is O O
no O O
need O O
to O O
prepare O O
multiple O O
libraries O O
of O O
clones O O
in O O
special O O
vectors O O
. O O

This O O
means O O
that O O
workers O O
can O O
use O O
vector O O
/ O O
host O O
combinations O O
that O O
yield O O
good O O
results O O
in O O
their O O
hands O O
, O O
and O O
an O O
increased O O
depth O O
of O O
multiplexing O O
can O O
easily O O
be O O
accomodated O O
by O O
synthesizing O O
more O O
primers O O
. O O

This O O
should O O
make O O
multiplexing O O
more O O
accessible O O
to O O
workers O O
undertaking O O
smaller O O
projects O O
. O O

A O O
theoretical O O
disadvantage O O
of O O
tagged O O
primers O O
is O O
that O O
the O O
procedure O O
can O O
only O O
be O O
multiplexed O O
following O O
primer O O
annealing O O
( O O
1 O O
) O O
, O O
or O O
following O O
the O O
sequencing O O
reactions O O
( O O
this O O
paper O O
; O O
in O O
practice O O
, O O
pooling O O
immediately O O
after O O
the O O
annealing O O
step O O
might O O
lead O O
to O O
increased O O
backgrounds O O
if O O
one O O
or O O
more O O
primers O O
were O O
present O O
in O O
excess O O
over O O
their O O
template O O
DNAs O O
) O O
. O O

This O O
is O O
a O O
relatively O O
late O O
stage O O
. O O

In O O
the O O
original O O
procedure O O
( O O
3 O O
) O O
, O O
clones O O
were O O
pooled O O
prior O O
to O O
amplification O O
by O O
growth O O
, O O
an O O
early O O
step O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
we O O
do O O
not O O
believe O O
the O O
sacrifice O O
to O O
be O O
of O O
practical O O
importance O O
when O O
using O O
phage O O
vectors O O
. O O

In O O
our O O
experience O O
, O O
recombinant O O
M13 O O
phage O O
have O O
variable O O
growth O O
rates O O
and O O
the O O
effects O O
of O O
competition O O
are O O
likely O O
to O O
severely O O
limit O O
the O O
number O O
of O O
clones O O
that O O
can O O
usefully O O
be O O
pooled O O
for O O
growth O O
. O O

In O O
contrast O O
, O O
by O O
growing O O
clones O O
individually O O
, O O
the O O
depth O O
of O O
multiplexing O O
is O O
only O O
really O O
limited O O
by O O
probe O O
sensitivity O O
. O O

We O O
have O O
not O O
investigated O O
the O O
factors O O
influencing O O
variability O O
in O O
phage O O
growth O O
rates O O
. O O

It O O
is O O
worth O O
noting O O
that O O
reliable O O
protocols O O
have O O
been O O
developed O O
for O O
growing O O
large O O
numbers O O
of O O
individual O O
M13 O O
clones O O
and O O
preparing O O
high O O
quality O O
ssDNA O O
templates O O
in O O
microtitre O O
trays O O
( O O
28 O O
, O O
21 O O
) O O
. O O

It O O
is O O
relatively O O
simple O O
to O O
prepare O O
manually O O
two O O
microtitre O O
trays O O
of O O
ssDNA O O
templates O O
( O O
192 O O
clones O O
) O O
in O O
a O O
day O O
. O O

Sufficient O O
clones O O
can O O
be O O
prepared O O
in O O
a O O
week O O
to O O
sequence O O
a O O
20kb O O
fragment O O
to O O
a O O
redundancy O O
of O O
10 O O
( O O
Victoria O O
Smith O O
, O O
personal O O
communication O O
) O O
. O O

In O O
this O O
laboratory O O
, O O
ssDNA O O
is O O
now O O
prepared O O
with O O
the O O
aid O O
of O O
a O O
commercially O O
available O O
robotic O O
workstation O O
( O O
21 O O
) O O
. O O

As O O
sequencing O O
reactions O O
are O O
also O O
carried O O
out O O
in O O
microtitre O O
trays O O
, O O
manually O O
or O O
robotically O O
( O O
20 O O
, O O
29 O O
) O O
, O O
the O O
entire O O
M13 O O
- O O
based O O
dideoxynucleotide O O
sequencing O O
procedure O O
is O O
amenable O O
to O O
automation O O
( O O
29 O O
) O O
. O O

For O O
these O O
reasons O O
we O O
see O O
little O O
practical O O
advantage O O
in O O
pooling O O
clones O O
early O O
. O O

Finally O O
, O O
by O O
not O O
pooling O O
clones O O
early O O
, O O
the O O
ability O O
to O O
easily O O
retrieve O O
individual O O
clones O O
is O O
retained O O
, O O
which O O
may O O
facilitate O O
directed O O
sequencing O O
later O O
in O O
a O O
project O O
should O O
this O O
become O O
necessary O O
. O O

Multiplex O O
DNA O O
sequencing O O
is O O
currently O O
limited O O
by O O
the O O
lack O O
of O O
a O O
robust O O
computer O O
program O O
which O O
can O O
correct O O
for O O
the O O
large O O
variety O O
of O O
gel O O
and O O
sequencing O O
artefacts O O
that O O
are O O
normally O O
encountered O O
. O O

The O O
foundation O O
of O O
a O O
film O O
reading O O
program O O
is O O
the O O
ability O O
to O O
bring O O
into O O
register O O
precisely O O
vertical O O
arrays O O
of O O
base O O
- O O
specific O O
bands O O
. O O

This O O
requires O O
the O O
ability O O
to O O
track O O
lanes O O
, O O
correct O O
for O O
distortions O O
, O O
and O O
order O O
bands O O
based O O
on O O
their O O
relative O O
spacing O O
. O O

A O O
method O O
of O O
sequencing O O
which O O
has O O
successfully O O
overcome O O
the O O
problem O O
of O O
sequence O O
reading O O
uses O O
real O O
- O O
time O O
detection O O
of O O
fluorescently O O
labelled O O
DNA O O
samples O O
migrating O O
through O O
the O O
gel O O
( O O
2 O O
) O O
. O O

This O O
system O O
also O O
utilizes O O
the O O
principle O O
of O O
running O O
the O O
four O O
base O O
reactions O O
down O O
the O O
same O O
lane O O
( O O
2 O O
) O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
bands O O
are O O
detected O O
at O O
a O O
fixed O O
location O O

in O O
space O O
, O O
and O O
their O O
detection O O
is O O
separated O O
in O O
time O O
. O O

Hence O O
the O O

Nucleic O O
Acids O O
Research O O
, O O
Vol O O
. O O

19 O O
, O O
No O O
. O O
12 O O
3305 O O

problem O O
of O O

is O O
essentially O O
avoided O O
, O O
although O O
corrections O O
for O O
the O O
different O O
mobilities O O
of O O
the O O
four O O
dyes O O
must O O
be O O
carried O O
out O O
. O O

In O O
contrast O O
, O O
we O O
utilize O O
the O O
advantages O O
of O O
single O O
lane O O
electrophoresis O O
to O O
address O O
the O O
problem O O
of O O
superimposing O O
four O O
relatively O O
large O O
and O O
complex O O
two O O
- O O
dimensional O O
images O O
. O O

Furthermore O O
, O O
by O O
using O O
sequence O O
- O O
tagged O O
oligonucleotides O O
which O O
are O O
detected O O
by O O
hybridization O O
, O O
a O O
much O O
greater O O
depth O O
of O O
multiplexing O O
can O O
realistically O O
be O O
achieved O O
than O O
by O O
real O O
- O O
time O O
detection O O
. O O

The O O
use O O
of O O
two O O
- O O
dimensional O O
colour O O
traces O O
to O O
depict O O
the O O
processed O O
output O O
of O O
a O O
film O O
reader O O
is O O
consistent O O
with O O
the O O
method O O
of O O
displaying O O
fluorescence O O
traces O O
, O O
and O O
should O O
facilitate O O
the O O
checking O O
and O O
editing O O
of O O
sequence O O
databases O O
in O O
which O O
both O O
kinds O O
of O O
data O O
have O O
been O O
entered O O
. O O

The O O
sequence O O
compilation O O
programs O O
used O O
in O O
this O O
laboratory O O
, O O
which O O
are O O
already O O
capable O O
of O O
handling O O
large O O
shotgun O O
databases O O
( O O
8 O O
, O O
31 O O
) O O
, O O
have O O
recently O O
undergone O O
extensive O O
improvements O O
( O O
Rodger O O
Staden O O
, O O
personal O O
communication O O
) O O
. O O

There O O
is O O
now O O
an O O
interactive O O
database O O
editor O O
which O O
allows O O
the O O
graphical O O
display O O
of O O
fluorescence O O
traces O O
, O O
and O O
it O O
is O O
envisaged O O
that O O
this O O
feature O O
could O O
be O O
extended O O
to O O
allow O O
the O O
handling O O
of O O
data O O
from O O
a O O
film O O
reader O O
when O O
a O O
suitable O O
machine O O
is O O
developed O O
. O O

EMBO O O
Journal O O
, O O
5 O O
, O O
2043 O O
- O O
2049 O O
. O O

Mapping O O
irradiation O O
hybrids O O
to O O
cosmid O O
and O O
yeast B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_GENE
artificial O O
chromosome O O
libraries O O
by O O
direct O O
hybridization O O
of O O
Alu O O
- O O
PCR O O
products O O
. O O

Abstract O O

A O O
direct O O
hybridization O O
protocol O O
is O O
described O O
for O O
screening O O
cosmid O O
and O O
yeast B B_SPECIES[BIO]
artificial O O
chromosome O O
libraries O O
with O O
pools O O
of O O
Alu O O
- O O
PCR O O
products O O
from O O
somatic O O
cell O O
or O O
irradiation O O
hybrids O O
. O O

This O O
method O O
eliminates O O
purification O O
, O O
cloning O O
and O O
analysis O O
of O O
each O O
individual O O
Alu O O
- O O
PCR O O
product O O
before O O
library O O
screening O O
. O O

A O O
series O O
of O O
human B B_NUMBER[MEASURE]/B_SPECIES[BIO]
X O O

ABSTRACT O O

A O O
direct O O
hybridization O O
protocol O O
is O O
described O O
for O O
screening O O
cosmid O O
and O O
yeast B B_SPECIES[BIO]
artificial O O
chromosome O O
libraries O O
with O O
pools O O
of O O
Alu O O
- O O
PCR O O
products O O
from O O
somatic O O
cell O O
or O O
irradiation O O
hybrids O O
. O O

This O O
method O O
eliminates O O
purification O O
, O O
cloning O O
and O O
analysis O O
of O O
each O O
individual O O
AluPCR O O
product O O
before O O
library O O
screening O O
. O O

A O O
series O O
of O O
human B B_NUMBER[MEASURE]/B_SPECIES[BIO]
X O O
chromosome O O
irradiation O O
hybrids O O
were O O
mapped O O
by O O
this O O
method O O
, O O
using O O
a O O
cosmid O O
reference O O
library O O
for O O
comparisons O O
between O O
overlapping O O
hybrids O O
to O O
identify O O
interesting O O
clones O O
for O O
further O O
analysis O O
. O O

INTRODUCTION O O

The O O
generation O O
of O O
human B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_DISEASE_ADJECTIVE[DISEASE]
DNA O O
probes O O
specific O O
for O O
individual O O
chromosomes O O
and O O
subregions O O
of O O
chromosomes O O
has O O
been O O
advanced O O
with O O
Alu O O
- O O
sequence O O
primed O O
polymerase O O
chain O O
reaction O O
amplification O O
( O O
Alu O O
- O O
PCR O O
, O O
1 O O
- O O
3 O O
) O O
. O O

This O O
method O O
specifically O O
amplifies O O
sequences O O
between O O
Alu O O
repeats O O
from O O
human B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_CELL_COMPONENT[BODY_PART_OR_ORGAN_COMPONENT]
DNA O O
in O O
somatic O O
cell O O
hybrids O O
and O O
yeast B B_SPECIES[BIO]
artificial O O
chromosomes O O
( O O
YACs O O
, O O
4 O O
) O O
. O O

Individual O O
Alu O O
- O O
PCR O O
products O O
can O O
be O O
purified O O
from O O
agarose O O
gels O O
or O O
ligated O O
into O O
plasmid O O
vectors O O
to O O
screen O O
for O O
single O O
copy O O
sequences O O
. O O

Unique O O
Alu O O
- O O
PCR O O
products O O
are O O
then O O
localized O O
to O O
certain O O
chromosome O O
regions O O
using O O
DNA O O
blots O O
of O O
somatic O O
cell O O
hybrid O O
panels O O
. O O

Once O O
localized O O
, O O
Alu O O
- O O
PCR O O
fragments O O
can O O
be O O
screened O O
against O O
genomic O O
libraries O O
to O O
isolate O O
longer O O
DNA O O
fragments O O
from O O
the O O
region O O
of O O
interest O O
. O O

As O O
an O O
alternative O O
to O O
this O O
multistep O O
process O O
we O O
have O O
developed O O
a O O
hybridization O O
protocol O O
for O O
screening O O
of O O
cosmid O O
and O O
YAC O O
libraries O O
directly O O
with O O
pools O O
of O O
Alu O O
- O O
PCR O O
products O O
. O O

Two O O
new O O
human B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_GENE
specific O O
Alu O O
primers O O
were O O
used O O
to O O
generate O O
DNA O O
probes O O
from O O
a O O
series O O
of O O
irradiation O O
- O O
reduced O O
hybrids O O
containing O O
multiple O O
human B B_SPECIES[BIO]
X O O
chromosome O O
fragments O O
of O O
1 O O
- O O
2000 O O
kb O O
on O O
a O O
hamster O O
chromosome O O
background O O
( O O
5 O O
; O O
P O O
. O O
N O O
. O O
G O O
. O O
, O O
unpublished O O
) O O
. O O

The O O
Alu O O
- O O
PCR O O
products O O
were O O
hybridized O O
as O O
a O O
pool O O
of O O
probes O O
to O O
X O O
- O O
specific O O
cosmid O O
and O O
YAC O O
libraries O O
, O O
after O O

competitive O O
reassociation O O
with O O
an O O
excess O O
of O O
human B B_PERSON/B_SPECIES[BIO]
DNA O O
to O O
both O O
the O O
library O O
filters O O
and O O
radioactively O O
labelled O O
Alu O O
- O O
PCR O O
products O O
. O O

Comparisons O O
were O O
made O O
between O O
clones O O
identified O O
by O O
overlapping O O
irradiation O O
hybrids O O
and O O
single O O
copy O O
DNA O O
probes O O
hybridized O O
to O O
the O O
cosmid O O
and O O
YAC O O
libraries O O
. O O

DISCUSSION O O

The O O
direct O O
hybridization O O
of O O
Alu O O
- O O

can O O

of O O
fragments O O
into O O

and O O

of O O
Alu O O
- O O
PCR O O
products O O
as O O

a O O

to O O

to O O

. O O

The O O

of O O

- O O

on O O
a O O

or O O
greater O O
rodent O O
background O O
) O O
or O O
flow O O
- O O
sorted O O
chromosomes O O
, O O
because O O
of O O
the O O
low O O

efficiency O O
of O O
yeast B B_BIO/B_CELL[BODY_PART_OR_ORGAN_COMPONENT]
. O O

The O O

Abstract O O

Many O O
species O O
have O O
been O O
shown O O
to O O
contain O O
tandemly O O
repeated O O
short O O
sequence O O
DNA O O
known O O
as O O
minisatellites O O
and O O
simple O O
sequence O O
motifs O O
. O O

Due O O
to O O
allelic O O
variation O O
in O O
the O O
copy O O
number O O
of O O
the O O
repeat O O
unit O O
these O O
loci O O
are O O
usually O O
highly O O
polymorphic O O
. O O

Here O O
we O O
demonstrate O O
the O O
presence O O
of O O
sequences O O
in O O
the O O
genome O O
of O O
the O O
nematode O O
Caenorhabditis B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_GENE
elegans I I_SPECIES[BIO]/I_GENE
which O O
are O O
homologous O O
to O O
two O O
sets O O
of O O
short O O
sequence O O
DNA O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
when O O
two O O
independent O O
strains O O
were O O
compared O O
no O O
polymorphism O O
for O O
these O O
sequences O O
could O O
be O O
detected O O

17 O O

ABSTRACT O O

Many O O
species O O
have O O
been O O
shown O O
to O O
contain O O
tandemly O O
repeated O O
short O O
sequence O O
DNA O O
kinown O O
as O O
minisatellites O O
and O O
simple O O
sequence O O
motifs O O
. O O

Due O O
to O O
allelic O O
variation O O
in O O
the O O
copy O O
number O O
of O O
the O O
repeat O O
unit O O
these O O
loci O O
are O O
usually O O
highly O O
polymorphic O O
. O O

Here O O
we O O
demonstrate O O
the O O
presence O O
of O O
sequences O O
in O O
the O O
genome O O
of O O
the O O
nematode O O
Caenorhabditis B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_GENE
elegans I I_SPECIES[BIO]/I_GENE
which O O
are O O
homologous O O
to O O
two O O
sets O O
of O O
short O O
sequence O O
DNA O O
. O O

However O O
, O O
when O O
two O O
independent O O
strains O O
were O O
compared O O
no O O
polymorphism O O
for O O
these O O
sequences O O
could O O
be O O
detected O O
. O O

INTRODUCTION O O

The O O
genome O O
of O O
many O O
species O O
, O O
including O O
lower O O
organisms O O
, O O
contain O O
minisatellite O O
sequences O O
and O O
so O O
- O O
called O O
simple O O
sequence O O
motifs O O
( O O
1 O O
, O O
2 O O
, O O
3 O O
) O O
. O O

Due O O
to O O
extensive O O
variation O O
in O O
the O O
number O O
of O O
repeat O O
units O O
, O O
many O O
of O O
these O O
loci O O
have O O
been O O
shown O O
useful O O
as O O
polymorphic O O
markers O O
, O O
e O O
. O O
g O O
. O O
for O O
genetic O O
linkage O O
studies O O
and O O
identification O O
purposes O O
. O O

Here O O
we O O
demonstrate O O
that O O
the O O
genome O O
of O O
the O O
nematode O O
Caenorhabditis B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_BODY_PART_OR_ORGAN_COMPONENT
elegans I I_SPECIES[BIO]/I_BODY_PART_OR_ORGAN_COMPONENT
contains O O
sequences O O
that O O
are O O
homologous O O
to O O
the O O
minisatellite O O
core O O
sequence O O
33 O O
. O O
6 O O
( O O
1 O O
) O O
and O O
to O O
the O O
simple O O
sequence O O
motif O O
( O O
AGC O O
) O O
n O O
. O O

Surprisingly O O
, O O
these O O
sequences O O
did O O
not O O
display O O
polymorphism O O
when O O
two O O
independent O O
C B B_SPECIES[BIO]/B_LOCATION
. I I_SPECIES[BIO]/I_LOCATION
elegans I I_SPECIES[BIO]/I_LOCATION
strains O O
, O O
Bristol O O
and O O
Bergerac O O
, O O
were O O
compared O O
. O O

MATERIALS O O
AND O O
METHODS O O
Genomic O O
DNA O O
from O O
nematodes O O

Genomic O O
DNA O O
was O O
isolated O O
according O O
to O O
standard O O
procedures O O
from O O
the O O
two O O
strains O O
Bergerac O O
( O O
BO O O
) O O
and O O
Bristol O O
( O O
strain O O
N2 O O
) O O
. O O

These O O
strains O O
are O O
derived O O
from O O
two O O
different O O
individual O O
worms O O
isolated O O
in O O
France O O
and O O
England O O
, O O
respectively O O
. O O

Southern O O
blotting O O

Genomic O O
DNA O O
digests O O
( O O
5 O O
Ag O O
) O O
were O O
separated O O
in O O
a O O
1 O O
% O O
agarose O O
gel O O
in O O
1 O O
x O O
TAE O O
( O O
40 O O
mM O O
Tris O O
. O O
HCl O O
, O O
pH O O
7 O O
. O O
4 O O
/ O O
20 O O
mM O O
sodium O O
acetate O O
/ O O
I O O
mM O O
NaEDTA O O
) O O
by O O
electrophoresis O O
at O O
75 O O
V O O
for O O
16 O O
h O O
. O O

Separation O O
patterns O O
were O O
transferred O O
to O O
Zetaprobe O O
membrane O O
( O O
BIORAD O O
) O O
in O O
0 O O
. O O
4 O O
N O O
NaOH O O
, O O
0 O O
. O O
6 O O
M O O
NaCl O O
in O O
a O O
vacu O O
- O O
blot O O
apparatus O O
( O O
LKB O O
) O O
according O O
to O O
the O O
manufacturer O O
' O O
s O O
instructions O O
. O O

The O O
minisatellite O O
and O O
simple O O
sequence O O
probes O O
used O O
were O O
prepared O O
essentially O O
as O O
described O O
( O O
5 O O
) O O
. O O

The O O
Tcl O O
probe O O
is O O
a O O
plasmid O O
containing O O
an O O
insert O O
of O O
the O O
transposable O O
element O O
Tcl O O
( O O
4 O O
) O O
. O O

All O O
probes O O
were O O
labelled O O
by O O
random O O
- O O
priming O O
. O O

Hybridization O O
was O O
performed O O
for O O
12 O O
h O O
in O O
7 O O
% O O
SDS O O
, O O
0 O O
. O O
5 O O
M O O
phosphate O O
buffer O O
, O O
1 O O
mM O O
Na2EDTA O O
at O O
650C O O
. O O

Blots O O
were O O
washed O O
twice O O
in O O
2 O O
. O O
5 O O
x O O
SSC O O
at O O
650C O O
and O O
exposed O O
to O O
Kodak O O
XAR O O
- O O
5 O O
film O O
with O O
intensifying O O
screens O O
. O O

Exposure O O
times O O

. O O

How O O
can O O
Health O O
Behavior O O
Theory O O
be O O
made O O
more O O
useful O O
for O O
intervention O O
research O O
? O O

Abstract O O

Background O O

The O O
present O O
paper O O
expresses O O
the O O
author O O
' O O
s O O
views O O
about O O
the O O
practical O O
utility O O
of O O
Health O O
Behavior O O
Theory O O
for O O
health O O
behavior O O
intervention O O
research O O
. O O

The O O
views O O
are O O
skeptical O O
and O O
perhaps O O
even O O
a O O
bit O O
exaggerated O O
. O O

They O O
are O O
, O O
however O O
, O O
also O O
based O O
on O O
20 O O
- O O
plus O O
years O O
of O O
in O O
- O O
the O O
- O O
trenches O O
research O O
focused O O
on O O
improving O O
health O O
behavior O O
practice O O
through O O
research O O
. O O

Discussion O O

The O O
author O O
' O O
s O O
research O O
has O O
been O O
theoretically O O
driven O O
and O O
has O O
involved O O
measurement O O
of O O
varying O O
variables O O
considered O O
to O O
be O O
important O O
theoretical O O
mediators O O
and O O
moderators O O
of O O
health O O
behavior O O
. O O

Regretfully O O
, O O
much O O
of O O
this O O
work O O
has O O
found O O
these O O
variables O O
wanting O O
in O O
basic O O
scientific O O
merit O O
. O O

Health O O
Behavior O O
Theory O O
as O O
we O O
have O O
known O O
it O O
over O O
the O O
last O O
25 O O
years O O
or O O
so O O
has O O
been O O
dominated O O
by O O
conceptualizations O O
of O O
behavior O O
change O O
processes O O
that O O
highlight O O
cognitive O O
decision O O
- O O
making O O
. O O

Although O O
much O O
of O O
health O O
behavior O O
practice O O
targets O O
what O O
people B B_PERSON
do O O
rather O O
than O O
what O O
they O O
think O O
, O O
the O O
logic O O
of O O
focusing O O
on O O
thoughts O O
is O O
that O O
what O O
people B B_PERSON
think O O
about O O
is O O
the O O
key O O
to O O
what O O
they O O
will O O
do O O
in O O
the O O
future O O
, O O
and O O
that O O
interventions O O
that O O
can O O
measure O O
and O O
harness O O
those O O
processes O O
will O O
succeed O O
to O O
a O O
greater O O
extent O O
than O O
those O O
that O O
do O O
not O O
. O O

Unfortunately O O
, O O
in O O
the O O
author O O
' O O
s O O
experience O O
, O O
the O O
premise O O
of O O
cognitive O O
theories O O
has O O
fallen O O
short O O
empirically O O
in O O
a O O
number O O
of O O
ways O O
. O O

The O O
cognitive O O
schemata O O
favored O O
by O O
most O O
health O O
behavior O O
theories O O
are O O
difficult O O
to O O
measure O O
, O O
they O O
do O O
not O O
predict O O
behavioral O O
outcomes O O
very O O

they O O
cause O O
behavior O O
, O O
and O O
they O O
are O O
hard O O
to O O
change O O
directly O O
. O O

Summary O O

It O O
is O O
suggested O O
that O O
health O O
behavior O O
researchers O O
reconsider O O
their O O
use O O
of O O
these O O
theories O O
in O O
favor O O
of O O
models O O
whose O O
variables O O
are O O
more O O
accessible O O
to O O
observation O O
and O O
experimental O O
manipulation O O
and O O
that O O
most O O
importantly O O
have O O
strong O O
empirical O O
support O O
. O O

Background O O

The O O
author O O
has O O
been O O
conducting O O
research O O
on O O
behavioral O O
treatment O O
of O O
obesity O O
for O O
about O O
25 O O
years O O
. O O

During O O
that O O
time O O
, O O
the O O
dominant O O
conceptual O O
models O O
guiding O O
intervention O O
development O O
have O O
been O O
cognitive O O
behavior O O
models O O
that O O
have O O
their O O
origin O O
in O O
psychological O O
theory O O
. O O

Those O O
most O O
often O O
cited O O
